original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya sandhi gambh'i ra ni rmo tsa s'u tra t'i k'a /
analyzed: a'arya sandhi gambh'i ra ni rmo tsa s'u tra t'i k'a /
translated: Āryagambhīrārthasandhinirmocanasūtraṭīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Profound Explanation of the Intention Sūtra

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Part One

original: gsung gi mnga' bdag 'phags pa byams pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsung gi mnga' bdag 'phags pa byams pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of Speech, the noble Maitreya, and to Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: gang gis mdo sde 'di 'chad par 'dod pas sgo rnam pa bzhir phye nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis mdo sde 'di 'chad par 'dod pas sgo rnam pa bzhir phye nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to explain this sūtra should teach it by opening it up in four ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dang mdo sde'i mtshan rnam par bshad pa bstan pa dang / mdo sde'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhung yang dag par bstan pa dang / gnas dang gang gi ched du gsungs pa bstan pa dang / tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dang mdo sde'i mtshan rnam par bshad pa bstan pa dang / mdo sde'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhung yang dag par bstan pa dang / gnas dang gang gi ched du gsungs pa bstan pa dang / tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the intention of the teachings and the explanation of the names of the sūtras, the explanation of the essence of the sūtra and the correct explanation of the text, the explanation of the basis and the purpose for which it was taught, and the explanation of the analysis of the meaning of the words.

original: de la dang po mdo sde gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dang / mdo sde'i mtshan rnam par bshad pa bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dang po mdo sde gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dang / mdo sde'i mtshan rnam par bshad pa bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first of these is the intention of the sūtras and the explanation of the names of the sūtras.

original: yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shin tu zab cing gzugs kyi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs las yongs su 'das kyang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shin tu zab cing gzugs kyi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs las yongs su 'das kyang /
translated: The perfect nature is extremely profound and transcends the various appearances of physical things.

original: gzugs kyi dngos por snang la yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsung @2a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dngos por snang la yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsung @2a * //
translated: It is the perfect speech that appears as physical things.

original: gsang ba skye dgu'i rjes su gsung bar mdzad kyang gsung ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: gsang ba skye dgu'i rjes su gsung bar mdzad kyang gsung ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: Although it speaks in accord with the speech of all beings, it is not speech.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is meant by the following:

original: gsung par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: gsung par mdzad kyang /
translated: Although it speaks,

original: tshig las rab tu dben zhing gzugs ma yin pa yang gzugs su ston te /
analyzed: tshig las rab tu dben zhing gzugs ma yin pa yang gzugs su ston te /
translated: it is completely divorced from words. It shows that which is not form as form.

original: gzugs ma yin par yang gzugs su ston pa'i tshul ni rab tu zhi ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin par yang gzugs su ston pa'i tshul ni rab tu zhi ba yin mod kyi /
translated: The way it shows that which is not form as form is indeed peace.

original: tshig tu brjod pa yang yod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa yang yod do zhes ston to //
translated: However, it is taught that there is also a way of speaking in words.

original: tshig tu brjod kyang tshig las rab tu dben la /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod kyang tshig las rab tu dben la /
translated: Although it speaks in words, it is completely divorced from words.

original: bstan pa rgya cher gsungs kyang tshig med de /
analyzed: bstan pa rgya cher gsungs kyang tshig med de /
translated: Although it teaches extensively, it is not words.

original: tshig med pa'i phyir dri ma med par grags pa'i gnas su cang mi smra bar gyur pa dang / gzhal med khang yongs su dag par ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par phye ba yin te /
analyzed: tshig med pa'i phyir dri ma med par grags pa'i gnas su cang mi smra bar gyur pa dang / gzhal med khang yongs su dag par ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par phye ba yin te /
translated: Because of the absence of words, there is silence in the abode of the pure one, and the three natures are distinguished in the pure palace.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa byams pa las don dam pa dang / kun rdzob gnyi ga yod par rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa byams pa las don dam pa dang / kun rdzob gnyi ga yod par rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Maitreya, both the ultimate and the conventional are established as existent.

original: skyes bu chen po klu sgrub kyis ni stong pa dang / yod pa gnyis ka yang yongs su gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po klu sgrub kyis ni stong pa dang / yod pa gnyis ka yang yongs su gsal ba yin no //
translated: And the great man Nagarjuna makes both emptiness and existence quite clear.

original: de la rnam par gzhag pa yang yongs su gsal ba dang mi 'gal bas na rnam par rig pa tsam gyi don shin tu gsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la rnam par gzhag pa yang yongs su gsal ba dang mi 'gal bas na rnam par rig pa tsam gyi don shin tu gsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since there is no contradiction in the establishment of the latter, the meaning of mere representation becomes quite clear.

original: yongs su gsal ba rnam par gzhag pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ni mtshan ma med pa'i tshul rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba rnam par gzhag pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ni mtshan ma med pa'i tshul rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: And because there is no contradiction between the establishment of the former and the latter, the way of signlessness is well taught.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yin la yod pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yin la yod pa yang yin pas /
translated: It is emptiness and it is existence.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi gzhung dang rjes @2b su mthun pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin stong ba yang ma yin pas dbu ma'i lam gyi tshul dang mthun par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi gzhung dang rjes @2b su mthun pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin stong ba yang ma yin pas dbu ma'i lam gyi tshul dang mthun par gyur pa yin te /
translated: It is in accord with the scriptures of the two truths and it is in accord with the way of the middle path, because it is neither existent nor empty.

original: de lta bas na rmongs shing nor ba dag gis stong par bshad pa thos na yod par yang dag par 'dzin la go zhing rtogs pa dag gis ni yod pa nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rmongs shing nor ba dag gis stong par bshad pa thos na yod par yang dag par 'dzin la go zhing rtogs pa dag gis ni yod pa nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, when the ignorant and confused hear that things are empty, they think that they really do exist. But those who understand and realize that things are empty know that existence is emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu zab pa'i tshul de lta yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'dren pa'i thabs dang 'jug pa'i tshul mang zhing gcig kho na nyid du ma zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu zab pa'i tshul de lta yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'dren pa'i thabs dang 'jug pa'i tshul mang zhing gcig kho na nyid du ma zad pa'i phyir /
translated: Although the way of the profound Buddha Dharma is like this, nevertheless, because there are many methods of guidance and ways of entry and it is not just one thing,

original: chos kyi mnga' bdag gis chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi mnga' bdag gis chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the Lord of the Dharma taught the three turnings of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de la dang po ni gang nyan thos kyi theg pa la gzhol ba dag la 'khor mor 'jig ri dvags rgyu ba'i tshal du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gang nyan thos kyi theg pa la gzhol ba dag la 'khor mor 'jig ri dvags rgyu ba'i tshal du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su bstan te /
translated: The first is the wheel of the four noble truths, which was turned for those who were devoted to the disciples' vehicle, in the Deer Park at Ṛṣipatana in Vārāṇasī, by teaching the causes and results of cyclic existence and nirvāṇa.

original: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //🔽gnyis pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gzhol ba dag la /
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o // gnyis pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gzhol ba dag la /
translated: This is called the wheel of the doctrine of the four truths.

original: bya rgod phung po'i ri la sogs pa 'dus pa bcu drug dag tu 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ri la sogs pa 'dus pa bcu drug dag tu 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The second is the wheel of signlessness, which was turned for those who were devoted to the bodhisattva vehicle, in the sixteen assemblies at Vulture Flock Mountain and other places, by teaching the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the wheel of the doctrine of signlessness.

original: gsum pa ni gang theg pa thams cad la gzhol ba dag la padma'i snying po la sogs pa zhing yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa rnams su 'phags pa dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni nges pa'i don theg pa chen po'i chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang theg pa thams cad la gzhol ba dag la padma'i snying po la sogs pa zhing yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa rnams su 'phags pa dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni nges pa'i don theg pa chen po'i chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
translated: The third is the wheel of the doctrine of the definitive meaning of the Mahayana, which is the teaching of the noble Unraveling the Intention in pure lands such as the heart of a lotus and in impure lands.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning of the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gcig gi spyi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gcig gi spyi'i ming ngo //
translated: The Unraveling the Intention Sūtra is the general name of one sūtra.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u ste dang po'o zhes bya ba ni le'u nyid kyi nang na tha dad pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u ste dang po'o zhes bya ba ni le'u nyid kyi nang na tha dad pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The first chapter is the name of the chapter itself.

original: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i tshul du gsungs so //
analyzed: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i tshul du gsungs so //
translated: Intention means that it was taught in a hidden manner.

original: zab mo zhes bya ba ni shin tu zab pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba ni shin tu zab pa'o //
translated: Profound means very profound.

original: nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: Unraveling means explaining.

original: theg pa gsum po thams cad kyis shin tu zab cing mkhyud pa'i dgongs pa rnam par dgrol bar dka' ba'i don mdo sde 'di las rnam par phye ste gsal bar ston par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po thams cad kyis shin tu zab cing mkhyud pa'i dgongs pa rnam par dgrol bar dka' ba'i don mdo sde 'di las rnam par phye ste gsal bar ston par mdzad pas na /
translated: Since this sutra elucidates and reveals the meaning that is extremely profound and difficult to unravel, the thought of all three vehicles,

original: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba zhes bya'o //🔽mdo zhes bya ba ni rgya @3a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba zhes bya'o // mdo zhes bya ba ni rgya @3a * //
translated: it is called the Definitive Explanation of the Profound Thought.

original: gar skad du s'u tra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs nas /🔽mdo dang brtag pa zhes bya bar 'dren te /
analyzed: gar skad du s'u tra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs nas / mdo dang brtag pa zhes bya bar 'dren te /
translated: As for the word sutra, it is derived from the Sanskrit word sutra, which means to pull or to draw.

original: sngon dang da ltar gyi gsung rab kyi don brtag par nges pa'i phyir brtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon dang da ltar gyi gsung rab kyi don brtag par nges pa'i phyir brtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also translated as to investigate, because it investigates the meaning of the scriptures of the past and the present.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na skud pa zhes bya ste de'i phyir 'dul ba dum bu bzhi pa las ji skad skud pas me tog brgyus nas 'thor bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na skud pa zhes bya ste de'i phyir 'dul ba dum bu bzhi pa las ji skad skud pas me tog brgyus nas 'thor bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In another way, it is called thread, and for that reason it says in the Four Part Vinaya: Just as when flowers are strung on a thread, they will not scatter.

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gis ni mthun pa'i mdo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gis ni mthun pa'i mdo zhes bshad de /
translated: The master Xuanzang explains that it is called sutra because it is a sutra that is in accord.

original: de la mthun pa ni mthun par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la mthun pa ni mthun par gyur pa ste /
translated: In that regard, in accord means in accordance with.

original: rig pa dang mthun par gyur pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po dang 'tsham par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang mthun par gyur pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po dang 'tsham par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is in accord with knowledge and in accord with the faculties of sentient beings.

original: mdo zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: mdo zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Sutra is so called for two reasons:

original: brgyus pa dang sdud pa'o //
analyzed: brgyus pa dang sdud pa'o //
translated: it is a string and it is a collection.

original: de la brgyus pa ni bshad par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la brgyus pa ni bshad par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Among them, string refers to the meaning to be explained.

original: sdud pa ni 'dul bar bya ba'i sems can te /
analyzed: sdud pa ni 'dul bar bya ba'i sems can te /
translated: Collection refers to the sentient beings to be disciplined.

original: don rnam pa 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mthun pa'i mdo zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: don rnam pa 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mthun pa'i mdo zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Because it possesses these two meanings, it is explained as a sutra.

original: de la ming 'thob par byed pa ni nges par 'grel pa dang / mdo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis brjod pa dang gsung rab bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ming 'thob par byed pa ni nges par 'grel pa dang / mdo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis brjod pa dang gsung rab bstan pa yin te /
translated: Among them, name is the two words explanation and sutra, which indicate the scriptures.

original: dgongs pa zab mo gsung gis brjod par bya ba'i tshul yongs su ston pas na rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i don gyis mdo sde'i mtshan rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo gsung gis brjod par bya ba'i tshul yongs su ston pas na rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i don gyis mdo sde'i mtshan rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Because it fully reveals the method of expressing the profound intention, it is the expression and the expressed meaning. The name of the sutra is established.

original: 'dis ni dgongs pa zab mos mdo sde rnam par bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dgongs pa zab mos mdo sde rnam par bshad pa bstan to //
translated: This explains the explanation of the sutra with the profound intention.

original: 'di ni rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug las bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug las bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation in terms of the sixfold analysis, in terms of the dominant condition.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u ste dang po'o zhes bya ba la gleng gzhi ni gtan tshigs kyi gleng gzhi ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u ste dang po'o zhes bya ba la gleng gzhi ni gtan tshigs kyi gleng gzhi ste /
translated: The chapter on the introduction, the first. The introduction is the causal introduction,

original: yang dag par bshad par 'byung ba'i gleng gzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bshad par 'byung ba'i gleng gzhi'o //
translated: the introduction that occurs in the explanation.

original: le'u ni phyogs kyi rnam pa 'am /
analyzed: le'u ni phyogs kyi rnam pa 'am /
translated: A chapter is a section or

original: yang na tha dad pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa'i don te /
translated: a distinct topic.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis thos pa la stsogs pa'i don gyi rnam pa mtshungs par gyur pa dang / don bsdus pa so so tha dad pa'i phyir le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis thos pa la stsogs pa'i don gyi rnam pa mtshungs par gyur pa dang / don bsdus pa so so tha dad pa'i phyir le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called a chapter because it has a similar topic, such as “Thus have I heard,” and because it has a distinct collected topic.

original: mdo sde 'di nyid las le'u brgyad 'byung ba'i dang bor le'u 'di 'byung bas na dang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nyid las le'u brgyad 'byung ba'i dang bor le'u 'di 'byung bas na dang po zhes bya ste /
translated: Since this very sutra has eight chapters, this chapter occurs first, and so it is called the first.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo gleng gzhi'i le'u ste dang po'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo gleng gzhi'i le'u ste dang po'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “This is the first chapter on the introduction to the sutra that explains the profound intention.”

original: de la mdo sde'i gzhung dang ngo bo nyid yang dag par bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la mdo sde'i gzhung dang ngo bo nyid yang dag par bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, the scripture of the sutra collection is called the teaching of the essence itself.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni brjod pa dang gsung @3b rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ming bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni brjod pa dang gsung @3b rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ming bstan to //
translated: By the essence itself, the name of the essence of speech and the scriptures is taught.

original: gzhung zhes bya bas ni so so'i bstan pas brjod par bya ba thun mong ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhung zhes bya bas ni so so'i bstan pas brjod par bya ba thun mong ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: By the word scripture, the uncommon subject matter expressed by each teaching is taught.

original: 'phags pas gsungs pa'i gsung rab rnam pa slob dpon hyan tsang gis sgo rnam pa lngas mdo sde ngo bo nyid bstan pas /
analyzed: 'phags pas gsungs pa'i gsung rab rnam pa slob dpon hyan tsang gis sgo rnam pa lngas mdo sde ngo bo nyid bstan pas /
translated: The scriptures spoken by the aryas are taught by the master Hyundzang in five ways.

original: de la dang po ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang dag pa nyid du bsdu ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang dag pa nyid du bsdu ba'i sgo ste /
translated: The first is the gate of collecting the unreal as reality.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnams kyi ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dang sgra skad rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnams kyi ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dang sgra skad rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Thus, the collections of names, words, and letters and the sounds and languages of the aryas' scriptures are the essence of suchness.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la stsogs pa las sems can thams cad de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la stsogs pa las sems can thams cad de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in the sutras taught by the arya Vimalakirti and so on, it says all sentient beings are suchness.

original: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: All phenomena are suchness.

original: gnyis pa ni rgyu mtshan rnam par rig pa nyid du bsdu ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rgyu mtshan rnam par rig pa nyid du bsdu ba'i sgo ste /
translated: The second is the door of inclusion in the reason-image itself.

original: 'di yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This also, in brief, has two topics.

original: dang po ni cha rnam pa gsum gyis don bstan te /
analyzed: dang po ni cha rnam pa gsum gyis don bstan te /
translated: First, the topic is taught by three parts.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intrinsic essence is called “consciousness.”

original: lta ba dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gnyis ni spyir rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa gnyis ni spyir rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
translated: The two aspects of view and reason-image are generally called “reason.”

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las gyur pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Establishing Consciousness Only, it says:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid cha gnyis lta bur gyur bar snang ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid cha gnyis lta bur gyur bar snang ste /
translated: The essence of consciousness appears as if it were two parts.🔽Because both the view and the reason-image arise in dependence on the intrinsic essence.

original: lta ba dang rgyu mtshan gnyi ga yang rang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las rnam par shes par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa mang mod kyi /
analyzed: lta ba dang rgyu mtshan gnyi ga yang rang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang de nyid las rnam par shes par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa mang mod kyi /
translated: And again, in that same text, it says: Although the characteristics of consciousness are many,

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa de yang rnam pa mi mtshungs pas rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa de yang rnam pa mi mtshungs pas rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: And that transformation of consciousness is threefold, because of its different aspects.

original: zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar nas rgyu mtshan ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar nas rgyu mtshan ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa ste /
translated: In connection with this explanation, the aspect of representation is the appearance of an object.

original: lta ba dang rgyu mtshan rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba dang rgyu mtshan rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the views and representations have the characteristic of the representation of their own nature.

original: gnyis pa ni cha rnam pa gnyis kyis don bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni cha rnam pa gnyis kyis don bstan te /
translated: The second is taught by means of two parts.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect of view is called representation.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
translated: The aspect of representation is called representation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las nang gi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi phyi rol gyi yul lta bur gyur par snang ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las nang gi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi phyi rol gyi yul lta bur gyur par snang ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Establishing Representation Only, it is explained: “Internal consciousness itself appears as if it were an external object.”

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar nas rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar nas rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya ste /
translated: In connection with this explanation, the aspect of representation is called representation.

original: rgyu mtshan ni lta ba'i rnam pa las gud na med pas rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya'o //🔽don mdor @4a * //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni lta ba'i rnam pa las gud na med pas rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya'o // don mdor @4a * //
translated: Because they are not separate from the aspect of the view, they are called mere consciousness.

original: bsdu na ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dang sgra skad rnams ni rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsdu na ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dang sgra skad rnams ni rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The meaning in brief is taught: because the collections of names, phrases, and letters, and sounds and voices are characterized by consciousness, they are called consciousness.

original: gsum pa ni btags pa rnams rdzas su bsdus pa'i sgo ste ji ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las ming la sogs pa ni btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni btags pa rnams rdzas su bsdus pa'i sgo ste ji ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa las ming la sogs pa ni btags pa yin no //
translated: The third is the door of the inclusion of the imputed in the substantial. Just as it is explained in the Levels of Yogic Deeds and so forth that names and so forth are imputed,

original: sgra ni rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir sgra las logs shig na ming la sogs pa gzhan med do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: sgra ni rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir sgra las logs shig na ming la sogs pa gzhan med do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o /
translated: and because sounds exist substantially, names and so forth are not separate from sounds.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na gong ma'i sgo gsum po re re la yang rnam pa gnyis gnyis su phye na sgo rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na gong ma'i sgo gsum po re re la yang rnam pa gnyis gnyis su phye na sgo rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Alternatively, if each of the three doors above is divided into two, there are six doors.

original: de la sgo dang po'i rnam pa gnyis kyang /
analyzed: de la sgo dang po'i rnam pa gnyis kyang /
translated: The two divisions of the first door are:

original: dang po ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang dag pa nyid du bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: dang po ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yang dag pa nyid du bsdu ba ste /
translated: The first is the inclusion of the unreal in the real.

original: yang dag pa nyid kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is real,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not unreal.

original: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The second is the differentiation of the real and the unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is unreal,

original: yang dag pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but not real.

original: ming la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po dag yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po dag yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the four dharmas of name, etc. are not the reality of the real.

original: de la sgo gnyis pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyang dang po ni rgyu mtshan rnam par rig pa nyid du bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de la sgo gnyis pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyang dang po ni rgyu mtshan rnam par rig pa nyid du bsdu ba ste /
translated: The two aspects of the second door are: the first is the inclusion of the sign in consciousness;

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: it is merely consciousness,

original: rgyu mtshan ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not a sign.

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu mtshan rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu mtshan rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The second is the differentiation of consciousness and the sign.

original: ming la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po dag rgyu mtshan tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po dag rgyu mtshan tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The four dharmas of name, etc. are merely signs,🔽but not consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the representations of name, etc.,

original: ming la sogs pa ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because name, etc., are included in the representation of causal signs.

original: sgo gsum pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyang dang po ni btags pa rnams rdzas su bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: sgo gsum pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyang dang po ni btags pa rnams rdzas su bsdu ba ste /
translated: The two kinds of threefold gates: The first is the inclusion of the nominal in the substantial.

original: rdzas tsam du zad kyi btags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas tsam du zad kyi btags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only a mere substance and not a nominal entity.

original: gnyis ni btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The second is the distinction between nominal and substantial entities.

original: sgo 'di ni btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa gnyis bstan pas ming la sogs pa ni btags pa yin la /
analyzed: sgo 'di ni btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa gnyis bstan pas ming la sogs pa ni btags pa yin la /
translated: This gate is the teaching of the two kinds of existence, nominal and substantial, because name, etc., are nominal entities,

original: sgra ni rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and sound is a substantial entity.

original: bzhi pa ni chos gsum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par bstan pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni chos gsum gyi ngo bo nyid nges par bstan pa'i sgo ste /
translated: The fourth is the gate of the definite teaching of the nature of the three dharmas.

original: chos gsum ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi sgo gsum nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos gsum ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi sgo gsum nyid yin te /
translated: The three dharmas are the three gates of the aggregates, sense bases, and sense fields.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa'i bstan bcos las chos gsum gyi le'u zhes @4b 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa'i bstan bcos las chos gsum gyi le'u zhes @4b 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the treatise called the Compendium of the Abhidharma, which is a collection of various dharmas, has a chapter on the three dharmas.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung dpyad pas bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don las ni sgra la ngo bo nyid du 'dod pas chos gsum las gzugs kyi phung po dang / sgra'i skye mched dang sgra'i khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung dpyad pas bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don las ni sgra la ngo bo nyid du 'dod pas chos gsum las gzugs kyi phung po dang / sgra'i skye mched dang sgra'i khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: The Vaibhāṣika system explains that sound is included in the aggregate of form, the sense base of sound, and the element of sound, because it is asserted to be the nature of sound.

original: mdo sde'i gzhung dang sbyar na btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i sgra gnyis la bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: mdo sde'i gzhung dang sbyar na btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i sgra gnyis la bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: When applied to the scriptural system of the Sautrāntikas, sound is asserted to be the nature of the teaching in terms of both imputed sound and substantial sound.

original: phung po lnga las gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po lnga las gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: It is included in the aggregate of form in the five aggregates.

original: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas ni sgra'i skye mched dang sgra'i khams dang chos kyi khams kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas ni sgra'i skye mched dang sgra'i khams dang chos kyi khams kyis bsdus te /
translated: In terms of the sense bases and elements, it is included in the sense base of sound and the element of sound and the element of mental objects.

original: rgya cher ni chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail in the teaching of the Enumeration of Dharmas.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, when applied to the scriptural system of the Mahāyāna,

original: sgra dang ming la sogs pa'i chos bzhi la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: sgra dang ming la sogs pa'i chos bzhi la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: sound, name, and so on are asserted to be the nature of the teaching.

original: phung po lnga las gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po dang / skye mched dang khams dang sgra'i skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i khams dang / chos kyi khams te /
analyzed: phung po lnga las gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po dang / skye mched dang khams dang sgra'i skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i khams dang / chos kyi khams te /
translated: The elements are the element of sound and the element of mental objects.

original: ming la sogs pa'i chos gsum po dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i chos gsum po dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three dharmas, name, etc., are not the objects of mental consciousness.

original: lnga pa ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i sgo ste /
translated: The fifth is the door of teaching the nature of the Dharma categories.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
translated: This is also divided into four parts.

original: 'di lta ste chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa bstan pa dang / bsags pa rnam par phye bas sems kyi khyad par bstan pa dang / gsung gcig pa dang tha dad pa rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa bstan pa dang / bsags pa rnam par phye bas sems kyi khyad par bstan pa dang / gsung gcig pa dang tha dad pa rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: They are: the teaching of the nature of the Dharma categories, the teaching of the existence and non-existence of one's own nature and reflection, the teaching of the difference in minds by the division of the aggregates, and the division of the single utterance and the different utterances.

original: de la chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of the nature of the Dharma categories is also twofold.

original: phyi rol pa dang 'dod do //
analyzed: phyi rol pa dang 'dod do //
translated: The non-Buddhists accept it.

original: phyi rol pa'i gzhung yang rnam pa mang mod kyi /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i gzhung yang rnam pa mang mod kyi /
translated: Although there are many non-Buddhist scriptures,

original: 'dir re zhig rnam pa bzhi zhig bstan te /🔽mu stegs can grangs can ni sgra'i de kho na nyid la ngo bo nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir re zhig rnam pa bzhi zhig bstan te / mu stegs can grangs can ni sgra'i de kho na nyid la ngo bo nyid du 'dod do //
translated: here four types are taught.🔽The Sāṃkhya tīrthikas assert that the reality of sound is the nature.

original: mchog tu smra ba rnams ni sgra'i yon tan la ngo bo nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: mchog tu smra ba rnams ni sgra'i yon tan la ngo bo nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The Īśvarīvāda asserts that the quality of sound is the nature.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: The Lokāyata assert that the four great elements are the nature,

original: thams cad kyang 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because everything is produced by the great elements.

original: sgrar smra ba rnams ni sgra la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: sgrar smra ba rnams ni sgra la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: The Śabdabrahman asserts that sound is the nature.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos las sgra ni rtag pas nges pa'i tshad ma byed de chos rnams brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i bstan bcos las sgra ni rtag pas nges pa'i tshad ma byed de chos rnams brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the treatise of logic, sound is the permanent, valid cognition, because it expresses phenomena.

original: zhe'o // de la chos 'di gzhung dang sbyar na yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te thams cad yod par smra @5a * //
analyzed: zhe'o // de la chos 'di gzhung dang sbyar na yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te thams cad yod par smra @5a * //
translated: The Dharma is also related to the treatises, but the explanations of the treatises are not in agreement.

original: ba dag ni /
analyzed: ba dag ni /
translated: The Sarvāstivādins say:

original: mdor na chos ni bdun cu rtsa lnga las med de don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdor na chos ni bdun cu rtsa lnga las med de don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: In brief, there are no more than seventy-five dharmas, and their meaning is as explained above.

original: bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang sems sna tshogs kyi bstan bcos dang / mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po'i bstan bcos dag las rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang sems sna tshogs kyi bstan bcos dang / mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po'i bstan bcos dag las rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The nature of the teaching is explained in two ways in the treatises: the treatise on the various minds, the treatise on the Abhidharma-piṭaka, and the treatise on the great commentary.

original: kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Some say: The aggregates of the Tathāgata’s Dharma are made the nature of the form aggregate,

original: 'di ltar sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because they are sound.

original: kha cig ni 'du byed kyi phung po nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'du byed kyi phung po nyid de /
translated: Some say: They are the formation aggregate,

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because they are names, phrases, and letters.

original: don des na yul 'di pa nyid kyi slob dpon rnams go ba dag mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: don des na yul 'di pa nyid kyi slob dpon rnams go ba dag mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
translated: For that reason, the masters of this land explain three different opinions.

original: kha cig ni sgra la yang dag pa'i don du 'dod de 'di ltar sgra ni dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig ni sgra la yang dag pa'i don du 'dod de 'di ltar sgra ni dge ba yin gyi /
translated: Sound is virtue,

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs ni lung du mi ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs ni lung du mi ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the collections of names, words and syllables are indeterminate.🔽Thus, the treatise on the various mental states declares:

original: de lta bas na sems sna tshogs kyi bstan bcos las mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang / ma mo dag ni kun rdzob kyi yang dag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems sna tshogs kyi bstan bcos las mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang / ma mo dag ni kun rdzob kyi yang dag pa'i chos so //
translated: The sūtras, the Vinaya and the mātṛkā are the conventional ultimate truth,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun ni don dam pa'i 'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun ni don dam pa'i 'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: but the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the ultimate truth.🔽And the commentary to this declares:

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las kun rdzob kyi yang dag ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni tshig gis bstan pa'i chos la bya'o zhes bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las kun rdzob kyi yang dag ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni tshig gis bstan pa'i chos la bya'o zhes bshad do zhe'o //
translated: The conventional ultimate truth refers to the Dharma that is taught verbally.

original: kha cig ni ming la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i don du 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni ming la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i don du 'dod de /
translated: Some believe that names and so on are the ultimate truth,

original: 'di ltar bstan par bya ba'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan par bya ba'i don brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since they express the meaning that is to be taught.

original: de'i phyir shes pa bskyed pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa bskyed pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Thus, the treatise on the generation of cognition declares:

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ci zhig gis ngo bo nyid byed ce na smras pa ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs go rims bzhin du gnas pa'o zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du zhe'o //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ci zhig gis ngo bo nyid byed ce na smras pa ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs go rims bzhin du gnas pa'o zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du zhe'o //
translated: What is the nature of the twelve branches of the scriptures? They are collections of names, words, and letters, respectively.

original: kha cig ni sgra dang ming la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni sgra dang ming la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Some say that sound, name, etc. are the nature of the scriptures.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i dbang gis don rnam pa gnyis ston pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i dbang gis don rnam pa gnyis ston pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because the meaning is indicated by the power of sound in two ways.

original: 'dir mdzod kyi bstan bcos gsar 'gyur dang sbyar na de las bshad pa rnam pa 'di gnyis ka yang smos te /
analyzed: 'dir mdzod kyi bstan bcos gsar 'gyur dang sbyar na de las bshad pa rnam pa 'di gnyis ka yang smos te /
translated: Here, in the new translation of the Abhidharmakośa treatise, both of these explanations are mentioned.

original: 'di ltar sgra 'am yang na ming la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung gi / rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra 'am yang na ming la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung gi / rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //
translated: Because it says, Sound or name, etc., but there is no explanation in any other way.

original: yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Also, in the treatise of correct reasoning,

original: slob dpon 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa smos pa mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa smos pa mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun te /
translated: the explanations of these two masters are mentioned, which are consistent with what appears in the Abhidharmakośa treatise.

original: dris pa dang lan dag kyang yod pas de'i @5b phyir bstan bcos de nyid las ngag dang bstan pa'i ming tha dad dam /
analyzed: dris pa dang lan dag kyang yod pas de'i @5b phyir bstan bcos de nyid las ngag dang bstan pa'i ming tha dad dam /
translated: Since there are questions and answers, the treatise asks, Is the name of the speech and teaching different?

original: 'on te bstan pa dag kyang yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te bstan pa dag kyang yin par 'dod /
translated: Or is it asserted that the teaching is also a name?

original: ming dang bstan pa ngo bo nyid tha dad na /
analyzed: ming dang bstan pa ngo bo nyid tha dad na /
translated: If the name and teaching have different natures,

original: bstan pa ji ltar ming yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ji ltar ming yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: how can the teaching be a name?

original: de las de skad du bshad pa ni ming yod pa'i dbang gis gdod bstan pa zhes bya bas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ming yin te /
analyzed: de las de skad du bshad pa ni ming yod pa'i dbang gis gdod bstan pa zhes bya bas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ming yin te /
translated: The treatise explains that since the name is called the teaching due to the power of the name existing, therefore the nature of the Tathagata's teaching is a name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du don brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du don brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it expresses the meaning just as it is.

original: ming ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ming ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yin no //
translated: The name is the teaching of the Tathagata.

original: ming gi don brjod pa'i phyir bstan pa ni ming yin te des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni nges par ming gis ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: ming gi don brjod pa'i phyir bstan pa ni ming yin te des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni nges par ming gis ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: The teaching is a name because it expresses the meaning of the name. Therefore the teaching of the Tathagata definitely has the nature of a name.

original: ming gtso bor smos pas na tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming gtso bor smos pas na tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it primarily mentions names, it should be understood that it also includes collections of words and letters.

original: gzhan yang gzhung rab tu bstan pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhung rab tu bstan pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the treatise that teaches the scriptures states:

original: yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: It accords with what is explained in the treatise of correct reasoning.

original: sde snod gsum la mkhas pa'i slob dpon dag gis bshad pa las ni /
analyzed: sde snod gsum la mkhas pa'i slob dpon dag gis bshad pa las ni /
translated: From the explanations of masters who are learned in the three scriptural collections,

original: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams brgyud de bshad pa las kyang 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams brgyud de bshad pa las kyang 'di skad du ston te /
translated: it is taught that this is explained through the lineage of Indian masters.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang des na yang dag pa'i rigs pa las so so rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yang so so nas dmigs pa yod de /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang des na yang dag pa'i rigs pa las so so rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yang so so nas dmigs pa yod de /
translated: In the treatise of the Abhidharmakośa, the two types of each are explained from correct reasoning, and each has its own focus.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can mgu ba bskyed par ni sgra mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: sems can mgu ba bskyed par ni sgra mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: In order to generate delight in sentient beings, sound is supreme.

original: chos brjod par ni ming la sogs pa mthu che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos brjod par ni ming la sogs pa mthu che ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to express the Dharma, names and so on are more powerful.

original: ltos pa mi mthun yang so so nas nges pa yod de /
analyzed: ltos pa mi mthun yang so so nas nges pa yod de /
translated: Although their reliance is not the same, each has its own certainty.

original: des na rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa gnyi ga yang dag pa'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa gnyi ga yang dag pa'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, both explanations of two kinds of reality are the true meaning.

original: 'dir bstan bcos rnams kyi dgongs pa brtags na yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ming la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i don du 'dod pas na /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos rnams kyi dgongs pa brtags na yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ming la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i don du 'dod pas na /
translated: Here, if one examines the intention of the treatises, it is that the correct meaning is asserted to be name and so on.🔽Therefore, in the conclusion of that treatise, it says:

original: de'i phyir de'i mjug sdud pa las de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni nges par ming nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mjug sdud pa las de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni nges par ming nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: Therefore the teaching of the Tathāgata is definitely a teaching of name alone.🔽Name alone is reality.

original: nges par ming nyid ngo bo nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar na mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kyang yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i bstan bcos dang mthun te /
analyzed: nges par ming nyid ngo bo nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar na mdzod kyi bstan bcos las kyang yang dag pa'i rigs pa'i bstan bcos dang mthun te /
translated: If this is applied, the treatise of the Abhidharmakośa is also in accord with the treatise of correct reasoning.

original: 'di ltar de las de sun mi 'byin pa yang don 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las de sun mi 'byin pa yang don 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not refute that, there is no contradiction in meaning.

original: yang na slob dpon phyi ma rang gi rnam par gzhag pa pham par khas blangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na slob dpon phyi ma rang gi rnam par gzhag pa pham par khas blangs pa yin gyi /
translated: Or the later master accepts his own position as defeated.

original: yang dag @6a * //
analyzed: yang dag @6a * //
translated: Correct

original: pa'i rigs pa mdzad pa'i slob dpon gyis pham rgyal rnam par phye ste bstan pa ni ma yin no bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las dpyad pa dag gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar na ni sgra bshad pa yang dag pa'i don yin te
analyzed: pa'i rigs pa mdzad pa'i slob dpon gyis pham rgyal rnam par phye ste bstan pa ni ma yin no bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las dpyad pa dag gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar na ni sgra bshad pa yang dag pa'i don yin te
translated: When the meaning of the great treatise is applied to the correct meaning explained by the analyses, the explanation of the term is the correct meaning.🔽Therefore, the great treatise explains:

original: / de'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa rnams ci zhig gis ngo bo nyid byed /
analyzed: / de'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa rnams ci zhig gis ngo bo nyid byed /
translated: By what is the nature of the teachings of the Tathāgata made?

original: ci ngag gi las yin nam /
analyzed: ci ngag gi las yin nam /
translated: Is it made by speech?

original: 'on te ming la sogs pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te ming la sogs pa yin /
translated: Or is it made by name and so on?

original: smras pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pas gsungs pa rnams ni bshad pa dag yin pas ngag gi las ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: smras pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pas gsungs pa rnams ni bshad pa dag yin pas ngag gi las ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is said that the teachings spoken by the enjoyment and emanation bodies are explanations, and thus the nature is speech.🔽If that is so, how can the explanation below be correct?

original: gal te de lta na 'di'i 'og nas bshad pa rnam pa ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di'i 'og nas bshad pa rnam pa ji ltar rung ste /
translated: It says:🔽What is the dharma called the teachings of the Tathāgata?

original: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa rnams chos ci zhes bya zhe na smras pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa rnams chos ci zhes bya zhe na smras pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams go rims su bkod pa dang / go rims su rnam par gzhag pa dang / go rims su 'brel pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams go rims su bkod pa dang / go rims su rnam par gzhag pa dang / go rims su 'brel pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: The collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of syllables are arranged in order, established in order, and connected in order.

original: yi ge 'og nas 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i nus pa bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yi ge 'og nas 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i nus pa bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The syllables that will be mentioned later are taught to be the power of the Tathagata's teaching.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par phye bar ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par phye bar ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But it is not maintained that they are the intrinsic reality of the Buddha's teaching.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: go rims su bkod pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i nus pa yin pas so //
analyzed: go rims su bkod pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i nus pa yin pas so //
translated: the collection of names, phrases, and syllables are the power of the Buddha's teaching, since they are arranged in order, established in order, and connected in order.

original: kha cig na re de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni ming la sogs bas ngo bo nyid byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni ming la sogs bas ngo bo nyid byed do zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The intrinsic reality of the Tathagata's teaching is made by names, etc.

original: gal te de ltar na 'di skad du bshad pha ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'di skad du bshad pha ji ltar rung ste /
translated: If that is so, how can this explanation be correct?

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi bstan ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes smras pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi bstan ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes smras pa 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the teaching of the Buddha?

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang brjod pa dang 'brel pa dang ngag gi lam dang ngag gi las dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang brjod pa dang 'brel pa dang ngag gi lam dang ngag gi las dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu zhe na /
translated: It is the speech, expression, connection, path of speech, action of speech, and indication of speech of the Buddha.

original: brgyud pa'i rgyu la brten nas de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: brgyud pa'i rgyu la brten nas de skad du bshad de /
translated: This is explained in terms of a causal process.

original: 'jig rten na bu tsha rnams gcig gis gcig skyed pa'i chos byed pa ltar /
analyzed: 'jig rten na bu tsha rnams gcig gis gcig skyed pa'i chos byed pa ltar /
translated: In the world, nephews are said to be the offspring of their uncles.

original: ngag gis ni ming skyed la ming gis don gsal bar byed pas so //
analyzed: ngag gis ni ming skyed la ming gis don gsal bar byed pas so //
translated: Speech generates names and names clarify objects.

original: dpyad pa dag gis bshad pa las 'byung ba de skad du bshad pa lta na /
analyzed: dpyad pa dag gis bshad pa las 'byung ba de skad du bshad pa lta na /
translated: If this is explained in terms of the analysis of the Abhidharma,

original: ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid byed de /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams pha rol gyis thos pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid byed de / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams pha rol gyis thos pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the essence of the action of speech is🔽that the speech of the Tathagata is heard by others.

original: zhib tu ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Abhidharma.

original: yang @6b dag pa'i rigs pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po la sogs pa la brten pa ma yin nam zhen ci'i phyir dpyad ba dag gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don la rten par mi byed /
analyzed: yang @6b dag pa'i rigs pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po la sogs pa la brten pa ma yin nam zhen ci'i phyir dpyad ba dag gis bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don la rten par mi byed /
translated: But aren't they based on correct reasoning and the great exegesis? They are not based on the correct meaning explained by the Analysts.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang gis bshad pa'i rigs pa bzang zhing mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang gis bshad pa'i rigs pa bzang zhing mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the reasoning explained by Master Samghabhadra is excellent and supreme.

original: ming la sogs pa la yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa la yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: Name and so on are reality.

original: zhes logs shig tu rigs pas bsgrubs so //
analyzed: zhes logs shig tu rigs pas bsgrubs so //
translated: This is established by reasoning elsewhere.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las 'di'i gzhung gi sgra la ngo bo nyid du bshad pa ni chos kyi grangs kyi sgo nas sgra'i chos gcig 'ba' zhig la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las 'di'i gzhung gi sgra la ngo bo nyid du bshad pa ni chos kyi grangs kyi sgo nas sgra'i chos gcig 'ba' zhig la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: The Autocommentary explains: The term reality in this text is asserted to be reality in the sense of a single phenomenon of sound.

original: ming la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that name and so on are reality

original: ming la sogs pa ni chos gsum la ngo bo nyid du ston to //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa ni chos gsum la ngo bo nyid du ston to //
translated: teaches that the three phenomena of name and so on are reality.

original: gal te gcig tu bsdus te bshad na ni chos bzhi bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu bsdus te bshad na ni chos bzhi bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid du 'dod de /
translated: If it is explained as a single term, it is asserted that the four phenomena are reality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sgra dang ming la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang ming la sogs pa'o //
translated: sound, name, etc.

original: dpyad pas bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don gyis ni sgra'i chos gcig la ngo bo nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dpyad pas bshad pa'i yang dag pa'i don gyis ni sgra'i chos gcig la ngo bo nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the nature of sound is the sound of a single dharma, as explained by analysis.

original: mdo sde pa dag ni sgra la ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag ni sgra la ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: The Sautrāntikas explain that the nature of sound is sound itself.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bstan bcos las mdo ste pa sun 'byin pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bstan bcos las mdo ste pa sun 'byin pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise that accords with correct reasoning, in the section refuting the Sautrāntikas, it says:

original: khyed ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams sgras ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: khyed ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams sgras ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: You say that the collections of names, phrases, and letters are made by sound.

original: zhes smra ba'i mi rigs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes smra ba'i mi rigs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is not reasonable to say this.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni mdo sde rnams kyi tshig dag gis ngo bo nyid byed do zhes zer ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes sun 'byin te /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni mdo sde rnams kyi tshig dag gis ngo bo nyid byed do zhes zer ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes sun 'byin te /
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by Master Niḥsvabhāva, it refutes this statement: The nature of the sūtras is made by sound.

original: gzhung 'di nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'di nyid la brten nas /
translated: Relying on this very text,

original: slob dpon gsum gyis 'di skad du ston to //🔽kha cig ni skye mched bcu gnyis las sgra'i skye mched kyis ngo bo nyid byed de /🔽sgra las logs shig na ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o /
analyzed: slob dpon gsum gyis 'di skad du ston to // kha cig ni skye mched bcu gnyis las sgra'i skye mched kyis ngo bo nyid byed de / sgra las logs shig na ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o /
translated: The three masters teach this.🔽Some say that the collection of names, phrases, and syllables is essentially sound, because apart from sound there is no other collection of names, phrases, and syllables.

original: kha cig ni chos kyi skye mched las rgyun mi 'chad pa'i btags pa'i sgras ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: kha cig ni chos kyi skye mched las rgyun mi 'chad pa'i btags pa'i sgras ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Some say that the collection of names, phrases, and syllables is essentially the sound of the uninterrupted indicative aspect of the element of mental objects,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because it is the object of mental consciousness alone.

original: kha cig ni btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i sgra gnyis kas ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: kha cig ni btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i sgra gnyis kas ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Some say that the collection of names, phrases, and syllables is essentially both the sound that exists as an indication and the sound that exists as a substance,

original: gong ma'i don gnyis kyi phyir ro zhes zer ro //🔽ci'i phyir mdo sde pa dag rnam pa 'di gsum lta bur 'dod par gyur ce na /
analyzed: gong ma'i don gnyis kyi phyir ro zhes zer ro // ci'i phyir mdo sde pa dag rnam pa 'di gsum lta bur 'dod par gyur ce na /
translated: because it has the meaning of both the above.🔽Why do the Sautrantikas assert these three types?

original: slob dpon sde snod gsum dang ldan pa dag gis bshad pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon sde snod gsum dang ldan pa dag gis bshad pa las /
translated: The three masters explain this based on the explanations of the Tripiṭaka masters.

original: @7a * // mdo sde tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: @7a * // mdo sde tshad mar byas te /
translated: The Sautrāntikas take the sūtras as their authority.

original: don rnams rnam par bshad pa ni thams cad kyang mdo sde pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: don rnams rnam par bshad pa ni thams cad kyang mdo sde pa zhes bya bas /
translated: The meaning of the term is explained by all as “those who rely on the sutras.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde pa dag rnam pa gsum po 'di lta bur 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde pa dag rnam pa gsum po 'di lta bur 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ” Therefore, the Sautrantikas are so called because they accept these three aspects.

original: de dag gi gzhung gis chos kyi rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa yang so so nas mi mthun te /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung gis chos kyi rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa yang so so nas mi mthun te /
translated: Their texts also differ in their presentation of the categories of phenomena.

original: kha cig ni sems las logs shig na sems las byung ba med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems las logs shig na sems las byung ba med do zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that mental factors do not exist separately from mind.

original: slob dpon dpe can lta bu'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dpe can lta bu'o //
translated: This is the position of the master Dignaga.

original: btsun pa rtogs pa'i lhas kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: btsun pa rtogs pa'i lhas kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Bhadanta Vimuktisena also explains in a way that accords with this.

original: de dag gis gzhung dang sbyar na rnam pa bcu dgu yod do //
analyzed: de dag gis gzhung dang sbyar na rnam pa bcu dgu yod do //
translated: If you apply their texts, there are nineteen aspects.

original: 'di ltar gzugs las bcu bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs las bcu bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, there are fourteen from form:

original: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //🔽sems ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o // sems ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: the five sense faculties, the five sense objects, and the four great elements.

original: sems las byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is only one mind because there are no mental factors.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos ni grangs gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos ni grangs gcig kho na ste /
translated: Non-associated compositional factors are a single category.

original: 'di lta ste mngon par 'du ma byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mngon par 'du ma byas pa rnams so //
translated: They are unconditioned states.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Unconditioned states are of three types:

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor rtogs pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor rtogs pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o /
translated: space, analytical cessations, and non-analytical cessations.

original: sems las byung ba yod par 'dod pa yang bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sems las byung ba yod par 'dod pa yang bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Those who assert that mental factors exist have two different explanations.

original: kha cig ni sems las logs shig na sems las byung ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems las logs shig na sems las byung ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Some say that mental factors exist separately from the mind and are of three types:

original: 'di lta ste tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //🔽zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o // zhes zer te /
translated: feeling, discernment, and intention.

original: shi ri ra lta bu'o //
analyzed: shi ri ra lta bu'o //
translated: This is the position of the Śāriputrīyas.

original: kha cig ni rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: Some say that there are four types

original: zhes zer / de yang reg pa bsnan na'o //🔽bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis sam /
analyzed: zhes zer / de yang reg pa bsnan na'o // bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis sam /
translated: by adding contact.

original: yang na nyi shu rtsa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na nyi shu rtsa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: If this explanation is applied to the Abhidharmakośa, there are twenty-two or twenty-three mental factors.

original: 'di ltar snga ma bcu dgu'i steng du chos gsum mam /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga ma bcu dgu'i steng du chos gsum mam /
translated: This is because three or four mental factors are added to the previous nineteen.

original: yang na bzhi bsnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bzhi bsnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or else, because four are added.

original: de ltar mang nyung mi mthun pa yod kyang sgra'i skye mched kyis ngo bo nyid byed par bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar mang nyung mi mthun pa yod kyang sgra'i skye mched kyis ngo bo nyid byed par bzung ste /
translated: Thus, although there is disagreement about the number, the nature of the bases is grasped by the word base.

original: rgyun mi 'chad ba'i btags pa'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad ba'i btags pa'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the word base is not separate from the uninterrupted continuum.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, if we apply the Mahayana scriptures,

original: de yang mi mthun par smra ba rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: de yang mi mthun par smra ba rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: there are two types of disagreement.

original: dang po ni n'a gardzu na'i gzhung ste /
analyzed: dang po ni n'a gardzu na'i gzhung ste /
translated: The first is the scripture of Nāgārjuna.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs mang nyung nges par bstan pa'i bstan bcos med de /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs mang nyung nges par bstan pa'i bstan bcos med de /
translated: There is no treatise that definitively teaches the number of Dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa yang phal cher thams cad yod par smra @7b bar 'dod pa dag dang mthun par chos ni mdor bsdu na bdun brgya drug cu rtsa gcig yod par bstan te
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa yang phal cher thams cad yod par smra @7b bar 'dod pa dag dang mthun par chos ni mdor bsdu na bdun brgya drug cu rtsa gcig yod par bstan te
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, the explanation of the characteristics of phenomena is mostly in agreement with the Sthavira assertion that there are 761 Dharmas in brief.

original: / de ltar bstan pa yang thams cad yong par smra ba'i gzhung gis chos bdun cu rtsa lngar 'dod pa dang / gnas pa bcu bshad pa'i bstan bcos las mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos bdun brgya yod par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos bcu bzhi ston te /
analyzed: / de ltar bstan pa yang thams cad yong par smra ba'i gzhung gis chos bdun cu rtsa lngar 'dod pa dang / gnas pa bcu bshad pa'i bstan bcos las mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos bdun brgya yod par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos bcu bzhi ston te /
translated: Thus, in the same way that the treatise that explains the fifty-five dharmas of the Vātsīputrīya school and the treatise that explains the ten categories of dharmas posit the existence of seven hundred and fifty nonassociated formative forces, fourteen nonassociated formative forces are taught.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i bdun brgyas bsnan na /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i bdun brgyas bsnan na /
translated: When the seven hundred nonassociated formative forces are added to the fifty-five,

original: chos bdun brgya drug cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bdun brgya drug cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: there are seven hundred and sixty-one dharmas.

original: des na gzugs rnam pa bcu gcig las sgra ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: des na gzugs rnam pa bcu gcig las sgra ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Therefore, sound is a substance that is different from the eleven types of form.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad du mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i dgra bcom pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa'i tshe 'khor 'dus pa nyid du ma 'dus kyang 'di ltar lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas mthong
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad du mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i dgra bcom pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa'i tshe 'khor 'dus pa nyid du ma 'dus kyang 'di ltar lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas mthong
translated: Thus, in the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom, it says, “Arhats who have attained the six superknowledges, even though they are not present in the assembly when the Tathāgata teaches the dharma, see the Buddha with their divine eye and hear the dharma with their divine ear.

original: ngo // lha'i rna bas chos thos so //
analyzed: ngo // lha'i rna bas chos thos so //
translated: and one sees and hears by means of the divine eye and ear.

original: mngon par shes pas ma khyab pa'i gnas der ni mthong zhing thos par mi nus so zhes 'byung ba des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni sgras ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas ma khyab pa'i gnas der ni mthong zhing thos par mi nus so zhes 'byung ba des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni sgras ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: But one cannot see or hear in a place that is not pervaded by supernormal knowledge.

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa byams pas bstan pa'i gzhung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa byams pas bstan pa'i gzhung ste /
translated: The second is the treatise taught by the ārya Maitreya.

original: des mdor bsdu na chos ni brgya yod par bshad de /
analyzed: des mdor bsdu na chos ni brgya yod par bshad de /
translated: In brief, it explains that there are one hundred dharmas.

original: ji ltar chos brgya pa'i rab tu byed pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chos brgya pa'i rab tu byed pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is taught in the Prakaraṇa on the Hundred Dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid ston pa de yang gsung rab de dag las mthun par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid ston pa de yang gsung rab de dag las mthun par mi 'byung ste /
translated: That teaching on the nature of the Buddha’s teaching does not appear in those scriptures in a consistent way.

original: kha cig las ni sgra 'ba' zhig go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig las ni sgra 'ba' zhig go zhes gsungs te /
translated: Some say that it is only sound.

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa la sogs pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa la sogs pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the teaching of the ārya Vimalakīrti and so on:

original: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni chos ston kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni chos ston kyang //
translated: Although the Buddha teaches the Dharma with a single voice,

original: sems can mos pa ji bzhin so sor go //
analyzed: sems can mos pa ji bzhin so sor go //
translated: Each being understands according to their aspiration.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid las 'jig rten 'di'i sems can dag shin tu gdul bar dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid las 'jig rten 'di'i sems can dag shin tu gdul bar dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the sentient beings of this world are very difficult to tame,🔽the Bhagavat also tamed them with the Dharma of harsh words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshig drag po'i chos kyis 'dul bar mdzad do zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang khams chen po bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshig drag po'i chos kyis 'dul bar mdzad do zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang khams chen po bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: And also, the Sutra Teaching the Great Element says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig chos bstan las //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig chos bstan las //
translated: From the Tathagata's teaching of a single Dharma

original: dpag med mdo sde rgya mtsho rab tu gsungs //🔽zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: dpag med mdo sde rgya mtsho rab tu gsungs // zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang de nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: an ocean of limitless sutras is taught.🔽And also, that same text says:

original: rnam pa gsum yod de /
