analyzed: rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: In brief, the Tathagata's speech has three aspects.

original: @8a * // 'di lta ste mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: @8a * // 'di lta ste mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: They are as follows: sutra, vinaya, and abhidharma.

original: 'di la sogs pa'i gsung rab gtan tshigs su rung ba mang po yod do zhes so //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa'i gsung rab gtan tshigs su rung ba mang po yod do zhes so //
translated: There are many such scriptures that are suitable as reasons.

original: kha cig las ni ming la sogs pas ngo bo nyid byed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig las ni ming la sogs pas ngo bo nyid byed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Some scriptures say that names and so forth are the nature of the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal po'i mdo las ji skad du mdo sde 'di'i ming dang tshig ni sangs rgyas brgya stong du mas gsungs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal po'i mdo las ji skad du mdo sde 'di'i ming dang tshig ni sangs rgyas brgya stong du mas gsungs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the noble King of Men Sutra says, “The name and words of this sutra have been spoken by many hundreds of thousands of buddhas.”

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: And in the treatise Establishing Awareness Only it says:

original: gal te ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs sgra dang tha mi dad na /
analyzed: gal te ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs sgra dang tha mi dad na /
translated: If the collection of names, words, and letters were not different from sound,

original: chos dang nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'i yul tha dad med par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: chos dang nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'i yul tha dad med par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: the objects of the analytical knowledges of phenomena and language would not be different.

original: zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Thus it is.

original: ming la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: So names and so on have their own nature.

original: la la las ni gcig tu bsdus nas sgra dang ming la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: la la las ni gcig tu bsdus nas sgra dang ming la sogs pas rang gi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: In some places it is said that they are included in one and have their own nature as sound, name, and so on.

original: mi'i rgyal po'i mdo las ji skad du gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge dang sgra dri ma med pas bsdus so zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las sgra skad dang tshig dang yig 'bru dang yi ges kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po'i mdo las ji skad du gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge dang sgra dri ma med pas bsdus so zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las sgra skad dang tshig dang yig 'bru dang yi ges kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And the same text says, “The sounds, words, phrases, and letters also perform the deeds of the buddhas.”

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang de skad du gsungs so //
translated: The teaching of the noble Vimalakirti also says this.

original: gzhan yang mdo sde 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the commentary to the noble Sutra of the Ten Stages says,

original: 'chad pa po yang dngos po 'di gnyis kyis 'chad do //
analyzed: 'chad pa po yang dngos po 'di gnyis kyis 'chad do //
translated: “The teacher also teaches through these two things.

original: nyan pa po yang dngos po 'di gnyis kyis nyan par byed do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang dngos po 'di gnyis kyis nyan par byed do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The listener also listens through these two things.”

original: de la dngos po gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two things are as follows.

original: sgra dang ming la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang ming la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are sound, name, and so on.

original: la lar ni yi ge dang don gcig tu bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid do zhes ston te /
analyzed: la lar ni yi ge dang don gcig tu bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid do zhes ston te /
translated: In some cases, the essence is taught as being the combination of letters and meaning.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du mdo sde'i lus ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du mdo sde'i lus ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The body of the sutras is summarized in two ways:

original: yi ge dang don no //
analyzed: yi ge dang don no //
translated: letters and meaning.

original: de la yi ge ni rten to //
analyzed: de la yi ge ni rten to //
translated: Among them, letters are the support.

original: don ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: don ni brten pa'o //
translated: Meaning is the supported.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa 'di gnyis po thams cad ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i yul lo //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa 'di gnyis po thams cad ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i yul lo // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, all of these two aspects are objects of knowledge.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti teaches this.

original: 'di ltar gsung rab rnams de ltar so so nas mi mthun par bstan pa 'di las /🔽slob dpon sde snod gsum dang ldan pa dag gis bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsung rab rnams de ltar so so nas mi mthun par bstan pa 'di las / slob dpon sde snod gsum dang ldan pa dag gis bshad pa /
translated: Thus, these scriptures are taught in such a way that they are not mutually contradictory.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na ming dang @8b tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs sgra dang yi ge dang don gcig tu bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /🔽'phags pa'i gsung rab rnams so so nas don re re la dmigs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na ming dang @8b tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs sgra dang yi ge dang don gcig tu bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid ces bya ste / 'phags pa'i gsung rab rnams so so nas don re re la dmigs te /
translated: The masters who are versed in the three baskets explain that in reality, the collection of names, phrases, and letters is subsumed under sound and letters, which are called entities.

original: bstan pas na phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bstan pas na phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since the scriptures of the aryas focus on each individual meaning and teach it, they are not mutually contradictory.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar btags pa rdzas su bsdus pa'i tshe ni sgras ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar btags pa rdzas su bsdus pa'i tshe ni sgras ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: Thus, when nominal things are subsumed under substantial things, the word “nature” is used.

original: sgra las logs shig na ming dang tshig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las logs shig na ming dang tshig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because names, phrases, etc. do not exist apart from sound.

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid las kyi rdzas su bsdus pa'i tshe ni ming la sogs pas ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid las kyi rdzas su bsdus pa'i tshe ni ming la sogs pas ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Thus, when nominal things are subsumed under substantial things, the word “nature” is used.🔽Because names, phrases, etc. do not exist apart from sound.🔽Thus, when the natures are subsumed under substantial things, the word “nature” is used.

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par brjod pa dang / gnyi ga'i rten byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par brjod pa dang / gnyi ga'i rten byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because names, etc. are the bases of the expression of the intrinsic natures and the specific differences of things, and the bases of both.

original: btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa phan tshun ltos pas na gcig tu bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid ces bshad de /
analyzed: btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa phan tshun ltos pas na gcig tu bsdus pa la ngo bo nyid ces bshad de /
translated: Since nominal and substantial things are mutually dependent, they are subsumed in one another and are called “natures.”

original: gal te rnam pa gcig ma tshang na bshad pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gcig ma tshang na bshad pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one of the three aspects is missing, the explanation is not complete.

original: shes pa bskyed pa mthar phyin pa ni nges par yi ge dang don gyi dbang gis 'grub pas na /
analyzed: shes pa bskyed pa mthar phyin pa ni nges par yi ge dang don gyi dbang gis 'grub pas na /
translated: The completion of the generation of consciousness is definitely accomplished by the power of letters and meaning.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa mang por bshad kyang phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa mang por bshad kyang phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, although many different explanations are given, they are not mutually contradictory.

original: de la gnyis la rang gi ngo bo dang / gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gnyis la rang gi ngo bo dang / gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The explanation of the existence and non-existence of the essence and the reflection has two parts:

original: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa bstan pa dang / chos ston pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa bstan pa dang / chos ston pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: the explanation of the existence and non-existence of the essence and the reflection, and the special teaching of the Dharma.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa dang / bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bstan pa rnams chos bzhis ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang med pa dang / bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bstan pa rnams chos bzhis ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: The explanation of the existence and non-existence of the essence and the reflection is the essence of the teachings spoken by the Tathagata, which is made by four dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste sgra skad dang ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sgra skad dang ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: They are the collection of sounds, words, phrases, and letters.

original: 'di ltar chos bzhi po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos bzhi po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes gsungs la /
translated: Thus, the Tathagata himself has said that these four dharmas are the essence.

original: nyan pa po'i rnam par rig par gyur pa ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rnam par rig par gyur pa ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The cognition of the listener is called the reflection.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang / med pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na so so'i gzhung la brten nas mu rnam pa bzhir gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod pa dang / med pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na so so'i gzhung la brten nas mu rnam pa bzhir gyur te /
translated: The distinction between the existence and nonexistence of the nature and the reflection is, in brief, four alternatives based on the individual scriptures.

original: de la mu dang po ni rang gi ngo bo yod la gzugs brnyan med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni rang gi ngo bo yod la gzugs brnyan med pa'o //
translated: The first alternative is the existence of the nature and the nonexistence of the reflection.

original: 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: This is also explained differently in the individual scriptures.

original: re zhig sde pa rnams la brten nas rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: re zhig sde pa rnams la brten nas rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: Based on the schools, it is explained in three parts.

original: de la dang po ni thams cad yod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni thams cad yod par smra ba ste /
translated: The first is the Sarvāstivāda.

original: de 'di skad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gis gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di skad du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gis gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They say, “All the speech of the buddhas is exclusively contaminated.

original: ming la sogs pa ni nges par lung mi ston pa'o zhes zer @9a * //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa ni nges par lung mi ston pa'o zhes zer @9a * //
translated: Name and so on are definitely not revealed.”

original: te ; rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: te ; rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the great treatise Vibhāṣā and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / lan cig brjod pa'i sde pa dang / 'jig rten 'das par smra ba'i sde pa dang / bya ba ngal ba'i sde pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / lan cig brjod pa'i sde pa dang / 'jig rten 'das par smra ba'i sde pa dang / bya ba ngal ba'i sde pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The second is the Mahāsāṃghika school, the Ekavyāvahārika school, the Lokottaravāda school, the Bahuśrutīya school, and so on.

original: de dag 'di skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thams cad kyang 'jig rten las 'das pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thams cad kyang 'jig rten las 'das pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos mi mnga'o //
translated: They say, “All bhagavān buddhas are supramundane and do not possess contaminated phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: The speech of the tathāgatas turns the wheel of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas ni gsung gcig gis chos thams cad gsung ngo zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni gsung gcig gis chos thams cad gsung ngo zhes zer ro ;
translated: The Buddha speaks of all phenomena with a single statement.”

original: / gsum pa ni mang du thos pa'i sde pa ste /
analyzed: / gsum pa ni mang du thos pa'i sde pa ste /
translated: The third is the Bahuśrutīya school.

original: de skad du sangs rgyas kyi gsung rnam pa lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du sangs rgyas kyi gsung rnam pa lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin te /
translated: They say, “The five aspects of the Buddha’s speech are supramundane.

original: 'di lta ste sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ste /
translated: They are suffering, emptiness, impermanence, selflessness, and peace, which is nirvāṇa.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the noble path.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sgra rnams ni thams cad kyang 'jig rten pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sgra rnams ni thams cad kyang 'jig rten pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: All other sounds are mundane.

original: 'di la sogs pa sde ba rnams thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo kho na ste gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa sde ba rnams thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo kho na ste gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: All these schools maintain that the reflection is not a real entity, but only a semblance of one.

original: de dag gis gzhung las rnam par rig pa tsam gyi don mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis gzhung las rnam par rig pa tsam gyi don mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of vijñapti-mātra is not taught in their scriptures.

original: de la mu gnyis pa gzugs brnyan yod pa la rang gi ngo bo med par 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mu gnyis pa gzugs brnyan yod pa la rang gi ngo bo med par 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second alternative is the existence of a reflection without a real entity, as the Nāga school maintains.

original: klu'i sde'o // 'di skad du sangs rgyas kyis ni de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kho na ste /
analyzed: klu'i sde'o // 'di skad du sangs rgyas kyis ni de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kho na ste /
translated: They say that the Buddha taught only suchness and the wisdom of suchness,

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan rags pa'i mtshan ma med do zhes ston te /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan rags pa'i mtshan ma med do zhes ston te /
translated: not the gross characteristics of qualities such as form and sound.

original: slob dpon brtan pa'i blo gros dang rdo rje'i sde yang de skad du 'chad do //
analyzed: slob dpon brtan pa'i blo gros dang rdo rje'i sde yang de skad du 'chad do //
translated: Master Sthiramati and Vajra-senā also explain it in this way.

original: mu gsum pa rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyis ka yod par 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mu gsum pa rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyis ka yod par 'dod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third possibility is that both the nature and the reflection exist.

original: slob dpon zla ba'i snying po dang / nye ba'i 'od la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba'i snying po dang / nye ba'i 'od la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the position of the masters Candragomin, Udbhatasiddhasvamin, and so on.

original: de dag 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sku gsum dang ldan zhing gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan mnga' bas /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sku gsum dang ldan zhing gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan mnga' bas /
translated: They say that all tathagatas possess the three bodies and the qualities of form, sound, and so on.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Golden Light Scripture says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum bskor bar spyod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum bskor bar spyod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: The Tathagata turns the wheel of the Dharma in three ways:

original: bskor ba dang rtogs pa dang 'dzin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bskor ba dang rtogs pa dang 'dzin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: turning, realizing, and holding.

original: 'di la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs @9b su rung ba'i gsung rab mang du yod do //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs @9b su rung ba'i gsung rab mang du yod do //
translated: There are many scriptures that can be cited as reasons for this.

original: yang na nyan pa po rnam par shes par gyur nas de 'dra bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa po rnam par shes par gyur nas de 'dra bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the listener becomes conscious of it and it appears to be like that.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyi ga yod par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyi ga yod par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that both the nature and the reflection exist.

original: mu bzhi pa rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyis ka med par 'dod pa ni slob dpon 'phags pa don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyis ka med par 'dod pa ni slob dpon 'phags pa don dam pa'i bden pa la brten nas /
translated: The fourth possibility, that both the entity and the reflection do not exist, is the position of the master Āryadāsa,

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: who posits that all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality in dependence on ultimate truth.

original: yang na slob dpon chos skyong gis rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: yang na slob dpon chos skyong gis rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan gnyi ga med do //
translated: Or the master Dharmapāla teaches that neither the entity nor the reflection exist,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la tshig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la tshig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa'o //
translated: because in ultimate truth words and so on do not exist.

original: de ltar khyad par gyur pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi yod kyang slob dpon hyan tsang dang chos skyong gis gzhung gi don rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar khyad par gyur pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi yod kyang slob dpon hyan tsang dang chos skyong gis gzhung gi don rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: Thus, although there are four different positions, the masters Xuanzang and Dharmapāla teach the meaning of the text in two parts.

original: de la dang po yang dag pa'i bstan pa la brten nas rang gi ngo bo kho na ste /
analyzed: de la dang po yang dag pa'i bstan pa la brten nas rang gi ngo bo kho na ste /
translated: First, in dependence on the correct teaching, only the entity exists,

original: gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no //
translated: but the reflection does not.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis rnam par rig pa las rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis rnam par rig pa las rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The entity is not a transformation of the consciousness of the Tathāgata himself.

original: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa dang gnyis ka yod par bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa dang gnyis ka yod par bstan te /
translated: The second is the teaching of the existence of both the real and the reflected image.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi mthu'i dbang gis byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi mthu'i dbang gis byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The essence and the reflected image exist by the power of the Tathāgata’s speech.

original: yang dag pa dang gnyi ga la brten nas rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod par bstan pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang gnyi ga la brten nas rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan yod par bstan pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do we know that the teaching of the existence of the essence and the reflected image is based on the real and the reflected image?

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
translated: The master Niḥsvabhāva wrote a commentary on the Mahāyāna Synthesis,

original: 'di ltar nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa la bsags pa rab tu phye bar gyur pa gang yin pa des bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa la bsags pa rab tu phye bar gyur pa gang yin pa des bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad de /
translated: where he explains that the essence of the teaching is created by the development of the accumulation of consciousness in the listener.

original: slob dpon chos skyong ni bstan bcos de tshad mar mi byed pas klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong ni bstan bcos de tshad mar mi byed pas klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: The master Dharmapāla does not accept that text as authoritative, so he cannot be faulted.

original: yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyang slob dpon chos skyong dang mthun par ston te /
analyzed: yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyang slob dpon chos skyong dang mthun par ston te /
translated: The master Niḥsvabhāva also teaches in accordance with the master Dharmapāla.

original: 'di ltar slob dpon ngo bo nyid med thabs kyi sku gsum gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan mnga' zhing chos ston par yang spyod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon ngo bo nyid med thabs kyi sku gsum gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yon tan mnga' zhing chos ston par yang spyod do //
translated: Thus the master Asvabhāva asserts that the body of the three pristine wisdoms is endowed with the qualities of form, sound, and so on, and also acts to teach the Dharma.🔽Therefore the Subcommentary states:

original: zhes 'dod de de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa ni rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'dod de de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa ni rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Enjoyment Body and Emanation Body are the special subsequent pristine wisdoms.

original: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rab tu phye ba gang yin pa des bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad @10a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rab tu phye ba gang yin pa des bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad @10a * //
translated: If that is so, why is it explained that the nature of the teaching is created by the analysis of the consciousnesses of the listeners?

original: la mthong ba po'i rnam par rig pa la gzugs la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de la sprul pa'i sku zhes ma bstan /
analyzed: la mthong ba po'i rnam par rig pa la gzugs la sogs pa snang ba gang yin pa de la sprul pa'i sku zhes ma bstan /
translated: Why is it not taught that the appearance of form and so on in the consciousness of the seer is the Emanation Body?

original: phan tshun mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan tshun mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is taught in this way in order to summarize the two.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na sku dang bstan pa gnyis ka la rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan mnga' par slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa bzhin du bstan dgos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na sku dang bstan pa gnyis ka la rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan mnga' par slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa bzhin du bstan dgos so //
translated: In reality, as the master Dharmā-pala explains, it is necessary to teach that both the body and the teaching have a nature of reflection.

original: gal te sku yang gzugs brnyan yin na ci'i phyir mthong ba po'i rnam par rig pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi sku zhes ma bstan /
analyzed: gal te sku yang gzugs brnyan yin na ci'i phyir mthong ba po'i rnam par rig pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi sku zhes ma bstan /
translated: If the body is a reflection, why is it not taught that it is the reflection of the body of the one who sees?

original: de ltar rung bar nges pa yang med de kla na ka dang mi 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rung bar nges pa yang med de kla na ka dang mi 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not certain that it is suitable, because it is not related to the one who sees.

original: gzhan yang bstan pas shes pa bskyed pa la nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa bskyed par nye ba'i phyir sku las sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo 'byung ba des na re zhig gzugs dang / sems la sogs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan pas shes pa bskyed pa la nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa bskyed par nye ba'i phyir sku las sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo 'byung ba des na re zhig gzugs dang / sems la sogs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, since the teaching generates knowledge, it is suitable to generate knowledge characterized by the consciousness of the one who hears. Therefore, since the nature of the Buddha arises from the body, it is explained that the body is the nature of the Buddha.

original: nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa las rnam par gyur pa bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid de zag pa dang bcas pa zhig gam 'on te zag pa med pa zhig yin /
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa las rnam par gyur pa bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid de zag pa dang bcas pa zhig gam 'on te zag pa med pa zhig yin /
translated: Is the nature of the teaching a transformation of the consciousness of the listener, and is it contaminated or uncontaminated?

original: sde snod gsum po dag gis rgya gar yul pa dag rnam pa gnyis su bshad do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: sde snod gsum po dag gis rgya gar yul pa dag rnam pa gnyis su bshad do zhes bstan te /
translated: The Indians of the three scriptural collections explain it in two ways.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du gang zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nges par zag pa med do //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du gang zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nges par zag pa med do //
translated: Some say: That which is a transformation of an uncontaminated mind is definitely uncontaminated.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnam par gyur pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnam par gyur pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: A transformation of a contaminated mind is of two types:

original: yang dag pa'i don du na zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called contaminated in the sense of the ultimate,

original: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems nyid yul du rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems nyid yul du rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a contaminated mind itself is transformed into an object.

original: chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i don gyi mtha' la ltos na ni zag pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i don gyi mtha' la ltos na ni zag pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: But in terms of the ultimate object that is the sphere of reality, it is called uncontaminated,🔽because it is the sphere of activity of the uncontaminated mind.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos kyi gzhung yang phal cher 'di la brten nas rnam par bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos kyi gzhung yang phal cher 'di la brten nas rnam par bshad do zhe'o //
translated: The treatise composed by Master Svābhāvika also explains it for the most part based on this.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnam par gyur pa ni nges par zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnam par gyur pa ni nges par zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Some say: A mind that is a transformation of a contaminated mind is definitely contaminated.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems las rnam par gyur pa ni nges par gcig tu zag ba med pa'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems las rnam par gyur pa ni nges par gcig tu zag ba med pa'o zhes ston te /
translated: A mind that is a transformation of an uncontaminated mind is definitely uncontaminated.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although this is explained in two ways,

original: slob dpon hyan tsang dang chos skyong ni bshad pa phyi ma ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang dang chos skyong ni bshad pa phyi ma ltar 'dod de /
translated: master Hīnayasaṃghabhadra asserts the latter explanation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Establishing Mere Consciousness explains:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa @10b med pa ni lta ba'i mtshan nyid nges par mtshungs la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa @10b med pa ni lta ba'i mtshan nyid nges par mtshungs la /
translated: Contaminated and uncontaminated minds definitely have the same characteristics of view.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshungs par nges pa yang med de /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshungs par nges pa yang med de /
translated: The characteristics of virtuous and so on are not definitely the same.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dren mar drangs nas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dren mar drangs nas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three aspects are drawn out and produced by the causes and conditions of the entity.🔽

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yang dag pa'i bstan pa nyid du rnam par gyur nas /🔽yang dag pa'i bstan bcos de las zag pa dang bcas pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yang dag pa'i bstan pa nyid du rnam par gyur nas / yang dag pa'i bstan bcos de las zag pa dang bcas pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: Because the impure is generated by causes and conditions that are impure by nature, and the pure is generated by causes and conditions that are pure by nature.🔽If the impure is transformed into the pure,🔽would the pure be generated from that treatise?

original: zag pa med pa'i phyin ci log gi bstan pa nyid du rnam par gyur nas phyin ci log gi bstan pa des zag pa med pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ram zhe na ;
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyin ci log gi bstan pa nyid du rnam par gyur nas phyin ci log gi bstan pa des zag pa med pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ram zhe na ;
translated: Or if the impure is transformed into the pure, would the pure be generated from that treatise?

original: de ltar bshad na yang nyes pa med na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na yang nyes pa med na /
translated: If you say that there is no error in explaining it in this way,

original: zag pa med pas rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pas rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the impure is transformed into the pure.🔽If the treatise is both impure and pure,

original: bstan pa la phyin ci log dang yang dag pa tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bstan pa la phyin ci log dang yang dag pa tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: then all would be both impure and pure.

original: 'on te gang zag la so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir thams cad 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin zhes bya bar 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te gang zag la so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir thams cad 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin zhes bya bar 'dod /
translated: Or, because there is a distinction of individuals into ordinary and noble, do you maintain that all are noble or that all are not noble?

original: de ltar bstan na yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar bstan na yang nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in teaching in this way,

original: 'di ltar rnam par gyur ba'i sems rnams gnyis su 'gyur bar rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par gyur ba'i sems rnams gnyis su 'gyur bar rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the transformation of mind is suitable to be twofold.

original: de la chos ston pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te sku gsum la brten nas bstan pa dang zhing rnams la brten nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ston pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te sku gsum la brten nas bstan pa dang zhing rnams la brten nas bstan pa'o //
translated: The distinction in teaching the Dharma is also twofold: that based on the three bodies and that based on the fields.

original: sku gsum la brten nas bstan pa zhes bya ba las brtsams nas dris ba sku gang la brten nas chos ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: sku gsum la brten nas bstan pa zhes bya ba las brtsams nas dris ba sku gang la brten nas chos ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: The question is raised: “Based on which body does the Buddha teach the Dharma?”

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of the Sarvāstivādins is that there are two kinds of buddhas:

original: dang po ni sku 'khrungs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po ni sku 'khrungs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is the born-body buddha,

original: yab yum las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sku 'khrungs so //
analyzed: yab yum las zag pa dang bcas pa'i sku 'khrungs so //
translated: whose body is born from a father and mother and is subject to defilement.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi sku'i sangs rgyas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi sku'i sangs rgyas 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the Buddha of the Truth Body.

original: cha rnam pa lnga'i chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: cha rnam pa lnga'i chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Truth Body is fivefold.

original: sku rnam pa gnyis las 'khrungs pa'i skus chos ston par mdzad kyi chos kyi skus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sku rnam pa gnyis las 'khrungs pa'i skus chos ston par mdzad kyi chos kyi skus ni ma yin te /
translated: The body that is born from the two kinds of bodies teaches the Dharma, but not the Truth Body,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na chos ston par mi mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhe'am /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na chos ston par mi mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhe'am /
translated: because it does not teach the Dharma in the state of meditative equipoise.

original: mdo sde pa'i gzhung las kyang sku rnam pa gnyis yod de /🔽de gnyi gas kyang chos ston par spyod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung las kyang sku rnam pa gnyis yod de / de gnyi gas kyang chos ston par spyod do zhes zer te /
translated: Or, according to the Sautrantikas, there are two kinds of bodies,🔽and both of them teach the Dharma.

original: de dag gi gzhung gis zag pa med pas kyang sgra skad mngon par bskyed nas /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung gis zag pa med pas kyang sgra skad mngon par bskyed nas /
translated: According to their scriptures, even the uncontaminated teaches the Dharma by generating speech.

original: 'phags @11a * //
analyzed: 'phags @11a * //
translated: The noble ones

original: pa'i gsung rab mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i gsung rab mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: compose the scriptures.

original: zhe'o // 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
analyzed: zhe'o // 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, according to the Mahayana scriptures,

original: sku rnam pa gsum mnga' ste /
analyzed: sku rnam pa gsum mnga' ste /
translated: the Buddha has three bodies.

original: chos ston par mdzad pa dang mi mdzad pa de yang mu rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
analyzed: chos ston par mdzad pa dang mi mdzad pa de yang mu rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
translated: The teaching and nonteaching of the Dharma is divided into four alternatives.

original: de la dang po gcig ni ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: de la dang po gcig ni ston par mdzad la /
translated: The first alternative is that which teaches.

original: gnyis ni ston par mi mdzad de ;
analyzed: gnyis ni ston par mi mdzad de ;
translated: Two are not teachers,

original: 'di lta ste chos kyi sku ni nang gi mngon par rtogs pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos kyi sku ni nang gi mngon par rtogs pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma body is the domain of inner realization,🔽and the emanation body is not a continuum.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Vajracchedika-sutra says:

original: longs spyod sprul pa yang dag sangs rgyas min //
analyzed: longs spyod sprul pa yang dag sangs rgyas min //
translated: The enjoyment body and the emanation body are not the true Buddha,

original: de bzhin chos 'chad pa yang ma yin te //🔽zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: de bzhin chos 'chad pa yang ma yin te // zhes 'byung bas /
translated: and likewise, the teaching of the Dharma is not.

original: sku gnyis ni chos ston pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sku gnyis ni chos ston pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the two bodies are not the teacher.

original: gnyis pa ni gnyis ni ston par mdzad la //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gnyis ni ston par mdzad la //
translated: The second verse shows that two are teachers,

original: gcig ni ston par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: gcig ni ston par mi mdzad de /
translated: but one is not a teacher.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa la gsung mnga' ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni tshig gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa la gsung mnga' ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni tshig gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The enjoyment body and the emanation body are teachers because they possess speech, but the Dharma body, suchness, is not a teacher because it is free of the characteristics of words.

original: gsum pa ni sum char yang chos ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sum char yang chos ston par mdzad de /
translated: The third verse shows that all three teach the Dharma,

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bcur byas pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bcur byas pa las ji skad du /
translated: as the Daśabhūmika-sūtra says:

original: de la chos kyi sku'i sangs rgyas chos ston par mdzad pa ni nang gi so sor rig pa 'phags pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku'i sangs rgyas chos ston par mdzad pa ni nang gi so sor rig pa 'phags pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha of the Dharma Body teaches the Dharma because of the inner individual awareness which is the domain of the noble ones.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston par mdzad pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mnyam pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston par mdzad pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mnyam pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha of Complete Enjoyment teaches the Dharma because of the equality of the intrinsic identity of all things.

original: sprul pa'i skus chos ston par mdzad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus chos ston par mdzad pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha of Transformation teaches the Dharma because of the teaching of the six perfections and so on.

original: zhes bya ba nas rgya cher gsungs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas rgya cher gsungs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: This is stated in detail.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las kyang phal cher 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: In the noble Lankavatara Sutra, which is divided into four sections, it is stated in a way that is for the most part in agreement with this.

original: bzhi pa ni sum char yang chos ston par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sum char yang chos ston par mi mdzad de /
translated: The fourth does not teach the Dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni gsung mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag pa'i 'chad pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni gsung mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni yang dag pa'i 'chad pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma Body of Reality does not have speech, the Enjoyment Buddha does not have manifest activity, and the Emanation Tathāgata is not a true expounder.

original: sku rnam pa bzhi dang sbyar na mu rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: sku rnam pa bzhi dang sbyar na mu rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: When applied to the four bodies, there are five alternatives.

original: de la dang po ni gcig ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gcig ston par mdzad la /
translated: The first is that one is the expounder,

original: gsum ni 'chad par mi mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum ni 'chad par mi mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: but the other three are not expounders.

original: 'di lta ste chos kyi sku ni ngag gi so sor rig pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir dang / @11b nyid kyi brten pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos kyi sku ni ngag gi so sor rig pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir dang / @11b nyid kyi brten pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma Body is not the expounder because it is the domain of the individual knowledge of speech,

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / sku gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / sku gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: and the other two bodies are not the expounders because they do not have manifest activity,

original: yang dag pa'i 'chad pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'chad pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the Emanation Body is not a true expounder.

original: gnyis pa ni gnyis 'chad par mdzad la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gnyis 'chad par mdzad la /
translated: The second is that two are expounders,

original: gnyis 'chad par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: gnyis 'chad par mi mdzad de /
translated: but two are not expounders.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: gzhan yang yongs su longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa dag yin gyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa dag yin gyis /
translated: Moreover, the enjoyment body and the emanation body teach the Dharma.

original: sku gzhan gnyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sku gzhan gnyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The other two bodies do not,

original: tshig mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free of speech and free of all effort.

original: gsum pa ni gsum 'chad par mdzad la gcig ni mi 'chad de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gsum 'chad par mdzad la gcig ni mi 'chad de /
translated: The third position is that three bodies teach the Dharma, but not the fourth.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni tshig gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni tshig gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma body of reality does not teach the Dharma, because it is free of the characteristics of speech.

original: bzhi pa ni bzhi char yang 'chad par mdzad de /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bzhi char yang 'chad par mdzad de /
translated: The fourth position is that all four bodies teach the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: The noble Descent into Laṅkā says,

original: ji skad du sku gsum char gyis chos 'chad do //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du sku gsum char gyis chos 'chad do // zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: “The three bodies teach the Dharma.”

original: sprul pa'i sku las rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku las rnam pa gnyis su phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The emanation body is divided into two kinds.

original: lnga pa ni bzhi char yang 'chad par yang mi mdzad de /
analyzed: lnga pa ni bzhi char yang 'chad par yang mi mdzad de /
translated: The fifth position is that all four bodies do not teach the Dharma.

original: tshig mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / yang dag pa 'chad pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / yang dag pa 'chad pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not a speaker, because he does not act, and because he is not a teacher.

original: de ltar mu tha dad pa mang po yod mod kyi /🔽slob dpon nye ba'i 'od la sogs pas gzhan yongs su longs spyod pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i skus chos 'chad do zhes bshad pa de yang dag pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mu tha dad pa mang po yod mod kyi / slob dpon nye ba'i 'od la sogs pas gzhan yongs su longs spyod pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i skus chos 'chad do zhes bshad pa de yang dag pa'i don yin te /
translated: Although there are many such different opinions,🔽the masters Upagupta and so on explain that the enjoyment body and the emanation body of the Buddha teach the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: This is the correct interpretation, because the commentary to the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i sku'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa gnyis las yongs su dag pa 'di zhing gang gis bsdus /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i sku'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa gnyis las yongs su dag pa 'di zhing gang gis bsdus /
translated: From among the two kinds of buddha lands, the enjoyment body land and the emanation body land, which land is the pure land?

original: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: In which body does the Buddha who teaches this scripture reside?

original: kha cig ni sprul pa'i zhing du sprul pa'i skus chos 'chad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni sprul pa'i zhing du sprul pa'i skus chos 'chad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that in the emanation body land the emanation body teaches the Dharma.

original: kha cig ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus chos bshad do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus chos bshad do zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: The Enjoyment Body explains the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i tshe /
translated: In reality, when Buddha Śākyamuni taught this sūtra,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa man chad kyi 'khor rnams kyis ni sprul pa'i skus zhing yongs su ma dag pa 'dir chos 'chad par mthong la /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa man chad kyi 'khor rnams kyis ni sprul pa'i skus zhing yongs su ma dag pa 'dir chos 'chad par mthong la /
translated: the retinue on the level of resolute conduct and below saw the Dharma being explained by the emanation body in this impure realm.

original: sa la gnas pa'i 'khor mang po rnams kyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par chos 'chad pa @12a * //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa'i 'khor mang po rnams kyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par chos 'chad pa @12a * //
translated: The retinue on the level of the ten grounds saw the Dharma being explained by the enjoyment body in a pure buddha realm.

original: mthong ste / thos pa mtshungs kyang mthong ba ni so so tha dad do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthong ste / thos pa mtshungs kyang mthong ba ni so so tha dad do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Although they heard the same Dharma, what they saw was individually different.

original: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Sūtra of the King of the Genuine Dharma.

original: gal te de de ltar sku rnam pa gnyis chos 'chad par mdzad na /
analyzed: gal te de de ltar sku rnam pa gnyis chos 'chad par mdzad na /
translated: If the two types of bodies teach the Dharma in that way,

original: 'phags pa la dkar gshegs pa la sogs pa ji lta bu go zhing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa la dkar gshegs pa la sogs pa ji lta bu go zhing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: how is the Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra and so on to be understood and explained?

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las ji skad du des na de'i phyir ngas 'di skad du gang gi nub mo ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba de'i bde'i
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las ji skad du des na de'i phyir ngas 'di skad du gang gi nub mo ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba de'i bde'i
translated: Therefore, I have said, “On the night I fully awakened to perfect buddhahood and on the night I will pass into parinirvāṇa,

original: bar du yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad mi 'chad /
analyzed: bar du yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad mi 'chad /
translated: in between those two, I have not uttered a single syllable, will not utter a single syllable, and do not utter a single syllable.”🔽And it also says, “What is taught in the sūtras is the teaching of the Buddha.”

original: 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde nyid las gang bshad pa ni sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde nyid las gang bshad pa ni sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: And the noble Perfection of Wisdom says,

original: sems can rnams so so nas bcom ldan 'das ni bdag gcig pu'i phyir chos 'chad do snyam du sems kyang /
analyzed: sems can rnams so so nas bcom ldan 'das ni bdag gcig pu'i phyir chos 'chad do snyam du sems kyang /
translated: “Sentient beings each think, ‘The Bhagavat teaches the Dharma just for me alone.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gdod ma nas 'chad dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gdod ma nas 'chad dam /
translated: But do the Tathāgatas teach from the beginning?

original: bstan pa med do zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde de nyid las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thog ma nas tha ma'i bar du yi ge 'bru gcig kyang ma bshad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa med do zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde de nyid las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thog ma nas tha ma'i bar du yi ge 'bru gcig kyang ma bshad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: and “There is no teaching,” and also in that same sutra, “From beginning to end, the buddhas and bodhisattvas have not explained a single syllable.”

original: kun rdzob kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas kyis bshad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas kyis bshad do //
translated: The Buddha explained in terms of the conventional.

original: zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: don dam pa la brten nas mi ma bshad do zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa la brten nas mi ma bshad do zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: He said that he did not explain in terms of the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las don dam pa'i tshul la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las don dam pa'i tshul la ni /
translated: Therefore, the great treatise, the Hundred Thousand Perfection of Wisdom, says that in the system of the ultimate,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad chad pa'i phyir /
translated: since all conceptual elaborations are eliminated,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos gang yang brjod du yod pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos gang yang brjod du yod pa'am /
translated: the Tathagatas do not express any phenomenon at all,🔽and they do not apprehend any phenomenon at all.

original: chos gang yang cung zad dmigs su yod pa ma yin yang kun rdzob kyi rjes su rnam par gzhag pas nyes pa med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos gang yang cung zad dmigs su yod pa ma yin yang kun rdzob kyi rjes su rnam par gzhag pas nyes pa med do zhes bshad do //
translated: However, since they are posited in terms of the conventional, there is no fault.

original: yang na ma bshad do zhes gsungs pa yang don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: yang na ma bshad do zhes gsungs pa yang don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: Also, it is not explained is stated for three reasons.

original: de la dang po ni de bzhin nyid tshig gi brjod pa la sogs pa mtshan ma sna tshogs pa dang bral ba la dgongs pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni de bzhin nyid tshig gi brjod pa la sogs pa mtshan ma sna tshogs pa dang bral ba la dgongs pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The first is that it is not explained because it is intended to be free from various signs, such as the expression of words in suchness.

original: de'i phyir lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir @12b byas pa las ci'i rgyus bshad pa med pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir @12b byas pa las ci'i rgyus bshad pa med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in the four-fascicle Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra, it is said, “For what reason is it not explained?

original: sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'o zhes gsungs /
translated: It is explained by the Buddha.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: blo gros chen po ngas chos rnam pa gnyis la dgongs nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po ngas chos rnam pa gnyis la dgongs nas de skad smras so //
translated: “Mahāmati, I have said that in consideration of two dharmas.

original: chos gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two dharmas?🔽They are as follows: the dharma of one’s own realization and the dharma that abides by its own nature.”

original: 'di lta ste rang gis mngon par rtogs pa'i chos dang / ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos te zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde de nyid bam po bcur byas pa las /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang gis mngon par rtogs pa'i chos dang / ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos te zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde de nyid bam po bcur byas pa las /
translated: And in the ten-fascicle version of that sūtra, it says:

original: rang gi lus nang gi so sor rig pa la brten pa'i chos dang / ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi lus nang gi so sor rig pa la brten pa'i chos dang / ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Dharma that is based on the individual’s own body and the Dharma that abides by its very essence.

original: rgya cher ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is as it appears in that sutra.

original: mdo sde de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of that sutra is as follows.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa gcig la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa gcig la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two meanings in the one aspect of suchness.

original: nang gi rang gis mngon par rtogs pa 'di dang de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: nang gi rang gis mngon par rtogs pa 'di dang de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: This inner realization by oneself and the essence of the Tathagata, whether he appears or not,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rtag tu gnas pas de bzhin nyid de tshig gi brjod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ma bshad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rtag tu gnas pas de bzhin nyid de tshig gi brjod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ma bshad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: abides forever as the nature of reality. Because it is free from verbal expression, it is not explained.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las /🔽gang gi nub mo mngon sangs rgyas //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las / gang gi nub mo mngon sangs rgyas //
translated: Therefore, in the four-part chapter of the noble Lankavatara Sutra,🔽it says:🔽On the night I attained enlightenment

original: gang gi nub mo mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: gang gi nub mo mya ngan 'das //
translated: and on the night I will pass into nirvana,

original: de dag gnyis kyi bar du yang //
analyzed: de dag gnyis kyi bar du yang //
translated: in between those two

original: nga yis cung zad bshad pa med //
analyzed: nga yis cung zad bshad pa med //
translated: I have nothing to explain.

original: rang gis mngon rtogs chos gnas pas //
analyzed: rang gis mngon rtogs chos gnas pas //
translated: Since the self-realized ones abide in the Dharma,

original: de phyir ngas ni 'di skad bshad //🔽nga dang sangs rgyas de dag la //
analyzed: de phyir ngas ni 'di skad bshad // nga dang sangs rgyas de dag la //
translated: therefore I have explained it thus.🔽There is no difference whatsoever

original: bye brag gyur pa ci yang med //
analyzed: bye brag gyur pa ci yang med //
translated: between me and those buddhas.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las //
translated: Moreover, the Sūtra Requested by the King of Humans says:

original: nyan pa med cing bshad med nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: nyan pa med cing bshad med nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: Like space, there is no listener and no explanation.

original: chos ni chos nyid mtshungs shing nyan dang bshad pa 'dra //
analyzed: chos ni chos nyid mtshungs shing nyan dang bshad pa 'dra //
translated: Dharma is the same as dharmatā, and listener and explanation are similar.

original: chos rnams kun dang gcig cing de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams kun dang gcig cing de bzhin nyid //
translated: All dharmas are one, and that is suchness.🔽Moreover, in the commentary on the noble Diamond Cutter composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las gang la la zhig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos 'chad pa yod do zher zer na /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las gang la la zhig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos 'chad pa yod do zher zer na /
translated: Whoever says, “The tathāgatas have the existence of explaining the Dharma,”

original: de ni sangs rgyas la skur pa btab pa yin pas /🔽ngas bshad pa'i don mi shes so zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas la skur pa btab pa yin pas / ngas bshad pa'i don mi shes so zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: is denigrating the Buddha.🔽They do not understand the meaning of what I have explained.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las //
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: sangs rgyas ji bzhin chos kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji bzhin chos kyang de bzhin te //
translated: The Dharma is just like the Buddha.

original: bstan pa gnyis po @13a * //
analyzed: bstan pa gnyis po @13a * //
translated: The two teachings

original: shin tu tha dad kyang //
analyzed: shin tu tha dad kyang //
translated: are very different,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang yongs su ma bral bas //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang yongs su ma bral bas //
translated: but they are not separate from the dharma-dhātu.

original: chos bstan pa la rang gi mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: chos bstan pa la rang gi mtshan nyid med //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma has no intrinsic identity.

original: ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'brel ba las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'brel ba las /
translated: The connection with this is:

original: gnyis po shin tu tha dad pa //
analyzed: gnyis po shin tu tha dad pa //
translated: The two are very different.

original: zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos dang don to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos dang don to zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the teaching Dharma and its meaning.

original: de la bstan bcos 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of this treatise is this:

original: sprul pa'i sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni de bzhin nyid las gud na rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan med de /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni de bzhin nyid las gud na rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan med de /
translated: The Tathāgata of the emanation body is not separate from suchness with a different intrinsic identity.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas de bzhin nyid las gud na rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan med pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas de bzhin nyid las gud na rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan med pa ste /
translated: Just as the Buddha is not separate from suchness with a different intrinsic identity,

original: de bzhin du bstan pa'i chos dang don kyang de bzhin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa'i chos dang don kyang de bzhin no zhes ston to //
translated: so too are the teaching Dharma and its meaning. This is taught.

original: gnyis pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa tha dad pa med pa la dgongs nas ma bshad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa tha dad pa med pa la dgongs nas ma bshad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The second is that the teachings of the Tathagatas are not differentiated.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, the commentary to the noble Diamond Cutter Sutra explains:

original: mdo las ji skad du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos bshad pa med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos bshad pa med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: “How should one understand the meaning of the statement in the sutra, ‘Subhuti, because the Tathagata does not explain the Dharma’?

original: chos gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis ni gsungs la /
analyzed: chos gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis ni gsungs la /
translated: Because there is no Dharma that the Tathagata alone has explained and

original: sangs rgyas gzhan gyis ni ma gsungs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan gyis ni ma gsungs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: other Buddhas have not explained.”

original: gsum pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos la dgongs nas ma bshad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos la dgongs nas ma bshad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The third is that the Dharma is not explained in consideration of the Dharma that has fallen into letters.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa bam po bzhir byas pa las /
translated: Therefore, the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka in four sections explains:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos mi ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos mi ston te /
translated: “The Tathagata does not teach the Dharma that has fallen into letters.

original: yi ge rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the existence and nonexistence of letters are not perceived.”

original: gzhan du ni yi ger ma lhung bas chos bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan du ni yi ger ma lhung bas chos bstan to //
translated: Elsewhere, he taught the Dharma without using letters.

original: gal te kha cig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos ston to //
analyzed: gal te kha cig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos ston to //
translated: If someone were to say, “The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma using letters,”

original: zhes zer na de ni brdzun du smra ba de chos nyid ni yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes zer na de ni brdzun du smra ba de chos nyid ni yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that would be a lie, because the way things really are is free of letters.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the buddhas and bodhisattvas do not teach even a single letter, nor will they do so.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: And so on at great length.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las blo gros chen po gal te chos thams cad ma bshad na ni bstan pa'i chos rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las blo gros chen po gal te chos thams cad ma bshad na ni bstan pa'i chos rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the same text says, “Mahāmati, if all phenomena were not taught, the taught Dharma would perish.

original: bstan pa'i chos zhig na ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos zhig na ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the taught Dharma perishes, then buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas would not exist.

original: de dag med na ni gang zhig su @13b la ci zhig bshad de zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag med na ni gang zhig su @13b la ci zhig bshad de zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If they did not exist, then what would be explained to whom?

original: gong du bstan pa'i mdo sde dgu dag las gsungs pa dang sbyar na yi ger lhung ba'i chos mi gsung mod kyi /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i mdo sde dgu dag las gsungs pa dang sbyar na yi ger lhung ba'i chos mi gsung mod kyi /
translated: When applied to the nine sūtras taught above, the Buddha did not teach the Dharma that fell into letters.

original: 'on kyang yi ger ma lhung ba'i sde snod gsum 'phags pa'i gsung rab mi 'chad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yi ger ma lhung ba'i sde snod gsum 'phags pa'i gsung rab mi 'chad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that he did not explain the three unfallen piṭakas, the scriptures of the āryas.🔽Therefore, in the Sūtra of the Teaching of Vimalakīrti,

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: it says:

original: de la chos 'chad pa po yang bshad pa dang / bstan pa med la /
analyzed: de la chos 'chad pa po yang bshad pa dang / bstan pa med la /
translated: “The one who explains the Dharma does not explain or teach.

original: nyan pa po yang thos pa med thob pa yang med de /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang thos pa med thob pa yang med de /
translated: The one who listens does not hear or attain.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bus sgyu ma'i skyes bu la chos ston pa ltar de lta bu'i bsam pas chos bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bus sgyu ma'i skyes bu la chos ston pa ltar de lta bu'i bsam pas chos bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Like an illusory person teaching the Dharma to an illusory person, the Dharma should be explained with that kind of thought.”

original: don des na gsungs pa dang ma gsungs pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: don des na gsungs pa dang ma gsungs pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, in that sense, there is no contradiction between what is taught and what is not taught.

original: de la zhing la brten pa'i khyad par bstan pa zhes bya ba yang ji ltar 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas chos ston pa rnam pa bcu'i khyad par gsungs pa lta bu de /
analyzed: de la zhing la brten pa'i khyad par bstan pa zhes bya ba yang ji ltar 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas chos ston pa rnam pa bcu'i khyad par gsungs pa lta bu de /
translated: The explanation of the difference in terms of the field is like the noble Laṅkâvatāra Sūtra’s teaching of the Dharma in terms of the ten differences of the Buddha-fields.

original: dang po tshig gis chos bstan pa nas /
analyzed: dang po tshig gis chos bstan pa nas /
translated: The first is the teaching of the Dharma by means of words,

original: tha ma lus bskyod pas chos ston pa'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma lus bskyod pas chos ston pa'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the last is the teaching of the Dharma by means of the shaking of the body.

original: mdo sde de nyid bam po bcur byas pa las kyang /
analyzed: mdo sde de nyid bam po bcur byas pa las kyang /
translated: And in that very sūtra, in the ten chapters,

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang gsol ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang gsol ba /
translated: the bodhisattva Mahāmati again asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das brjod pa mchis na ni dngos po rnams kyang mchis par 'gyur la dngos po rnams ma mchis na ni brjod pa yang ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das brjod pa mchis na ni dngos po rnams kyang mchis par 'gyur la dngos po rnams ma mchis na ni brjod pa yang ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Bhagavān, if there is expression, then things will exist, and if things do not exist, then expression will not exist.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: blo gros chen po dngos po med pa dag kyang brjod pa ni yod de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dngos po med pa dag kyang brjod pa ni yod de /
translated: “Mahāmati, even non-things are expressed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'o ;
translated: the horn of a rabbit and so on.”

original: / blo gros chen po ri bong gi rva ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin yang brjod pa ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / blo gros chen po ri bong gi rva ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin yang brjod pa ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Mahāmati, a rabbit’s horns do not exist, nor do they not exist, but they are spoken of because they exist.

original: khyod kyis smras pa'i don de ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa'i don de ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of what you have said will be lost.

original: blo gros chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na brjod pas chos ston pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na brjod pas chos ston pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “Mahāmati, the Dharma is not taught in all buddha-fields by means of speech.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: kyi zhing la la na ni mig rig rig byas pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kyi zhing la la na ni mig rig rig byas pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In some buddha-fields, the Dharma is taught by the sign of a frown.🔽In some

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni bgad pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni glal ba la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni bgad pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do // sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni glal ba la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In some buddha-fields, a smile is called the teaching of the Dharma.🔽In some buddha-fields, a yawn is called the teaching of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni se gol byas pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni se gol byas pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In some buddha-fields, a finger snap is called the teaching of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni rjes su dran pa la chos bshad pa zhas brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni rjes su dran pa la chos bshad pa zhas brjod do //
translated: In some buddha-fields, recollection is called the teaching of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni lus bskyod pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni lus bskyod pa la chos bshad pa zhes brjod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: In some buddha-fields, a bodily movement is called the teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa dang sbyar na /
translated: If we apply this to the noble Sūtra Taught by Vimalakīrti and so on,

original: ji tsam du rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan 'dogs pa thams cad ni chos ston pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan 'dogs pa thams cad ni chos ston pa zhes bya ste /
translated: all the various kinds of helpful activity are called the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las la lan na ni 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las la lan na ni 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //
translated: Therefore, in that very sūtra, in some places light rays perform the activity of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin du la la na ni nam mkha' so //
analyzed: de bzhin du la la na ni nam mkha' so //
translated: Likewise, in some [Buddha-fields], the Buddha's work is done by space.

original: la la na ni sgra skad dang tshig gi brjod pa dang yi ges sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni rab tu zhi zhing tshig med pa dang brjod pa yang med /
analyzed: la la na ni sgra skad dang tshig gi brjod pa dang yi ges sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do // sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni rab tu zhi zhing tshig med pa dang brjod pa yang med /
