translated: In some [Buddha-fields], the Buddha's work is done by sounds, words, expressions, and letters.🔽In some Buddha-fields, the Buddha's work is done by the unconditioned, without peace, without words, without expression,

original: bstan pa yang med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa med pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //
analyzed: bstan pa yang med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa med pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed do //
translated: without teaching, without awareness, without manifest activity, and without conditioning.

original: de bzhin du kun dga' bo sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod lam dang / g-yo zhing bskyod pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ma yin pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun dga' bo sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod lam dang / g-yo zhing bskyod pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ma yin pa gang yang med do //
translated: In the same way, Ananda, there is nothing whatsoever that is not the Buddha's work in all the Buddha's activities, movements, and changes.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: zhib tu ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: In detail, it is as it occurs in that very [sutra].

original: de ltar chos ston pa tha dad par gyur pas yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pas so so'i zhing gis 'dul ba'i rjes su rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun pas phan 'dogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos ston pa tha dad par gyur pas yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pas so so'i zhing gis 'dul ba'i rjes su rnam pa sna tshogs mi mthun pas phan 'dogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, since the teachings of the Dharma are different, the various different kinds of benefit that are conferred by the skillful means of the Tathagatas in accordance with the individual realms to be trained are called the activities of the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas are not mutually contradictory.

original: gong du bstan pa lta bu chos ston pa de dag la ming la sogs pa yod dam zhe na /🔽nges pa med de zhing so so dag na chos ston pa yang nam mkha' la sogs pa shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa lta bu chos ston pa de dag la ming la sogs pa yod dam zhe na / nges pa med de zhing so so dag na chos ston pa yang nam mkha' la sogs pa shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Do those teachings of the Dharma, as they have been explained above, have names and so on?

original: chos bshad pa zhes brjod pa nas /
analyzed: chos bshad pa zhes brjod pa nas /
translated: There is no certainty, because in the individual realms, the teachings of the Dharma are said to be the explanation of the Dharma in order to generate the understanding of space and so on.🔽Up to:

original: ming la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa med de /
translated: There are no names and so on,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la @14b gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la @14b gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because unconditioned phenomena have no temporal stages.

original: brjod pa yang med bstan pa yang med pa la sogs pa rab tu zhi zhing tshig med pa'i sems la brtags pa tsam du ming la sogs pa rnam par gzhag na yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: brjod pa yang med bstan pa yang med pa la sogs pa rab tu zhi zhing tshig med pa'i sems la brtags pa tsam du ming la sogs pa rnam par gzhag na yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: And it is not contradictory to posit names, etc. as mere imputations on the mind that is utterly peaceful, without expression or demonstration, etc., and without words, because there are occasions of the conditioned mind, etc.

original: 'dus byas kyi sems la sogs pa la gnas skabs yod pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po gnyis pa /🔽de la gsum pa bsags pa rnam par phye bas sems kyi khyad par bstan pa zhes bya ba yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba byas pa las ji skad du brgyus zhing 'brel pa'i phyir mdo zhes bya'o zhes 'byung🔽ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi sems la sogs pa la gnas skabs yod pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po gnyis pa / de la gsum pa bsags pa rnam par phye bas sems kyi khyad par bstan pa zhes bya ba yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba byas pa las ji skad du brgyus zhing 'brel pa'i phyir mdo zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: The third, the explanation of the mind’s distinctions by way of the division of the accumulations, is also as it is related in the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by Master *Asvabhāva, where it says, “Because it is related and connected, it is called a sūtra.”🔽Here, the eight times are the times of the eight assemblies.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.

original: de la 'dir dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs shing nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa la drang po dang drang po ma yin par bshad pa dag bsags shing /
analyzed: de la 'dir dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs shing nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa la drang po dang drang po ma yin par bshad pa dag bsags shing /
translated: The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de la ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de la ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The eight assemblies are the eight assemblies of bodhisattvas.🔽The eight assemblies

original: dus brgyad ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: dus brgyad ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
translated: The eight times are also explained in two ways.

original: kha cig na re dus brgyad ni bsgyur ba'i sgra brgyad nyid de 'di ltar bsgyur ba'i sgra bdun gyi steng du 'bod pa'i sgras bsnan pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re dus brgyad ni bsgyur ba'i sgra brgyad nyid de 'di ltar bsgyur ba'i sgra bdun gyi steng du 'bod pa'i sgras bsnan pa ste /
translated: Some say: The eight times are the eight transformed sounds. Thus, in addition to the seven transformed sounds, the word call is added.

original: ji skad du skyes bu zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du skyes bu zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying person.

original: bsgyur ba'i sgra brgyad ni 'og nas rnam par dbye ba nyid de /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i sgra brgyad ni 'og nas rnam par dbye ba nyid de /
translated: The eight transformed sounds will be differentiated below.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos 'chad pa'i tshe bsgyur ba brgyad po las gang yang rung ba'i sgra cig brjod pas na de'i phyir dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos 'chad pa'i tshe bsgyur ba brgyad po las gang yang rung ba'i sgra cig brjod pas na de'i phyir dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus, when the tathāgatas explain the Dharma, they utter one of the eight transformed sounds. Therefore they are said to engage in the eight times.

original: kha cig ni sgra'i rig pa'i rab tu byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni sgra'i rig pa'i rab tu byed pa la brten nas /
translated: Some say: Based on the treatise on grammar,

original: nyin dang mtshan re re la dus bzhi bzhi yod pas gcig tu bsdus na /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan re re la dus bzhi bzhi yod pas gcig tu bsdus na /
translated: there are four times in each day and night. When they are combined,

original: dus brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: there are eight times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos 'chad pa yang dus brgyad po las gang yang rung ba cig gi rjes su 'gro bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos 'chad pa yang dus brgyad po las gang yang rung ba cig gi rjes su 'gro bas na /
translated: The Tathagatas' teaching of the Dharma is in accordance with any of the eight times.

original: de'i phyir dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be in accordance with the eight times.

original: de la drang po dang drang po ma yin par bshad pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: de la drang po dang drang po ma yin par bshad pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
translated: Here, the explanation of straightforward and not straightforward is also explained in three ways.

original: kha cig ni rang gi ngo bo nyid brjod pa'i phyir drang por bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rang gi ngo bo nyid brjod pa'i phyir drang por bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say that because it expresses its own nature, it is called straightforward explanation.

original: khyad par brjod pa'i phyir drang po ma yin par bshad pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: khyad par brjod pa'i phyir drang po ma yin par bshad pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Because it expresses distinctions, it is called not straightforward explanation.

original: kha cig ni tshig rkang ni drang por bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni tshig rkang ni drang por bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say that a verse line is a straightforward explanation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni drang po ma yin par bshad ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni drang po ma yin par bshad ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: A verse is a not straightforward explanation.

original: kha cig ni @15a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni @15a * //
translated: Some say that

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis las mdo sde mdo'i sde ni drang por bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis las mdo sde mdo'i sde ni drang por bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: among the twelve branches of scripture, the sutra collection is a straightforward explanation.

original: gzhan bcu gcig po dag ni drang po ma yin par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan bcu gcig po dag ni drang po ma yin par bshad pa'o //
translated: The other eleven are said to be not straightforward.

original: zhes bya'o zer te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o zer te /
translated: This is what they say.

original: de'i don du na dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs shing nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi ming dang yi ge dang tshigs la sogs pa bsags shing rab tu phye bar gyur pa gang yin pa des bstan pa ngo bo
analyzed: de'i don du na dus brgyad kyi rjes su zhugs shing nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi ming dang yi ge dang tshigs la sogs pa bsags shing rab tu phye bar gyur pa gang yin pa des bstan pa ngo bo
translated: The meaning of this is that the collection and division of the names, letters, and words of the twelve branches of scripture in the consciousness of the listener is the teaching of the essence of the teaching.

original: nyid byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: nyid byed do zhes ston to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: ji lta bu zhig la nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa'i sems zhes bya /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig la nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa'i sems zhes bya /
translated: In what kind of consciousness of the listener is it taught?

original: ci'i phyir bsags pa rab tu phye ba zhes bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsags pa rab tu phye ba zhes bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is it taught as a collection and division?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na re zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la brten nas sems rnam pa lnga rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang sbyar na re zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la brten nas sems rnam pa lnga rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: In the context of the Bodhisattvabhumi, the five kinds of consciousness are distinguished on the basis of the six collections of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las gzhan yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las gzhan yang /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvabhumi says:🔽Moreover, the five kinds of consciousness are distinguished on the basis of the six collections of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa byung ba na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshol ba dang / nges pa'i sems rnam pa gsum dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa byung ba na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshol ba dang / nges pa'i sems rnam pa gsum dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: When visual consciousness arises, three types of mind are observed: that which arises from the presence of the eye, that which seeks, and that which determines.

original: de la dang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: The first is the visual consciousness itself.

original: gnyis pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The second is the mental consciousness.

original: de la nges pa'i sems phan chad nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar blta'o //
analyzed: de la nges pa'i sems phan chad nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar blta'o //
translated: From the mind that determines, there is the arising of defilement and purification.

original: de nas de'i rgyu mthun pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yang dge ba dang mi dge bar yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de'i rgyu mthun pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yang dge ba dang mi dge bar yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, from that, there arises a visual consciousness that is similar to it, whether it is wholesome or unwholesome.

original: rang gi rtog pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //🔽ji srid du yid de gzhan la rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur pa de srid du yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis ka dge ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no // ji srid du yid de gzhan la rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur pa de srid du yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis ka dge ba'am /
translated: It does not arise by the power of one’s own imagination.

original: nyon mongs pa can du rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as that mind is not distracted elsewhere, both the mental consciousness and the visual consciousness continue to function, whether wholesome or unwholesome.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa byung ba na ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi rnam par bshes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin nyid du rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa byung ba na ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi rnam par bshes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin nyid du rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the arising of eye consciousness up to the arising of body consciousness.

original: rnam pa lnga las dang po dang tha ma ni rnam pa drug dang ldan no //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga las dang po dang tha ma ni rnam pa drug dang ldan no //
translated: From among the five types, the first and last have six types.

original: bar ma gsum ni yid 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: bar ma gsum ni yid 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The three in the middle are only mental consciousness.

original: gzhan yang dang po gsum ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dang po gsum ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the first three are indeterminate.

original: tha ma gnyis ni dge ba dang mi dge bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni dge ba dang mi dge bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The last two are virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gzhan yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga'i 'og tu nges par tshol ba'i sems yod la /🔽@15b tshol ba'i sems kyi 'og tu ni rnam par g-yengs pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga'i 'og tu nges par tshol ba'i sems yod la / @15b tshol ba'i sems kyi 'og tu ni rnam par g-yengs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, after the five consciousnesses that arise from the actual basis, the mind that definitely searches exists.

original: rnam par g-yengs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: After the mind that definitely searches, the mind is either distracted or not distracted.

original: de'i 'og tu ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the five consciousnesses that arise from the actual basis arise.

original: rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur na ni gsum pa nges pa'i sems nas rgyu mthun pa'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur na ni gsum pa nges pa'i sems nas rgyu mthun pa'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not distracted, then the third, the ascertained mind, and so on up to the concordant cause, will occur.

original: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the mental faculty that arises from the presence of a sense object is of two kinds:

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang dus gcig pa'i nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid gcig pu'i nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang dus gcig pa'i nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid gcig pu'i nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: the mental consciousness that arises from the presence of the five sense consciousnesses and the mental consciousness that arises from the presence of the mental faculty alone, which is called the mind.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvabhumi says:

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med cing rnam par g-yeng bar gyur ba dang ma 'dris pa'i dmigs pa la ni 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med cing rnam par g-yeng bar gyur ba dang ma 'dris pa'i dmigs pa la ni 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med do //
translated: In that case, if the mental consciousness is not active and is distracted, and if the object is not familiar, then aspiration and so on do not operate.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye bar gnas pa las 'byung bar zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye bar gnas pa las 'byung bar zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: That mental consciousness should be said to arise from the presence of a sense object.

original: 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: It only takes the past as its object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid tshol ba ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid tshol ba ba'am /
translated: The mental faculty that arises immediately after the five collections of consciousness is called the mental faculty that seeks or ascertains.

original: nges pa ni gal te de'i yul de'i dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: nges pa ni gal te de'i yul de'i dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If its object is its object-support,

original: da ltar gyi yul can kho na zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul can kho na zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is called the present subject.

original: gal te yul de nyid la dmigs nas skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul de nyid la dmigs nas skye'o zhe na /
translated: If it arises by means of that object-support,

original: 'grel ba dag gis rnam pa bzhir bshad de /
analyzed: 'grel ba dag gis rnam pa bzhir bshad de /
translated: it is explained in the commentaries as four types.

original: de la kha cig ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug cing sems dang po gsum gyi go rims la mi brten pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug cing sems dang po gsum gyi go rims la mi brten pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Some say: The mental consciousness that engages by its own power and not in the order of the first three minds is called distracted.

original: rkyen drag po ma yin pa dang / ma goms pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i tshe ni lnga kun tu 'gro ba yod kyi /
analyzed: rkyen drag po ma yin pa dang / ma goms pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i tshe ni lnga kun tu 'gro ba yod kyi /
translated: When it focuses on an object that is not a powerful condition and is not a familiar object, the five omnipresent mental factors exist,

original: lnga yul so sor nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: lnga yul so sor nges pa ni med do //
translated: but the five with specific objects do not exist.

original: de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: At that time, that mental consciousness should be called the mind that arises from the immediately preceding condition.

original: sngon myong ba'i yul 'das pa la dmigs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa dang / tshol ba pa'i sems sam nges pa'i sems gang yin pa de dag ni snga ma'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rnam pa'i yul mngon sum du @16a * //
analyzed: sngon myong ba'i yul 'das pa la dmigs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa dang / tshol ba pa'i sems sam nges pa'i sems gang yin pa de dag ni snga ma'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rnam pa'i yul mngon sum du @16a * //
translated: It is called “that which focuses on the object of past experience” and “the mental consciousness that arises subsequent to the five collections of consciousness.”

original: gyur pa la dmigs pa kho na zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa la dmigs pa kho na zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is also called “the mind that seeks” or “the mind that ascertains.”🔽It should be said that these minds focus on the object that is the aspect of the five collections of consciousness that arose previously.

original: tshol ba po dang nges pa'i sems gnyis po gang yin pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po de dag gi rnam pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: tshol ba po dang nges pa'i sems gnyis po gang yin pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po de dag gi rnam pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that the two minds—the mind that seeks and the mind that ascertains—arise after focusing on the object that is the aspect of those five collections of consciousness.

original: slob dpon gzhan gsum gyi bshad pa dag ni sems rnam pa lnga bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //🔽'dir re zhig sems rnam pa lnga dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan gsum gyi bshad pa dag ni sems rnam pa lnga bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin no // 'dir re zhig sems rnam pa lnga dang sbyar nas /
translated: The explanations of the other three masters are like those that appear in the teaching on the five types of mind.

original: bsags pa'i don rab tu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bsags pa'i don rab tu bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of accumulation should be taught in connection with the five types of mind.

original: de la bsags pa zhes bya ba ni mdo de dag las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la bsags pa zhes bya ba ni mdo de dag las ji skad du /
translated: “Accumulation” is as stated in those sūtras:

original: 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste //
translated: Conditioned things are impermanent.

original: byung nas zad pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: byung nas zad pa'i chos can no //
translated: Having arisen, they possess the quality of cessation.

original: skyes nas nges par 'gag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skyes nas nges par 'gag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because having arisen, they definitely cease,

original: zhi ba de ni bde ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhi ba de ni bde ba yin // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: peace is happiness.

original: mdo sde'i tshad ma 'dis rtag par 'dzin pa dag 'jig par mdzad de /
analyzed: mdo sde'i tshad ma 'dis rtag par 'dzin pa dag 'jig par mdzad de /
translated: This valid cognition of the sūtras destroys the grasping of permanence.

original: 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag ste //
translated: Conditioned things are impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: byung nas zad pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: byung nas zad pa'i chos can no //
translated: Having arisen, they possess the quality of cessation.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos mtshungs pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos mtshungs pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is the example of similar attributes.

original: mar me'i 'od la sogs pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od la sogs pa smos pa'o //
translated: It refers to the light of a lamp and so on.

original: skyes nas nges par 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skyes nas nges par 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because having arisen, they definitely cease.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: This is the reason.

original: rigs pa des na zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa de ni mchog tu bde bar gyur ba yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa des na zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa de ni mchog tu bde bar gyur ba yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: By that reasoning, that peace, nirvāṇa, is supremely blissful.

original: de la re zhig tshig dang po la brten nas bsags pa rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig tshig dang po la brten nas bsags pa rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: Here, first, based on the first statement, the analysis of accumulation should be done.

original: 'di yang sgra rnam pa bzhi dang yi ge bzhi dang ming bzhi dang tshig bzhi dang brjod par bya ba'i don dang rab tu ldan no //
analyzed: 'di yang sgra rnam pa bzhi dang yi ge bzhi dang ming bzhi dang tshig bzhi dang brjod par bya ba'i don dang rab tu ldan no //
translated: This is also associated with the four kinds of sound, the four letters, the four names, the four words, and the four objects of expression.

original: don 'di la rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon dag gis rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: don 'di la rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon dag gis rnam pa gsum du bshad do //
translated: On this point, the Indian masters explain in three ways.

original: kha cig tu 'di skad du rnam shes bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: kha cig tu 'di skad du rnam shes bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe /
translated: Some say that when the letter “vi” is pronounced,

original: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i //
translated: the auditory consciousness arises from the sound that is its object-field.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las de dang dus gcig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba pa'i sems la sgra'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig yod de /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa las de dang dus gcig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba pa'i sems la sgra'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig yod de /
translated: From the auditory consciousness, the mental consciousness arises at the same time, and in the mental consciousness there is only the characteristic of sound.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lnga dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lnga dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mental consciousness that is associated with the five consciousnesses is a valid form of direct perception.

original: ming la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed do //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed do //
translated: It does not take names, etc., as its object.

original: tshol ba'i sems rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la sogs pa'i dmigs par bya ba'i yul yongs su tshol ba'i phyir ming la sogs pa la dmigs @16b par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshol ba'i sems rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la sogs pa'i dmigs par bya ba'i yul yongs su tshol ba'i phyir ming la sogs pa la dmigs @16b par mi byed do //
translated: The mind of investigation is the five groups of consciousness, etc., because they are the objects of observation of the investigation of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum po 'di las rnam par gyur pa'i sgra la sogs pa yod kyang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum po 'di las rnam par gyur pa'i sgra la sogs pa yod kyang /
translated: The sound, etc., that is a transformation of these three consciousnesses does exist,

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin du dmigs pa mi byed pa'i phyir bsags pa zhes mi bshad do //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin du dmigs pa mi byed pa'i phyir bsags pa zhes mi bshad do //
translated: but, like the characteristics of birth, etc., it is not an object of observation, and therefore it is not called an accumulation.

original: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: After the mind of ascertainment, there are three kinds of characteristics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sgra dang ming dang yi ge'o //
analyzed: sgra dang ming dang yi ge'o //
translated: sound, name, and letter.

original: 'du byed ces brjod pa'i tshe ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshol ba'i sems ni 'du byed ces bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed ces brjod pa'i tshe ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshol ba'i sems ni 'du byed ces bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When the term “conditioning” is used, the ear consciousness that arises from the ear faculty, the mental consciousness that is simultaneous with it, and the mind of investigation are only associated with the term “conditioning.”

original: snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as above.

original: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu ni mtshan nyid rnam pa drug mngon sum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu ni mtshan nyid rnam pa drug mngon sum du 'gyur te /
translated: After the ascertainment of the mind, the six characteristics become manifest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam shes bya ba'i sgra dang ming dang yi ge dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i sgra dang / ming dang yi ge'o //🔽mi zhes brjod pa'i tshe ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems la sogs /
analyzed: rnam shes bya ba'i sgra dang ming dang yi ge dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i sgra dang / ming dang yi ge'o // mi zhes brjod pa'i tshe ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems la sogs /
translated: the sound, name, and letters of consciousness, the sound, name, and letters of the formative forces, and the sound, name, and letters of the person.

original: mi zhes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig thob par gyur te /
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig thob par gyur te /
translated: When the word person is uttered, the sound, name, and letters of the person are obtained from the mind, etc. that are present.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as above.

original: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /
translated: After the ascertainment of the mind, three characteristics are obtained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam shes bya ba'i sgra dang ming dang yi ge dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i sgra dang / ming dang yi ge mi zhes bya ba'i sgra dang ming dang yi ge'o //
analyzed: rnam shes bya ba'i sgra dang ming dang yi ge dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i sgra dang / ming dang yi ge mi zhes bya ba'i sgra dang ming dang yi ge'o //
translated: the sound, name, and letters of consciousness, the sound, name, and letters of the formative forces, and the sound, name, and letters of the person.

original: rtag ces bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe ni nye bar gnas pa la sogs pa'i sems rtag ces bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag ces bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe ni nye bar gnas pa la sogs pa'i sems rtag ces bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the syllable “permanent” is uttered, the mind of abiding, etc., is obtained as the mere sound “permanent.”

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as before.

original: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu bzhi thob par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: nges pa'i sems kyi 'og tu ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu bzhi thob par 'gyur te ;
translated: After the mind of ascertainment, the fourteen characteristics are obtained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sgra bzhi dang yi ge bzhi dang ming bzhi dang tshig dang brjod par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra bzhi dang yi ge bzhi dang ming bzhi dang tshig dang brjod par bya ba'i don to //
translated: four sounds, four syllables, four names, phrases, and the meaning to be expressed.

original: des na rab tu nyung na yang rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: des na rab tu nyung na yang rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan par gyur na /
translated: Therefore, even if it is very brief, if it has sixteen aspects,

original: gdod yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdod yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then it becomes fully complete.

original: 'di ltar yi ge bzhi po de dag re re yang sems rnam pa bzhi dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge bzhi po de dag re re yang sems rnam pa bzhi dang ldan te /
translated: Thus, each of those four syllables has four minds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshol ba dang nges pa'i sems so //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshol ba dang nges pa'i sems so //
translated: the ear consciousness arisen from abiding, the mental consciousness that accompanies it, the seeking mind, and the ascertaining mind.

original: gal te rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i sems 'byung @17a * //🔽bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i sems 'byung @17a * // bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the mind is not distracted, then a defiled or pure mind arises.

original: ci rigs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs su shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as appropriate.

original: kha cig ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ming la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed pa'i don yang yod pas /🔽snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ming la sogs pa la dmigs par mi byed pa'i don yang yod pas / snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Some say: There is an object that is not the object of the ear consciousness that arises from the ear faculty and the mental consciousness that arises simultaneously with it, and that is the name base and so on.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshol ba pa phan chad ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pas de ni sgra dang ming dang yi ge la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i sems rnam pa bzhi yang 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro // tshol ba pa phan chad ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pas de ni sgra dang ming dang yi ge la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i sems rnam pa bzhi yang 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: This should be understood as before, because it is direct perception.

original: go rims bzhin du gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu bzhi yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu bzhi yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the subsequent investigation is direct perception, it obtains the four types of mind that investigate terms, names, letters and so on and it obtains three, six, nine and fourteen in order.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhe na /
translated: This should be understood as before.

original: rnam par bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni sems bcu gnyis dang ldan par gyur na gdod yongs su rdzogs par gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni sems bcu gnyis dang ldan par gyur na gdod yongs su rdzogs par gyur te /
translated: If this explanation is applied to the above, then the ten mental factors are complete when the twelve mental factors are present.

original: nges pa'i sems la sogs pas mang nyung ci tsam dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang ci rigs su shes par bya'o //🔽kha cig ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ming la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i don yang yod de /
analyzed: nges pa'i sems la sogs pas mang nyung ci tsam dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang ci rigs su shes par bya'o // kha cig ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ming la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i don yang yod de /
translated: The number of mental factors present in the minds of certainty and so on should be understood according to the circumstances.

original: de lta ma yin na tshol ba pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ming ji lta bu zhig yongs su tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshol ba pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ming ji lta bu zhig yongs su tshol bar byed de /
translated: Some say: The mental consciousness that simultaneously occurs with ear consciousness focuses on names and so on because if that were not so, then the mental consciousness that searches would not search for names and so on.

original: rigs pa des na rnam shes bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam shes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig 'thob par 'gyur la //
analyzed: rigs pa des na rnam shes bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam shes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig 'thob par 'gyur la //
translated: By that reasoning, when the syllable vijñāna is uttered, the ear consciousness derived from the elements would obtain only the sound vijñāna.

original: de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i don yang yod de /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i don yang yod de /
translated: Also, the meaning of the mental consciousness that accompanies it focuses on names, etc.

original: de ltar ma yin na tshol ba pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ming ji lta bu zhig yongs su tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na tshol ba pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ming ji lta bu zhig yongs su tshol bar byed de /
translated: If that were not so, how would the mental consciousness that seeks names seek names?

original: rigs pa des na /
analyzed: rigs pa des na /
translated: By that reasoning,

original: rnam shes bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam shes bya ba'i yi ge brjod pa'i tshe /
translated: when the syllable consciousness is uttered,

original: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam shes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam shes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig thob par 'gyur la /
translated: the consciousness that arises from the immediately preceding condition obtains the mere sound of the word consciousness.

original: de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sgra dang ming la sogs pa'i ldan par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sgra dang ming la sogs pa'i ldan par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that accompanies it obtains the sound, name, etc.

original: don 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su phye nas rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: don 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su phye nas rnam par bshad de /
translated: This meaning is also explained by dividing it into two.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems rnam pa gsum kho na dang ldan te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems rnam pa gsum kho na dang ldan te /
translated: Some say: The mind that arises from the immediately preceding condition possesses only three aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag ces bya @17b ba'i sgra brjod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rtag ces bya @17b ba'i sgra brjod pa'i tshe /
translated: When the word permanent is uttered,

original: rnam shes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang ming dang / yi ge la dmigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam shes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang ming dang / yi ge la dmigs par mi byed de /
translated: He does not focus on the words, names, and letters of the term consciousness, etc.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig pa'i nye bar gnas pa nas byung ba'i sems zhes brjod pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig pa'i nye bar gnas pa nas byung ba'i sems zhes brjod pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that is said to arise in dependence on the five collections of consciousness is direct perception.

original: gal te dmigs so zhes bya bar 'dod na ni rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma yang 'das pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshol ba pa'i sems kyi tshe gdod yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dmigs so zhes bya bar 'dod na ni rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma yang 'das pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshol ba pa'i sems kyi tshe gdod yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that it is focused, then the direct perception of a distracted mind would focus on the past, and the mind seeking it would be complete at the time of the first moment.

original: tshol ba pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis mang nyung ji tsam 'thob par 'gyur ba yang gnyis pas bshad pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: tshol ba pa la sogs pa'i sems kyis mang nyung ji tsam 'thob par 'gyur ba yang gnyis pas bshad pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The mind seeking it and so on would obtain it in the same way as explained in the Subcommentary.

original: kha cig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin par yang 'dod pa'i phyir 'das pa'i ming la sogs pa la dmigs par yang byed do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin par yang 'dod pa'i phyir 'das pa'i ming la sogs pa la dmigs par yang byed do zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: The mental consciousness that is simultaneous with the five collections of consciousness is also asserted to be a valid perceptual cognition and it also focuses on the name and so on of the past.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni sems rnam pa brgyad la yang bsags pa yongs su rdzogs par yod do //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni sems rnam pa brgyad la yang bsags pa yongs su rdzogs par yod do //
translated: If this explanation is applied to the eight types of mind, then the collection of the mind is complete.

original: gal te gong du bshad pa ltar lnga dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges par mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na ci'i phyir ming la sogs pa la yang dmigs par byed ces bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gong du bshad pa ltar lnga dang lhan cig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges par mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na ci'i phyir ming la sogs pa la yang dmigs par byed ces bstan zhe na /
translated: If the mental consciousness that is simultaneous with the five as explained above is definitely a valid perceptual cognition, why is it taught that it also focuses on name and so on?

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas kyang ming la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas kyang ming la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs par byed do //
translated: It is taught that it also focuses on the intrinsic identity of name and so on by means of a valid perceptual cognition.

original: rigs pa'i sgo'i bstan bcos la dmigs par mi byed do //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo'i bstan bcos la dmigs par mi byed do //
translated: It does not focus on the treatise on the door of reasoning.

original: zhes bshad pa yang ming la sogs pa la yang dmigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yang ming la sogs pa la yang dmigs par mi byed de /
translated: It is also explained that it does not focus on name and so on.

original: phan tshun 'ching ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'ching ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the effect of mutual binding.

original: yang na rgyu mthun pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rgyu mthun pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it is generated by the power of the homogeneous ear consciousness.

original: rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa drangs te bskyed pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa drangs te bskyed pa la ltos nas /
translated: The expression “distinction” refers to the ear consciousness that arises from the store consciousness, because it is generated by the latter.

original: gdod bsags pa nyid du gyur bar nges pa yang med do //
analyzed: gdod bsags pa nyid du gyur bar nges pa yang med do //
translated: But it is not certain that it is a collection.

original: de yan chad du ni re zhig gnas ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs la brten nas nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems la sogs pa'i bsags pa rab tu phye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de yan chad du ni re zhig gnas ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs la brten nas nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems la sogs pa'i bsags pa rab tu phye ba bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the distinctions of the collections of mind, etc., that arise from the store consciousness are explained in terms of the state in which the support has not yet been transformed.

original: gnas gyur pa'i skabs na ni sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la rab tu phye ba rdzogs par yod de /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i skabs na ni sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la rab tu phye ba rdzogs par yod de /
translated: When the support has been transformed, the distinctions are complete in a single moment of mind.

original: de yang ci rigs su rig par @18a * //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs su rig par @18a * //
translated: Moreover, this should be understood according to the circumstances.

original: bya'o // sems rnam pa lnga rgya cher bshad pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bya'o // sems rnam pa lnga rgya cher bshad pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The five kinds of mind explained in detail are the same as those in the explanation of the characteristics.

original: de la bzhi pa gsung gcig pa dang tha dad pa rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba las brtsams nas dris pa /
analyzed: de la bzhi pa gsung gcig pa dang tha dad pa rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba las brtsams nas dris pa /
translated: The question is asked:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'chad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'chad pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma,

original: gsung gcig tu gsung par mdzad dam zhe na /
analyzed: gsung gcig tu gsung par mdzad dam zhe na /
translated: is it the case that he speaks with a single voice?

original: smras pa so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: smras pa so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: It is said that each school explains this differently.

original: theg pa chung ngu'i sde pa tha dad pa'i gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i sde pa tha dad pa'i gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatises of the various Hīnayāna schools,

original: sde pa tha dad pa nyi shu 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: sde pa tha dad pa nyi shu 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
translated: the twenty different schools are divided into two groups and explained.

original: dang po ni thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde 'chad par byed pa la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams so //
analyzed: dang po ni thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde 'chad par byed pa la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams so //
translated: The first group is the Sarvâstivāda, the Sautrāntika, and so on.

original: de dag 'di skad du zer te /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du zer te /
translated: They say the following.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ma yin pa de dag gis kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ma yin pa de dag gis kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: The turning of the wheel of the Dharma was done by those who are not the speech of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gcig gis chos thams cad gsung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gcig gis chos thams cad gsung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is not the case that all phenomena are spoken of by the Tathāgata’s single voice.

original: rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to the extensive explanation.

original: gnyis pa ni phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / lan cig brjod pa'i sde pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par smra ba'i sde pa dang / bya mngal ba'i sde pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / lan cig brjod pa'i sde pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par smra ba'i sde pa dang / bya mngal ba'i sde pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The second is the Mahāsāṃghika, Ekavyāvahārika, Lokottaravāda, and Kukkuṭika schools and so on.

original: de dag mthun par 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung thams cad ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: de dag mthun par 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung thams cad ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: They agree in saying, “All the speech of the tathāgatas turns the wheel of the dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsung gcig gis chos thams cad gsung bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsung gcig gis chos thams cad gsung bar byed do //
translated: The tathāgatas speak all dharmas with a single speech.

original: zhes pa nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: ” and so on up to the extensive explanation.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i brjed byang byas pa las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i brjed byang byas pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in the notes on the noble Golden Light Sūtra composed by the master Parahitabhadra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: it says, “The speech of the tathāgatas is of two types.

original: dang po ni gsung ngag las byung ste /
analyzed: dang po ni gsung ngag las byung ste /
translated: The first is speech that arises from speech.

original: thams cad kyang chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
translated: All of it is the wheel of the dharma.🔽”

original: gnyis pa ni mthu'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba gsung ngag las ma byung ba 'khor lor ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mthu'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba gsung ngag las ma byung ba 'khor lor ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The second is distinguished by the quality of power, and is not included in the wheel of speech.🔽For example, when asked, “Where did you come from?”

original: ji ltar kun dga' bo la gang nas 'ongs so zhes dris pa la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das chos 'chad pa'i tshe mdun dang rgyab na 'dug pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa zhal bstan nas chos 'chad par mthong ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar kun dga' bo la gang nas 'ongs so zhes dris pa la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das chos 'chad pa'i tshe mdun dang rgyab na 'dug pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa zhal bstan nas chos 'chad par mthong ba lta bu ste /
translated: and when the Bhagavat was teaching the Dharma, those who were sitting in front and behind saw the Tathagata teaching the Dharma with his face turned toward them.

original: 'di yang de bzhin du mthu'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin du mthu'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: This is also distinguished by the quality of power.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas sde @18b pa rnams kyi brjed byang byas pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas sde @18b pa rnams kyi brjed byang byas pa las /
translated: Master Paramartha’s Abhidharma Commentary says:🔽The Tathagata’s speech benefits sentient beings.🔽When asked, “Where did you come from?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rnams ni sems can la phan 'dogs pas gang nas 'ongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rnams ni sems can la phan 'dogs pas gang nas 'ongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ni /
translated: and so on,

original: gzhan dag mgu ba dang / mos pa'i sems bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag mgu ba dang / mos pa'i sems bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is to please others and generate the mind of faith.

original: de yang chos kyi 'khor lo yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi 'khor lo yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: That is also the wheel of Dharma.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang /
translated: The treatise Vibhāṣā explains:

original: gzhung lugs kyi 'khor lo'i bstan bcos dang mthun pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: gzhung lugs kyi 'khor lo'i bstan bcos dang mthun pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The wheel of scripture is explained in two ways:🔽the wheel of scripture is the wheel of the Dharma and the wheel of the Vinaya.🔽If the wheel of scripture is the wheel of the Dharma, then why does the treatise Vibhāṣā say:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa'i skad kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pas 'dul bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de dag go bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa'i skad kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pas 'dul bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de dag go bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: “If the Bhagavān taught the four truths of the āryas in the āryan language and those to be guided understood it, would they understand it?”

original: de lta na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: gnyi ga la yang nyes pa yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang nyes pa yod de /
translated: Both are wrong.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gal te spyod do zhe na 'dul ba las bshad pa de dag ji ltar bshad cing go bar rung ste /
analyzed: gal te spyod do zhe na 'dul ba las bshad pa de dag ji ltar bshad cing go bar rung ste /
translated: If you say they did, then how could the explanation in the Vinaya be correct?

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gcig gi tshe lha'i rgyal po bzhi la /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gcig gi tshe lha'i rgyal po bzhi la /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the four kings:

original: sngar 'phags pa'i skad kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa na /
analyzed: sngar 'phags pa'i skad kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa na /
translated: “Previously, when I taught the four truths of the āryas in the āryan language,

original: rgyal po bzhi las gnyis kyis ni go bar gyur la /
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi las gnyis kyis ni go bar gyur la /
translated: two of the four kings understood it,

original: gnyis kyis ni go bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni go bar ma gyur to //
translated: but two did not understand it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la thugs brtse zhing phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la thugs brtse zhing phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: The Bhagavān, out of love and compassion for them,

original: lho phyogs kyi yul mtha' 'khob kyi skad kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gsungs pa na /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi yul mtha' 'khob kyi skad kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gsungs pa na /
translated: taught the four noble truths in the language of the border barbarians in the south.

original: rgyal po gnyis las gcig gis ni go bar gyur la /
analyzed: rgyal po gnyis las gcig gis ni go bar gyur la /
translated: One of the two kings understood,

original: gcig gis ni go bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: gcig gis ni go bar ma gyur to //
translated: but the other did not understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la thugs brtse zhing phan gdags pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la thugs brtse zhing phan gdags pa'i phyir yang /
translated: The Bhagavān, out of love and compassion for him,

original: kla klo can gyi skad rnam pa gcig gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa na lha'i rgyal po bzhi po de dag thams cad kyis go bar gyur to //
analyzed: kla klo can gyi skad rnam pa gcig gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad pa na lha'i rgyal po bzhi po de dag thams cad kyis go bar gyur to //
translated: taught the four noble truths in the language of the mlecchas in a single form, and all four of the kings of the gods understood.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gal te mi spyod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi spyod do zhe na /
translated: If you say they do not engage in it,

original: tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa de dag ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa de dag ji ltar rung ste /
translated: how can those statements in the verses be correct?

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the verses:

original: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni chos ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni chos ston to //
translated: The Buddha teaches the Dharma with a single voice,

original: sems can mos pa ji bzhin so sor go'o //
analyzed: sems can mos pa ji bzhin so sor go'o //
translated: but beings understand it individually according to their inclinations.

original: bcom ldan gsung gcig tu ni bdag cag don rnam pa sna tshogs bshad par rab tu sems zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan gsung gcig tu ni bdag cag don rnam pa sna tshogs bshad par rab tu sems zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat, with a single utterance, explains to us the various aspects of the meaning.

original: de la gsung gcig ces bya ba ni tshangs pa'i skad do @19a * //🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la gsung gcig ces bya ba ni tshangs pa'i skad do @19a * // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, “a single utterance” is the voice of Brahma.

original: rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to the extensive explanation.

original: 'di'i lan yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: 'di'i lan yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The answer is also explained in two parts.

original: de la dang po ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das gsung gcig gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pas thams cad mdzad par yang mi spyod do //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das gsung gcig gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pas thams cad mdzad par yang mi spyod do //
translated: The first is as follows: “The Bhagavat, with a single utterance, teaches the four noble truths, but does not engage in accomplishing everything.

original: bcom ldan 'das rang dbang dang rdzu 'phrul mnga' yang yul la dbang bsgyur bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rang dbang dang rdzu 'phrul mnga' yang yul la dbang bsgyur bar mi spyod do //
translated: Bhagavat, although you have mastery and supernatural powers, you do not engage in controlling objects.

original: ji ltar rna bas gzugs mthong bar mi nus pa dang / mig gis sgra la sogs pa thos pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rna bas gzugs mthong bar mi nus pa dang / mig gis sgra la sogs pa thos pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the ear cannot see forms, and the eye cannot hear sounds and so on.”

original: gal te de lta na snga ma bzhin tshigs su bcad pa de ltar rung bar 'gyur rung bar bya dgos par nges pa yang med de /
analyzed: gal te de lta na snga ma bzhin tshigs su bcad pa de ltar rung bar 'gyur rung bar bya dgos par nges pa yang med de /
translated: If that is so, then it is not certain that the former verse must be corrected to agree with the latter verse,

original: sde snod gsum pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sde snod gsum pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former verse is not included in the Tripiṭaka.

original: sangs rgyas la bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni tshig la skyon yod pa phal che ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams ni tshig la skyon yod pa phal che ste /
translated: The verses praising the Buddha often have faults in their wording.🔽For example, the Vaibhāṣikas praise the Buddha as follows:

original: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba dag bcom ldan 'das ni thugs rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba dag bcom ldan 'das ni thugs rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat is always in equipoise.

original: rtag par mnal ba mi mnga' zhes bstod pa ltar /
analyzed: rtag par mnal ba mi mnga' zhes bstod pa ltar /
translated: He never sleeps.

original: snga ma'i tshigs su bcad pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: snga ma'i tshigs su bcad pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The former verse is similar to this.

original: de'i phyir rnam par bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par bshad mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it does not need to be explained.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni sgra rnams kyi yul la khyab pas ji ltar gsungs par bzhed pa bzhin du mdzad par spyad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni sgra rnams kyi yul la khyab pas ji ltar gsungs par bzhed pa bzhin du mdzad par spyad de /
translated: Moreover, the speech of the Tathāgata pervades the domain of sounds, and he acts as he wishes to speak.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yul dbus kyi skad du gsung bar mdzad pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yul dbus kyi skad du gsung bar mdzad pa na /
translated: when the Bhagavat speaks in the language of the central country,

original: yul dbus su skyes pa bas mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: yul dbus su skyes pa bas mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: It is superior to the speech of those born in the central country.

original: yul gzhan dag gis yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: yul gzhan dag gis yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The same is true of the other countries.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung sgra'i yul rnams la khyab pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de las de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung sgra'i yul rnams la khyab pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de las de skad du bstan to //
translated: This is taught in that verse because the speech of the Bhagavat pervades all countries.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang zhing rno la myur du bsgyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang zhing rno la myur du bsgyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the speech of the Bhagavat is light, sharp, and quickly understood.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su gsung bar mdzad kyang thams cad kyis so so nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni yul dbus kyi skad gsungs pa'i rjes la bar ma chad par yang sh'akya'i yul gyi skad gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su gsung bar mdzad kyang thams cad kyis so so nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni yul dbus kyi skad gsungs pa'i rjes la bar ma chad par yang sh'akya'i yul gyi skad gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, although he speaks in various ways, each person thinks, “The Bhagavat spoke the language of the central country, and without interruption he then spoke the language of the Śākyas.

original: snyam pa nas /
analyzed: snyam pa nas /
translated: and I will do this and that.

original: de bzhin du ka ka'i ra'i skad du gsungs pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ka ka'i ra'i skad du gsungs pa'i bar du ste /
translated: And so on up to, “He spoke in the language of the Kākavāsī people.”

original: 'di ltar myur bar bsgyur ba'i sa nas dus gcig go snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'di ltar myur bar bsgyur ba'i sa nas dus gcig go snyam du sems so //
translated: Because it is quickly understood, they think it is spoken at one time.

original: ji ltar mgal me'i 'khor lo ma yin yang 'khor lo'i @19b mtshan nyid du snang ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar mgal me'i 'khor lo ma yin yang 'khor lo'i @19b mtshan nyid du snang ba ltar /
translated: Just as a firebrand circle is not a wheel, but appears to have the characteristics of a wheel.

original: snga ma'i tshigs su bcad pa yang 'di la brten pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: snga ma'i tshigs su bcad pa yang 'di la brten pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since the previous verse is based on this, there is no contradiction.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni skad mang po sna tshogs yod kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni skad mang po sna tshogs yod kyang /
translated: Moreover, although the Tathagata has many different languages,

original: mi mthun par so sor lan 'debs pa'i phyir gsung gcig ces bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par so sor lan 'debs pa'i phyir gsung gcig ces bshad do zhe'o //
translated: he is said to have one voice because he answers each one individually without contradiction.

original: gnyis pa ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das ni 'phags pa'i skad kyis bden pa bzhi bstan pas thams cad go bar mdzad par spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das ni 'phags pa'i skad kyis bden pa bzhi bstan pas thams cad go bar mdzad par spyod do //
translated: The second is as follows: The Bhagavat acts so that all understand by teaching the four noble truths in the language of the noble ones.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir lha'i rgyal po phyi ma gnyis go bar ma gyur /🔽lha'i rgyal po bzhi po de dag mos pa tha dad pas de dag gi re ba yongs su skong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir lha'i rgyal po phyi ma gnyis go bar ma gyur / lha'i rgyal po bzhi po de dag mos pa tha dad pas de dag gi re ba yongs su skong ba'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, why did the last two kings of the gods not understand?

original: bcom ldan 'das tha dad par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tha dad par gsungs so //
translated: Because those four kings of the gods had different inclinations, the Bhagavat spoke differently in order to fulfill their hopes.

original: zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: From that up to the extensive explanation.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das skad rnam pa sna tshogs rab tu mkhyen par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das skad rnam pa sna tshogs rab tu mkhyen par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate that the Bhagavān knows the various languages,

original: de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad gsungs te /
translated: he said this.

original: 'di ltar kha cig bcom ldan 'das ni 'phags pa'i skad 'ba' zhig gis ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig bcom ldan 'das ni 'phags pa'i skad 'ba' zhig gis ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: Some doubt that the Bhagavān teaches only in the language of the noble ones,🔽but does not have mastery over all languages.

original: sgra skad thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa ni ma yin no snyam du the tshom za ba dag gi the tshom bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra skad thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa ni ma yin no snyam du the tshom za ba dag gi the tshom bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate their doubts,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tha dad par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tha dad par gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavān taught in different languages.

original: gzhan yang gdul ba'i sems can kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung ma bsgyur bas 'dul bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul ba'i sems can kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung ma bsgyur bas 'dul bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, some disciples are to be tamed by the Bhagavān's body and speech without transformation,

original: gdul ba kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung bsgyur bas 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul ba kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung bsgyur bas 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: while some disciples are to be tamed by the Bhagavān's body and speech with transformation.

original: bcom ldan 'das skad rnam pa gsum gyis lha'i rgyal po bzhi po dag la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skad rnam pa gsum gyis lha'i rgyal po bzhi po dag la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan to zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān taught the four noble truths to the four kings of the gods in three languages.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las go bar gyur te zhes bshad pa de ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'o //🔽tshigs su bcad pa las go bar gyur to //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las go bar gyur te zhes bshad pa de ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i thams cad yod par smra ba la sogs pa'o // tshigs su bcad pa las go bar gyur to //
translated: The explanation in the Mahāvibhāṣā that “it is understood from the verse” refers to the Sarvāstivāda that appears in the treatise of the scriptural system.

original: zhes bshad pa ni nges par bshad mi dgos te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ni nges par bshad mi dgos te /
translated: The explanation that “it is understood from the verse” is not necessarily correct.

original: sde snod gsum pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig gi skyon yod par bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sde snod gsum pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig gi skyon yod par bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not in the three piṭakas, and because it is true that it has verbal faults.

original: gzhan yang gsung gcig ces bya ba ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsung gcig ces bya ba ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Moreover, “one voice” is threefold.

original: dang po ni sgra'i yul rnams la khyab cing gnas kyi rjes su mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir gcig ces bya'o //🔽gnyis pa ni myur ba @20a * //
analyzed: dang po ni sgra'i yul rnams la khyab cing gnas kyi rjes su mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir gcig ces bya'o // gnyis pa ni myur ba @20a * //
translated: The first is called one because it pervades and abides in the objects of sound, and because it is supreme.

original: gcig pa lta bur gyur pa'i phyir gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: gcig pa lta bur gyur pa'i phyir gcig ces bya'o //
translated: The second is called one because it is like a single swift🔽.

original: gsum pa ni phan gdags par mtshungs pa'i phyir gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni phan gdags par mtshungs pa'i phyir gcig ces bya'o //
translated: The third is called one because it is the same in benefiting.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las go bar gyur to zhes bshad pa 'di ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phal chen pa'i sde pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las go bar gyur to zhes bshad pa 'di ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phal chen pa'i sde pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Mahāvibhāṣā says, “It is understood from the Mahāsāṅghika school and so on that appear in the treatise of the scriptural system.”

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yang dgongs pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yang dgongs pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The explanation of three types of intention is also explained in three ways.

original: dang po ni de dag gi re ba yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ni de dag gi re ba yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is because the Buddha fulfilled their hopes.

original: gnyis pa ni de dag gi the tshom yongs su bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de dag gi the tshom yongs su bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is because he dispelled their doubts.

original: gsum pa ni 'dul ba de dag bcom ldan 'das kyang sku dang gsung ma bsgyur ba dang / sku dang gsung bsgyur ba la brten pa gnyis kyi phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dul ba de dag bcom ldan 'das kyang sku dang gsung ma bsgyur ba dang / sku dang gsung bsgyur ba la brten pa gnyis kyi phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: The third is because those to be tamed are of two types: those who rely on the Buddha’s body and speech that do not change and those who rely on his body and speech that change.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po dang sbyar na gsung gcig gis ston par byed do zhes phal chen pa'i sde pa la sogs pa dag dang mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po dang sbyar na gsung gcig gis ston par byed do zhes phal chen pa'i sde pa la sogs pa dag dang mthun te /
translated: Here, when applied to the Mahāyāna, it is similar to the Mahāsāṅghika school and so on, which say, “The Buddha taught with a single voice.”

original: de'i phyir tshad med pa'i don gyi mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad med pa'i don gyi mdo las /
translated: Therefore the Aparimitāyur-nāma-sūtra says:

original: gsung sgra gcig gis sgra skad mang po dang mthun par mdzad do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsung sgra gcig gis sgra skad mang po dang mthun par mdzad do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: With a single sound, he speaks in the manner of the many sounds.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the Buddhavatamsaka says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig gis chos ston pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig gis chos ston pa las /
translated: From the Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma with a single sound,

original: dpag med mdo sde rgya mtsho rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: dpag med mdo sde rgya mtsho rab tu gsungs //
translated: An immeasurable ocean of scriptures is well proclaimed.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las /
translated: And the Vimalakirti Sutra says:

original: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni chos ston kyang //🔽sems can mos pa ji bzhin so sor go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni chos ston kyang // sems can mos pa ji bzhin so sor go //
translated: Although the Buddha teaches the Dharma with a single sound,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Sentient beings understand it individually according to their inclinations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo'i 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo'i 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: And the commentary to the Buddhabhumi-sutra says:

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi mos pa can rnams kyi mos pa'i khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du gsung sprul pa'i phrin las des don rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pas the tshom rnams gcod par mdzad do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi mos pa can rnams kyi mos pa'i khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du gsung sprul pa'i phrin las des don rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pas the tshom rnams gcod par mdzad do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The deeds of the gnosis of achieving activities are as follows: Those who have the inclination for the deeds of the gnosis of achieving activities have their doubts eliminated by the various teachings of the Dharma that are manifested by that activity of emanating speech in accordance with their particular inclinations.

original: yang na gcig bskyed pas don thams cad bstan nas sems can rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du phan pa thob par mdzad de /
analyzed: yang na gcig bskyed pas don thams cad bstan nas sems can rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du phan pa thob par mdzad de /
translated: Or else, by teaching one thing, he benefits sentient beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: mdo de dag las ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo de dag las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the sutras:

original: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni bka' stsal na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung gcig tu ni bka' stsal na //
translated: The Buddha speaks with a single voice,
