original: sems can gsung gcig de dag so sor go //🔽la la 'jigs skrag la la rab tu dga' //🔽la la skyo zhing la la the tshom rab tu 'chad /
analyzed: sems can gsung gcig de dag so sor go // la la 'jigs skrag la la rab tu dga' // la la skyo zhing la la the tshom rab tu 'chad /
translated: And sentient beings each understand in their own language.🔽Some are frightened, some are delighted,

original: @20b ces gsungs pa lta bu ste /🔽'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyis rab tu bskyed pa /
analyzed: @20b ces gsungs pa lta bu ste / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyis rab tu bskyed pa /
translated: Some are saddened, some have their doubts resolved.🔽This is the emanation of the Tathagata's speech, which is produced by the power of his inconceivable aspirations and

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu las byung ba'i gsung sprul pa yin pas gsung gcig gis sems can rnams kyi the tshom gcod par mdzad la /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu las byung ba'i gsung sprul pa yin pas gsung gcig gis sems can rnams kyi the tshom gcod par mdzad la /
translated: Resolves the doubts of sentient beings with a single voice.

original: sku sprul pa des kyang sems can rnams sku gcig la tha dad pa nyid du mthong bar mdzad pas kyang phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
analyzed: sku sprul pa des kyang sems can rnams sku gcig la tha dad pa nyid du mthong bar mdzad pas kyang phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po rnams yongs su rdzogs par mdzad de /
translated: The things that benefit are completely fulfilled.

original: 'di la sogs pa brjod kyis mi lang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa brjod kyis mi lang ngo //
translated: There are countless other such benefits.

original: de la gsung gcig ces bya ba yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la gsung gcig ces bya ba yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: As for the single voice, in brief there are three kinds.

original: dang po ni chos kyi rjes su gcig pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni chos kyi rjes su gcig pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ste /
translated: The first is called single because it is the same for all teachings.

original: ji skad du gzugs zhes brjod pa'i tshe sems can dag so so nas thos pa tha dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gzugs zhes brjod pa'i tshe sems can dag so so nas thos pa tha dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: When it is said “form,” sentient beings each hear it differently.

original: gnyis pa ni yul gyi rjes su gcig pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yul gyi rjes su gcig pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ste /
translated: The second is called single because it is the same for all objects.

original: ji ltar dbus kyi yul gcig gi skad brjod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar dbus kyi yul gcig gi skad brjod pa'i tshe /
translated: When the language of a single central country is spoken,

original: sems can dag so so nas rang gi yul gyi skad thos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can dag so so nas rang gi yul gyi skad thos pa lta bu'o //
translated: sentient beings each hear it in their own language.

original: gsum pa ni tshangs pa'i skad du gcig pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni tshangs pa'i skad du gcig pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ste /
translated: The third is called single because it is the same as the voice of Brahmā.

original: de'i phyir tshad med pa'i don gyi mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad med pa'i don gyi mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Sūtra on the Immeasurable Topics says:

original: tshangs pa'i skad la spyi btud skyabs su mchi //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i skad la spyi btud skyabs su mchi // zhes gsungs so //
translated: I bow to the universal refuge, the Brahmā voice.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang //
translated: And the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines says:

original: 'di ltar tshangs pa'i sgra skad kyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshangs pa'i sgra skad kyis //
translated: Thus, with the Brahmā voice,

original: sems can dag la chos ston to //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can dag la chos ston to // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.🔽And the Great Treasury of Detailed Exposition says:

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las gsung gcig ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las gsung gcig ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The so-called single voice is as follows.

original: tshangs pa'i skad de 'di ltar yul dbus kyi mi 'khor 'dus par 'ongs pa dag ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i skad de 'di ltar yul dbus kyi mi 'khor 'dus par 'ongs pa dag ni /
translated: When the Brahmā voice is heard by the assemblies of humans who have gathered in the central region,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag la yul dbus kyi skad du chos ston to snyam du sems la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag la yul dbus kyi skad du chos ston to snyam du sems la /
translated: they think, “The Bhagavat teaches the Dharma to us in the language of the central region.”

original: de bzhin du yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa dag ni bcom ldan 'das bdag gcig pu ni phyir rang gi yul gyi skad du ston to snyam du sems shing thos nas kyang ji lta ba bzhin du so so nas go bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa dag ni bcom ldan 'das bdag gcig pu ni phyir rang gi yul gyi skad du ston to snyam du sems shing thos nas kyang ji lta ba bzhin du so so nas go bar gyur to //
translated: Similarly, those who have come from other regions think, “The Bhagavat teaches the Dharma to me alone in the language of my own region.” Having heard it, they understand it individually just as it is.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags spyod pa dag ni mi gtsang ba bshad pa thos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags spyod pa dag ni mi gtsang ba bshad pa thos so //
translated: Moreover, those who engage in desire hear the explanation of impurity.

original: zhe sdang spyod pa gzhan dag ni byams pa bshad pa nyid du thos so //
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa gzhan dag ni byams pa bshad pa nyid du thos so //
translated: Those who engage in hatred hear the explanation of love.

original: gti mug spyod pa dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar bshad pa nyid du thos so //🔽nga rgyal spyod pa dag la sogs @21a * //
analyzed: gti mug spyod pa dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar bshad pa nyid du thos so // nga rgyal spyod pa dag la sogs @21a * //
translated: Those who engage in delusion hear the explanation of dependent origination.

original: pa yang ci rigs su shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pa yang ci rigs su shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who engage in pride and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig tu gsung ba 'di rang gi ngo bo yin nam 'on te gzugs brnyan nyid yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig tu gsung ba 'di rang gi ngo bo yin nam 'on te gzugs brnyan nyid yin /
translated: Is this single speech of the Tathāgata's own nature or is it a mere reflection?

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo yin na ni ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de ji ltar go zhing bshad par bya /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo yin na ni ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa de ji ltar go zhing bshad par bya /
translated: If it is his own nature, then how can the Mahāyāna, which is devoid of intrinsic reality, be understood and explained?

original: gal te gzugs brnyan yin na ni nyan pa po'i rjes su rnam pa mang po nyid du 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan yin na ni nyan pa po'i rjes su rnam pa mang po nyid du 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is a reflection, then it would be established as manifold in accordance with the listeners,

original: ji ltar gcig ces brjod /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig ces brjod /
translated: so how can it be called single?

original: slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pa'i gzhung gis yang dag pa nyid kyi lung la brten nas rang gi ngo bo kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pa'i gzhung gis yang dag pa nyid kyi lung la brten nas rang gi ngo bo kho nar zad kyi /
translated: and the treatises of Master Dharmapala and others,

original: gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no //🔽zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no // zhes bshad de /
translated: that it is only the nature of the object that is seen, not a reflection.

original: yang dag pa dang gnyis ka la brten nas bshad na ni rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang gnyis ka la brten nas bshad na ni rang gi ngo bo dang gzugs brnyan nyid du 'dod do //
translated: If it is explained in terms of both the correct and the incorrect, then it is asserted that it is the nature of the object and a reflection.

original: de gsung gcig ces bya ba yang tshangs pa'i skad du gcig pa'i ga la yin te /
analyzed: de gsung gcig ces bya ba yang tshangs pa'i skad du gcig pa'i ga la yin te /
translated: Also, how can it be said that there is one voice in the language of Brahma?

original: 'di ltar sgra la brten nas rjes su mthun pa dang / 'gal ba med par 'byed pa na rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba ni sgra gcig pa nyid du rung na /🔽gal te gzugs la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra la brten nas rjes su mthun pa dang / 'gal ba med par 'byed pa na rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba ni sgra gcig pa nyid du rung na / gal te gzugs la brten nas /
translated: If it is suitable to say that there is one voice when it is divided without contradiction in accordance with the language,🔽then if blue and yellow are divided in dependence on form,

original: sngon po dang ser po rnam par 'byed pa na sngon po dang ser po yang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po rnam par 'byed pa na sngon po dang ser po yang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: would blue and yellow also be the same?

original: de ltar 'dod na yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na yang nyes pa med de /
translated: If you assert that, there is no fault.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig la so so nas tha dad par mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig la so so nas tha dad par mthong ste /
translated: By the power of the Tathagata's magical transformation, each one sees the same thing, such as a form, differently.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes sku sprul pa des sems can rnams gzugs kyi dngos po gcig la tha dad par mthong bar mdzad pas kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes sku sprul pa des sems can rnams gzugs kyi dngos po gcig la tha dad par mthong bar mdzad pas kyang /
translated: Therefore, the commentary to the Bodhisattvabhumi states that the gnosis that accomplishes activities is the body of magical emanation, and that by that body of magical emanation, sentient beings see the same thing, such as a form, differently.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po yongs su grub par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu la mnga' brnyes pa gzugs kyi dngos po gcig la tha dad bar mthong du rung na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po yongs su grub par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do // rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu la mnga' brnyes pa gzugs kyi dngos po gcig la tha dad bar mthong du rung na /
translated: Thus, it is the basis of benefit.🔽If it is possible for those who have attained mastery over magical powers to see the same thing, such as a form, differently,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu la mnga' brnyes pas gzugs kyi phung po tha dad pa yang gcig pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ram zhe'am /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu la mnga' brnyes pas gzugs kyi phung po tha dad pa yang gcig pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ram zhe'am /
translated: then is it possible for those who have attained mastery over magical powers to see different aggregates of form as one?

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis mu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis mu bzhi yod de /
translated: The Mahayana scriptures teach that there are four possibilities.

original: thams cad kyang 'grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad kyang 'grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: All of them are established.

original: de la dang po ni gzugs la tha dad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gzugs la tha dad par mthong ba ste /
translated: The first is the seeing of difference in form.

original: ji ltar sprul pa'i sku @21b gcig la sems can rnams so so nas mi mthun par mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa'i sku @21b gcig la sems can rnams so so nas mi mthun par mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the case of a single emanated body, which sentient beings see in different and incompatible ways.

original: gnyis pa ni gzugs tha dad pa la mthong ba gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzugs tha dad pa la mthong ba gcig pa ste /
translated: The second is the seeing of sameness in different forms.

original: ji ltar sprul pa'i sku gcig sangs rgyas rnams mthun mong sprul pas sprul par mdzad pa la ltos nas mang po zhes brjod kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa'i sku gcig sangs rgyas rnams mthun mong sprul pas sprul par mdzad pa la ltos nas mang po zhes brjod kyang /
translated: It is like the case of a single emanated body, which is called many in dependence on the emanations of many buddhas.

original: mthong ba ni gcig par gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni gcig par gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: But the seeing is the same.

original: gzugs la brten nas sngon po dang ser po 'byed na sngon po dang / ser po gcig pu 'grub pa ni rung na gal te sems la brten nas rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par 'byed pa na /
analyzed: gzugs la brten nas sngon po dang ser po 'byed na sngon po dang / ser po gcig pu 'grub pa ni rung na gal te sems la brten nas rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par 'byed pa na /
translated: If, in dependence on form, the differentiation of blue and yellow is established as a single entity, then, in dependence on mind, if the differentiation of the eight consciousnesses is established,

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyang gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyang gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: would the eight consciousnesses become a single entity?

original: gzugs dang sgra ni chos rags pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra ni chos rags pa yin te /
translated: Form and sound are gross phenomena.

original: gzugs su mtshungs pa tha dad par mthong gi / sems kyi chos ni phra zhing shes par dka' bas gcig pa nyid do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs su mtshungs pa tha dad par mthong gi / sems kyi chos ni phra zhing shes par dka' bas gcig pa nyid do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: The nature of mind is subtle and difficult to know, so it should not be said to be the same.🔽From here on is the explanation of the Dharma with one voice, which is taught in the Sutra of the Questions of Paramārthasamudgata.🔽All of that is the secret of the body and speech of the Tathāgata

original: de yan chad du gsung gcig gis chos bshad pa zhes bya ba la gzugs mtshungs shing lta ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnam pa gsum las sku dang gsung gi gsang ba🔽dag yin te /
analyzed: de yan chad du gsung gcig gis chos bshad pa zhes bya ba la gzugs mtshungs shing lta ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnam pa gsum las sku dang gsung gi gsang ba dag yin te /
translated: from among the three secrets.

original: gsang ba rnam pa gsum rgya cher bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / gsang ba'i gnas bstan pa'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba rnam pa gsum rgya cher bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / gsang ba'i gnas bstan pa'i mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the three secrets should be understood according to what appears in the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom and the Sutra Teaching the Secret Topics.

original: de la gzhung brjod pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te phyi rol pa dang chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhung brjod pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te phyi rol pa dang chos 'di pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the expression of the treatise is also, in brief, of two kinds: non-Buddhist and Buddhist.

original: de la phyi rol pa ni mu stegs can rnams te /
analyzed: de la phyi rol pa ni mu stegs can rnams te /
translated: Among them, the non-Buddhists are the tīrthikas.

original: de dag kyang mang mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang mang mod kyi /
translated: And they are indeed numerous,

original: gtso bo rnams kyi dbang du byas te brjod na rnams pa bzhi las med de rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: gtso bo rnams kyi dbang du byas te brjod na rnams pa bzhi las med de rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: If we speak in terms of the main ones, there are no more than four.

original: dang po ni 'di yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / nges par ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i chos yod do zhes 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'di yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / nges par ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i chos yod do zhes 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The first is the apprehension that there is a phenomenon whose nature is existence, etc., and whose identity is definitely one.

original: grangs can la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the Sāṃkhya and so on.

original: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Their apprehension is also illogical.

original: chos thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are of the nature of existence,

original: thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin ltar ngo bo nyid bye brag med pa ni gang yang med do //🔽gnyis pa ni yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / ngo bo nges par tha dad pa'i chos yod do //
analyzed: thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin ltar ngo bo nyid bye brag med pa ni gang yang med do // gnyis pa ni yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / ngo bo nges par tha dad pa'i chos yod do //
translated: there is nothing that is not devoid of a specific nature, like all that is of the nature of existence.

original: zhes 'dzin pa ste /🔽mchog tu smra @22a * //
analyzed: zhes 'dzin pa ste / mchog tu smra @22a * //
translated: The second is the apprehension that there is a phenomenon whose nature is existence, etc., and whose identity is definitely different.

original: ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the Lokāyata and so on.

original: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Their apprehension is also illogical.

original: chos thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all dharmas are not of the nature of existence,

original: 'gags zin pa ltar ngo bo nyid med pa ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'gags zin pa ltar ngo bo nyid med pa ni gang yang med de /
translated: there is nothing at all that is essenceless, as if it had already ceased,

original: dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsum pa ni yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / ngo bo nyid gcig pa yang yin /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // gsum pa ni yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / ngo bo nyid gcig pa yang yin /
translated: because it is not perceived.

original: tha dad pa yang yin pa'i chos yod do zhes 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang yin pa'i chos yod do zhes 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The third is the grasping of the existence of a dharma that is both of the same nature and different in nature as existence, etc.

original: ngo tshar med pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngo tshar med pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like shamelessness, etc.

original: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /🔽gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i ni snga ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te / gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i ni snga ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: That grasping of theirs is also unreasonable,

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the error of sameness and difference, as before.

original: bzhi pa ni yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i chos yod do zhes 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni yod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i chos yod do zhes 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the grasping of the existence of a dharma that is neither of the same nature nor different in nature as existence, etc.

original: log par 'tsho ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like wrong livelihood, etc.

original: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'dzin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That grasping of theirs is also unreasonable,🔽because of the error of sameness and difference, as before.

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i skyon gcig pa dang tha dad pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i skyon gcig pa dang tha dad pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the error of being neither the same nor different is similar to the errors of being the same or different.

original: zhib tu ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is as it occurs in detail in the Compendium of the Mahāyāna.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa dang / slob dpon 'phags pa'i lhas gzhung rnam pa bzhi 'jigs pa'i bstan bcos mdzad pa las bstan par bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa dang / slob dpon 'phags pa'i lhas gzhung rnam pa bzhi 'jigs pa'i bstan bcos mdzad pa las bstan par bzhin no //
translated: The extensive analysis is as it is taught in the treatise called the Hundred Thousand Eloquent Verses and in the treatise called the Four Hundred Verses composed by the master Āryadeva.

original: de la chos 'di pa'i gzhung yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'di pa'i gzhung yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In this regard, the treatises of this Dharma are also, in brief, of three kinds:

original: nad tha dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gzhung dang / sde tha dad pas rab tu phye ba'i gzhung dang / dus kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: nad tha dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gzhung dang / sde tha dad pas rab tu phye ba'i gzhung dang / dus kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'i gzhung ngo //
translated: treatises that follow the different illnesses, treatises that distinguish the different classes, and treatises that explain from the perspective of time.

original: de la nad tha dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gzhung ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nad tha dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gzhung ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the treatises that follow the different illnesses are as follows.

original: sems can rnams ma rig pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa brgyad khri bzhi stong 'byung ba na /
analyzed: sems can rnams ma rig pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa brgyad khri bzhi stong 'byung ba na /
translated: When, due to the power of ignorance, eighty-four thousand afflictions arise in sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nad pa rnams kyi rjes su sman rnams rjes su rnam par bzhag pas des na re re nas gzhung rnams brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nad pa rnams kyi rjes su sman rnams rjes su rnam par bzhag pas des na re re nas gzhung rnams brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus the Tathāgatas have established the medicines for the sick, and therefore they have taught the scriptures individually.🔽Therefore the Compendium of the Immaculate Sciences states,

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dri ma med pa bsdus pa las gzhan yang 'jig rten na bdud bzhi dang nyon mongs pa'i sgo brgyad khri bzhi stong yod pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dri ma med pa bsdus pa las gzhan yang 'jig rten na bdud bzhi dang nyon mongs pa'i sgo brgyad khri bzhi stong yod pas /
translated: “Moreover, since there are four demons and eighty-four thousand afflictions in the world,

original: sems can rnams de dag gis rab tu nyon mongs pa'i phyir /🔽de bzhin gshegs @22b pa rnams chos 'di dag gis sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad do zhes 'byung bas de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi rjes su chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gnyen por gyur
analyzed: sems can rnams de dag gis rab tu nyon mongs pa'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs @22b pa rnams chos 'di dag gis sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad do zhes 'byung bas de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi rjes su chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gnyen por gyur
translated: sentient beings are greatly afflicted by them.🔽Therefore the Tathāgatas perform the deeds of a Buddha for sentient beings through these dharmas.”

original: pa rgya cher gsungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa rgya cher gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood that the Tathāgatas have extensively taught the eighty-four thousand dharma doors as antidotes to the diseases of the afflictions.

original: chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong po de dag kyang so so'i bstan pa dag las mi mthun par ston pas /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong po de dag kyang so so'i bstan pa dag las mi mthun par ston pas /
translated: The 84,000 Dharma doors are taught in their respective teachings in a way that is not in accord with each other.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i mdzod kyi bstan bcos las rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i mdzod kyi bstan bcos las rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: Thus the treatise Treasury of the Proponents of True Existence explains them in three ways.

original: de'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: Therefore the Verses of Sūtra says:

original: thub pas gsungs pa'i chos kyi phung po grangs ni stong phrag brgyad cu yod /
analyzed: thub pas gsungs pa'i chos kyi phung po grangs ni stong phrag brgyad cu yod /
translated: The number of aggregates of Dharma taught by the Sage is 80,000.

original: de dag rang bzhin tshig gam yang na min //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin tshig gam yang na min //
translated: They are not by nature words or letters.

original: de ni gzugs dang 'du byed phung pos bsdus //
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang 'du byed phung pos bsdus //
translated: They are subsumed within the form and compositional factors aggregates.

original: kha cig dag ni chos kyi phung po'i tshad //
analyzed: kha cig dag ni chos kyi phung po'i tshad //
translated: Some say the measure of the aggregates of Dharma

original: bstan bcos dag nas de bzhin rab tu bshad //
analyzed: bstan bcos dag nas de bzhin rab tu bshad //
translated: is explained in the treatises in that way.

original: kha cig phung po la sogs tshig rjes su yang dag don du spyod pa rnams gnyen po'i zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig phung po la sogs tshig rjes su yang dag don du spyod pa rnams gnyen po'i zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some say that the aggregates of Dharma are the words of the aggregates and so on that are the objects of correct engagement by those who are engaged in the antidote.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The Commentary to this says:

original: slob dpon kha cig ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri re re'i tshad kyang chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos kyi tshad tsam ste /
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri re re'i tshad kyang chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos kyi tshad tsam ste /
translated: Some masters say: The measure of each of the eighty thousand aggregates of Dharma is the measure of the treatise called the Aggregate of Dharma.

original: 'di ltar de dag re re la tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag drug yod pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag re re la tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag drug yod pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, each of them has six thousand verses.

original: kha cig chos kyi phung po ni phung po la sogs pa'i tshig gi rjes su re re tha dad pas grangs stong phrag brgyad cu yod de /
analyzed: kha cig chos kyi phung po ni phung po la sogs pa'i tshig gi rjes su re re tha dad pas grangs stong phrag brgyad cu yod de /
translated: Others say: The aggregate of Dharma is the eighty thousand aggregates of Dharma that are separate from each other, since each is a different word, such as aggregate, base, element, etc.

original: 'di lta ste phung po dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste phung po dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: Thus, there are the aggregates, bases, elements, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i don du gdul bar bya ba'i sems can 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang ldan zhing spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri yod pas brgyad khri de dag gi gnyen po'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du gdul bar bya ba'i sems can 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang ldan zhing spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri yod pas brgyad khri de dag gi gnyen po'i phyir /
translated: In reality, there are eighty thousand aggregates of Dharma because there are eighty thousand different behaviors of sentient beings to be trained, such as attachment and aversion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is said that the Bhagavān taught eighty thousand aggregates of Dharma as antidotes to those eighty thousand.

original: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dag dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dag dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The treatise Elucidating the Text also explains in accordance with what appears in the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: de la slob dpon snga ma gnyis kyis don mi mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i yang dag pa'i don gsum la 'jigs par byed de /
analyzed: de la slob dpon snga ma gnyis kyis don mi mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i yang dag pa'i don gsum la 'jigs par byed de /
translated: The two earlier masters are afraid of the three correct meanings that appear in the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de @23a * //🔽nyid las 'dis ni phung po la sogs tshig rjes su zhes bya ba dang / phung po la sogs pa med ces bya ba dang / sems can gyi nad gyi spyod pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de @23a * // nyid las 'dis ni phung po la sogs tshig rjes su zhes bya ba dang / phung po la sogs pa med ces bya ba dang / sems can gyi nad gyi spyod pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, that treatise states:

original: bshad pa rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If this is not for the purpose of countering the conduct of sentient beings’ illness, then the explanations would be meaningless.”

original: zhes bya ba'i rjes su mthun par 'grub pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rjes su mthun par 'grub pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is established in accordance with that statement.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa rnam pa gsum tha dad par 'byung ba yang /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa rnam pa gsum tha dad par 'byung ba yang /
translated: The three explanations that appear in the Treasury of Abhidharma are different.

original: slob dpon dang po ni de bzhin gshegs pas logs shig tu chos kyi sde brgyad khri gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon dang po ni de bzhin gshegs pas logs shig tu chos kyi sde brgyad khri gsungs te /
translated: The first master thinks that the Tathagata separately taught eighty thousand dharmas.

original: sde re re yang chos kyi phung po'i gnas zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: sde re re yang chos kyi phung po'i gnas zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos dang mnyam ste /
translated: He thinks that each collection is equal to a treatise called the abode of the aggregate of Dharma,

original: tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag drug yod do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag drug yod do snyam du sems so //
translated: which has six thousand verses.

original: gnyis pa ni phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa nyid la brgyad khri zhes bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa nyid la brgyad khri zhes bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: The second thinks that the eighty thousand is the number of aggregates, sense bases, and so on.

original: gsum pa ni nad kyi spyod pa'i tshad kyi rjes su stong phrag brgyad cu yod do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nad kyi spyod pa'i tshad kyi rjes su stong phrag brgyad cu yod do snyam du sems so //
translated: The third thinks that the eighty thousand is the number of afflictions to be abandoned.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni rnam pa drug yod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ni rnam pa drug yod de /
translated: The great commentary explains that there are six types.

original: dang po gnyis dang drug pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun no //🔽de'i 'og tu bshad pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dang po gnyis dang drug pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun no // de'i 'og tu bshad pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba ni /
translated: The first two and the sixth are similar to the explanation in the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The three types that are explained below are as follows.

original: btsun pa rab dbyangs na re chos kyi phung po re re la yang tshigs su bcad pa khri phrag lnga bcu dang / lnga stong lnga brgya lnga bcu yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: btsun pa rab dbyangs na re chos kyi phung po re re la yang tshigs su bcad pa khri phrag lnga bcu dang / lnga stong lnga brgya lnga bcu yod do zhe'o //
translated: Bhadanta Subhuti says that each aggregate of Dharma has 50,000 verses,🔽5,550 verses.

original: yang slob dpon gzhan dag na re chos kyi phung po re re la yang tshigs su bcad pa khri phrag bco lnga dang / lnga stong lnga brgya lnga bcu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang slob dpon gzhan dag na re chos kyi phung po re re la yang tshigs su bcad pa khri phrag bco lnga dang / lnga stong lnga brgya lnga bcu yod do zhe na /
translated: Other masters say that each aggregate of Dharma has 15,000 verses,🔽550 verses.

original: gzhan kha cig ni chos kyi phung po re re la yang tshigs su bcad pa khri lnga stong lnga brgya lnga bcu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan kha cig ni chos kyi phung po re re la yang tshigs su bcad pa khri lnga stong lnga brgya lnga bcu yod do zhe na /
translated: Others say that each aggregate of Dharma has 5,500 verses.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po slob dpon klu sgrub kyi dgongs pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po slob dpon klu sgrub kyi dgongs pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Here, in accordance with the intention of the Mahayana master Nagarjuna,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyi le'u'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyi le'u'i 'grel pa las /
translated: in the commentary on the chapter on method in the perfection of wisdom sutra,🔽it says:🔽Moreover, since there are 21,000 faculties of an individual who engages in desire,

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags spyod pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig stong yod pas dbang po de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags spyod pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig stong yod pas dbang po de dag gi phyir /
translated: for the sake of those faculties,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
translated: The Tathagatas have taught the eighty-four thousand antidotes.

original: dang po ni de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos so //
analyzed: dang po ni de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos so //
translated: First, the Bodhisattvas are interested in the order of the antidotes.

original: zhe sdang spyod pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig @23b stong yod pas dang po de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig @23b stong yod pas dang po de dag gi phyir /
translated: There are twenty-one thousand faculties of the person who practices hatred. First, for their sake,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
translated: the Tathagatas have taught the eighty-four thousand antidotes.

original: dbang po de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos so //
analyzed: dbang po de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos so //
translated: After those faculties, the Bodhisattvas are interested in the order of the antidotes.

original: gti mug spyod pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig stong yod pas dbang po de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: gti mug spyod pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig stong yod pas dbang po de dag gi phyir /
translated: There are twenty-one thousand faculties of the person who practices delusion. For the sake of those faculties,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
translated: the Tathagatas have taught the eighty-four thousand antidotes.

original: dbang po de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos so //
analyzed: dbang po de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos so //
translated: And in accordance with those faculties, the bodhisattvas are devoted to teaching the order of the antidotes.

original: cha mnyam pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig stong yod pas dbang po de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: cha mnyam pa'i gang zag gi dbang po nyi khri chig stong yod pas dbang po de dag gi phyir /
translated: There are twenty one thousand faculties of the individual, and for those faculties,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnyen po'i chos brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
translated: the Tathagatas have taught eighty four thousand dharmas as antidotes.

original: dbang po de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos te /
analyzed: dbang po de dag gi rjes su byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnyen po'i chos kyi go rims bstan par rab tu mos te /
translated: And in accordance with those faculties, the bodhisattvas are devoted to teaching the order of the antidotes.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spobs pa sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spobs pa sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ unobstructed knowledge of eloquence.

original: de la bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of the treatise is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang zag rnam pa bzhi'i phyir mdor bsdus nas chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang zag rnam pa bzhi'i phyir mdor bsdus nas chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
translated: The Tathagatas have taught in brief eighty four thousand dharma doors for the sake of four kinds of individuals.

original: de las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang zag re re'i phyir /
analyzed: de las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang zag re re'i phyir /
translated: For each person,🔽bodhisattvas explain the Dharma in twenty one thousand ways.

original: nyi khri chig stong rab tu bshad pas de'i phyir gcig tu bsdus nas brgyad khri bzhi stong yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi khri chig stong rab tu bshad pas de'i phyir gcig tu bsdus nas brgyad khri bzhi stong yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when they are combined, there are eighty four thousand.

original: 'di ji ltar bskal pa bzang po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar bskal pa bzang po'i mdo las /
translated: This is like the Fortunate Eon Sutra, which states:

original: sgo sum brgya lnga bcu re re la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yod pa des na /
analyzed: sgo sum brgya lnga bcu re re la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yod pa des na /
translated: Each of the three hundred and fifty doors has the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa nyis stong tshig brgya nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa nyis stong tshig brgya nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are two thousand one hundred perfections.

original: gnyen po de dag 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang zhe sdang drug gi nad rab tu spyod pas nyi khri chig stong nyid du 'gyur la /🔽de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nang rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po de dag 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang zhe sdang drug gi nad rab tu spyod pas nyi khri chig stong nyid du 'gyur la / de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nang rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyir /
translated: Since these antidotes are applied to the four great elements and the six kinds of anger, there are twenty one thousand.

original: brgyad khri bzhi stong nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: brgyad khri bzhi stong nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, there are eighty four thousand in order to counteract the four aspects of attachment and so forth.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon yang dag bden pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa rnam par shes pa dang sbyar na yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon yang dag bden pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa rnam par shes pa dang sbyar na yang /
translated: Moreover, the master Paramartha, in his commentary on the perfection of wisdom, correlates the consciousnesses with the perfections.

original: don la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: don la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in the meaning.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung dang sbyar na yang sangs rgyas @24a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung dang sbyar na yang sangs rgyas @24a * //
translated: When correlated with the texts of the noble Maitreya, the Vrtti on the Buddhagotra says:

original: kyi sa'i 'grel pa las sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gang zhe na /
analyzed: kyi sa'i 'grel pa las sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighty-four thousand mental behaviors?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems can rnams kyi spyod ba'i dri ma'i bye brag brgyad khri bzhi stong de dag pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la sogs pa'i bgegs byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi spyod ba'i dri ma'i bye brag brgyad khri bzhi stong de dag pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la sogs pa'i bgegs byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The eighty-four thousand afflictions of the conduct of sentient beings are the obstacles to the eighty-four thousand perfections, the dhāraṇī gateways, the samādhi gateways, and so on.

original: bskal pa bzang po'i mdo las de dag gi mtshan nyid rgya cher bshad pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i mdo las de dag gi mtshan nyid rgya cher bshad pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of those are explained extensively in the Bhadrakalpika Sūtra, which should be stated here.

original: de las ji skad du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las ji skad du 'di lta ste /
translated: It says:

original: thog ma kho nar spyod pa'i chos kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar spyod pa'i chos kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: First of all, one should cultivate the perfection of the Dharma of practice.

original: de bzhin du tha mar ni sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par dgod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha mar ni sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par dgod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Similarly, in the end, there is the perfection of the arrangement of the Buddha's body.

original: sum brgya lnga bcu po re re yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan te /
analyzed: sum brgya lnga bcu po re re yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan te /
translated: Each of the three hundred and fifty is endowed with the six perfections.

original: de ltar thams cad bsdus na nyis stong chig brgya yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bsdus na nyis stong chig brgya yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if all are combined, there are two thousand and one hundred.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang cha mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyi spyod pa'i gnyen por brgyad stong bzhi brgya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang cha mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyi spyod pa'i gnyen por brgyad stong bzhi brgya'o //
translated: For the practice of beings with equal parts of desire, hatred, and delusion, there are eight thousand and four hundred.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang don med pa drug gis bskyed pa'i don rnams bton te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang don med pa drug gis bskyed pa'i don rnams bton te /
translated: The meanings generated by the four great elements and the six meaningless ones are extracted.

original: lan bcur bsgyur ba gcig tu bgrangs na brgyad khri bzhi stong nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan bcur bsgyur ba gcig tu bgrangs na brgyad khri bzhi stong nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: When multiplied by ten and counted as one, it becomes eighty-four thousand.

original: 'di yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: For the cultivation of this,

original: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa brgyad khri bzhi stong yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa brgyad khri bzhi stong yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the eighty-four thousand dhāraṇī gateways, samādhis, and so on are all perfected.

original: 'di ni mdor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a brief explanation.

original: rgyas par byed na dpag tu med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyas par byed na dpag tu med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one explains it extensively, it is immeasurable.

original: de lta bas na mdor bsdus te bstan na ni brgyad khri bzhi stong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na mdor bsdus te bstan na ni brgyad khri bzhi stong ngo //
translated: Therefore, if it is taught concisely, there are eighty-four thousand.

original: rgya cher bstan na ni dpag tu med de /
analyzed: rgya cher bstan na ni dpag tu med de /
translated: If it is taught extensively, it is immeasurable.

original: brgyad khri bzhi stong zhib tu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: brgyad khri bzhi stong zhib tu bshad pa ni /
translated: The detailed explanation of the eighty-four thousand

original: bskal pa bzang po'i mdo la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i mdo la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood according to what appears in the Bhadrakalpika-sutra and so on.

original: de la sde tha dad bas rab tu phye ba'i gzhung zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos kyi sgo me brgyad khri yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de la sde tha dad bas rab tu phye ba'i gzhung zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos kyi sgo me brgyad khri yod mod kyi /
translated: Among those, the treatise called Distinguishing the Different Piṭakas says: Although there are eighty-four thousand Dharma gates,

original: sde rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis so so nas brjod pa'i gzhung yang tha dad de /
analyzed: sde rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis so so nas brjod pa'i gzhung yang tha dad de /
translated: the treatises that are individually taught are also different due to the power of the different piṭakas.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i mdo ni theg pa gcig gzhung du gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dri ma med pas bstan pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab ba'i rnam par grol ba gzhung du gsungs pa dang / @24b sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo ni 'phags pa bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor spyod pa gzhung du gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i mdo ni theg pa gcig gzhung du gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa dri ma med pas bstan pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab ba'i rnam par grol ba gzhung du gsungs pa dang / @24b sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo ni 'phags pa bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor spyod pa gzhung du gsungs pa dang /
translated: The noble Sūtra of the Flower Garland of the True Dharma teaches the single vehicle, the noble Sūtra of Vimalagarbha teaches inconceivable liberation, and the Sūtra of the Great Bounteousness of the Buddhas teaches the yoga of the forty-two noble ones.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bsnan pa gzhung du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bsnan pa gzhung du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Sūtra of the Great Nirvana teaches the addition of buddha nature.

original: 'di la sogs pa'i mdo la brjod kyis mi lang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa'i mdo la brjod kyis mi lang ngo //
translated: There are countless sūtras such as these.

original: de la dus kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba ni sde rnams kyi rjes su so so'i gzhung tha dad mod kyi dus la brten te brjod na rnam pa gsum las med de /
analyzed: de la dus kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba ni sde rnams kyi rjes su so so'i gzhung tha dad mod kyi dus la brten te brjod na rnam pa gsum las med de /
translated: In terms of time, the scriptures of the various piṭakas are different, but if we speak in terms of time, there are only three.

original: dang po ni bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: dang po ni bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: The first is the wheel of the dharma of the four truths.

original: ji ltar lung rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa sde mang po yod kyang bden pa bzhi gzhung du gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lung rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa sde mang po yod kyang bden pa bzhi gzhung du gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as, although there are many collections of scriptures, such as the four āgamas, the four noble truths are the basis.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i gzhung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i gzhung ste /
translated: The second is the basis of signlessness.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: gsum pa ni nges pa'i don gyi gzhung ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni nges pa'i don gyi gzhung ste /
translated: The third is the basis of definitive meaning.

original: mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is like this sūtra.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las so //
translated: Therefore, below it says from the sūtra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata said this to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po yul b'a r'a na s'i drang srong lhung ba'i gnas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dang po yul b'a r'a na s'i drang srong lhung ba'i gnas /
translated: Bhagavān, in the past, in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana in the region of Vārāṇasī,

original: ri dvags 'byin pa'i nags su nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
analyzed: ri dvags 'byin pa'i nags su nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
translated: for those who had entered the vehicle of the hearers,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa bstan pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags mod kyi de'i tshe yongs su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo de ni bla na mchis pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa bstan pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags mod kyi de'i tshe yongs su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo de ni bla na mchis pa /
translated: However, at that time, the wheel of the Dharma that was turned was surpassable,

original: skabs mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs mchis pa /
translated: had an occasion [for being surpassed],

original: drang ba'i don /
analyzed: drang ba'i don /
translated: was interpretable in meaning,

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags so //
translated: and was a basis for dispute.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon dus gnyis pa'i tshe theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang / skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon dus gnyis pa'i tshe theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang / skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang /
translated: Blessed One, in the second period, for those who have set out in the Great Vehicle, you began with the lack of entityness of phenomena, their non-arising, their non-cessation, their primordial peace,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: and their natural complete nirvāṇa.

original: 'di ltar mi mngon pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba chos ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mngon pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba chos ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags mod kyi /
translated: In this way, you turned the wheel of the true Dharma in an inconceivable manner, a wondrous and marvelous Dharma.

original: de'i tshe yongs su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo de yang bla na mchis pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe yongs su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo de yang bla na mchis pa /
translated: The wheel of Dharma that was turned then was surpassable,

original: skabs mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs mchis pa /
translated: had an occasion [for being surpassed],

original: drang ba'i don /🔽rtsod @25a * //
analyzed: drang ba'i don / rtsod @25a * //
translated: was of interpretable meaning,

original: pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis deng dus gsum pa 'dir theg pa chen po de la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang / skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang /
analyzed: pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis deng dus gsum pa 'dir theg pa chen po de la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang / skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang /
translated: and was a basis for dispute.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas 'di ltar rab tu phye ba'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas 'di ltar rab tu phye ba'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags te /
translated: Blessed One, in this third period, for those who have entered the Great Vehicle, you have turned the wheel of Dharma that is a thorough analysis of the lack of entityness of all phenomena, of non-arising, of non-ceasing, of primordial peace, and of natural nirvāṇa. This wheel of Dharma is truly wondrous and marvelous.

original: deng 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'di ni bla na ma mchis pa /
analyzed: deng 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'di ni bla na ma mchis pa /
translated: The wheel of Dharma that the Blessed One has turned here is unsurpassed,

original: skabs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs ma mchis pa /
translated: has no occasion [for being surpassed],🔽is of definitive meaning,🔽and is not a basis for dispute.

original: nges pa'i don lags te /
analyzed: nges pa'i don lags te /
translated: It is of definitive meaning.

original: rtsod pa rnams kyi gzhi'i gnas su gyur ba ma lags so //
analyzed: rtsod pa rnams kyi gzhi'i gnas su gyur ba ma lags so //
translated: It is not a basis for dispute.

original: bstan pa 'di gsum gyi dgongs pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di gsum gyi dgongs pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the thought of these three teachings is difficult to understand,

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu lo brgya lhag lon nas gnas brtan pa'i sde la sogs pa nyi shu pa'i slob dpon rnams so so nas rang gi gzhung gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu lo brgya lhag lon nas gnas brtan pa'i sde la sogs pa nyi shu pa'i slob dpon rnams so so nas rang gi gzhung gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo rnam par bshad de /
translated: after more than one hundred years had passed after the Buddha passed into nirvāṇa, the teachers of the twenty schools such as the Sthaviravādins each explained the wheel of dharma of the four truths of āryas according to their own texts.

original: yul 'dir 'phags pa'i gsung rab bzhugs pa yang ;
analyzed: yul 'dir 'phags pa'i gsung rab bzhugs pa yang ;
translated: The scriptures of the āryas that exist in this land

original: sde pa gnyis las med de //
analyzed: sde pa gnyis las med de //
translated: are not more than two schools.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde tshad mar byed pa'i sde'o //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde tshad mar byed pa'i sde'o //
translated: They are the Sarvāstivāda and the Sautrāntika.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sde pa gnyis kyi brjod pa mdo tsam du bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sde pa gnyis kyi brjod pa mdo tsam du bshad de /
translated: Therefore here I will explain just a few of the assertions of these two schools.

original: de la thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde pa dag ni chos thams cad la rang bzhin yod pas /
analyzed: de la thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde pa dag ni chos thams cad la rang bzhin yod pas /
translated: The Sarvāstivāda school asserts that all phenomena have a nature.

original: dus gsum gyi chos rnams yang dag par ngo bo nyid yod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi chos rnams yang dag par ngo bo nyid yod do zhes zer te /
translated: They say that phenomena of the three times exist in reality.

original: gzhung 'di yang bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: gzhung 'di yang bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four different explanations of this treatise.

original: dang po ni dngos po 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni dngos po 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The first is that things change.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The second is that characteristics change.

original: gsum pa ni gnas skabs 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnas skabs 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The third is that states change.

original: bzhi pa ni dus 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni dus 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The fourth is that time changes.

original: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las btsun pa chos skyong gis 'di ltar dngos po mi mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las btsun pa chos skyong gis 'di ltar dngos po mi mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise entitled Treasury of Abhidharma, Bhadanta Dharmatrāta explains:

original: dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
translated: The three times are different because things are not similar.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is because

original: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: when phenomena engage in the world,

original: dngos po la bye brag yod kyang ngo bo nyid tha dad @25b pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la bye brag yod kyang ngo bo nyid tha dad @25b pa ni ma yin te /
translated: although there is a difference in things, there is no difference in their nature.

original: ji ltar gser gyi snod bcag ste dngos po gzhan du byas na /
analyzed: ji ltar gser gyi snod bcag ste dngos po gzhan du byas na /
translated: For example, when a golden vessel is destroyed and made into something else,🔽although there is a difference in shape, there is no change in its nature.

original: dbyibs la bye brag yod kyang ngo bo nyid la ni 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa na /
analyzed: dbyibs la bye brag yod kyang ngo bo nyid la ni 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa na /
translated: Similarly, when phenomena engage in the world,

original: ma 'ongs pa nas ni da ltar gyi dus su 'jug la da ltar gyi dus 'di nas ni 'das pa'i dus su 'jug ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa nas ni da ltar gyi dus su 'jug la da ltar gyi dus 'di nas ni 'das pa'i dus su 'jug ste /
translated: The future enters the present and the present enters the past.

original: thob pa'i dngos po dang bral bar zad kyi /
analyzed: thob pa'i dngos po dang bral bar zad kyi /
translated: It is only the entity that is obtained that is lost,

original: thob pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ni bral ba ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ni bral ba ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: but not the nature of the obtainment itself.

original: gnyis pa ni btsun pa rab dbyangs kyis 'di ltar mtshan nyid mi mtshungs pas dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni btsun pa rab dbyangs kyis 'di ltar mtshan nyid mi mtshungs pas dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
translated: The second is that Bhadanta Rāvaṇa explains that the three times are different because they have different characteristics.

original: de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de 'di lta ste /
translated: He says:

original: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: When phenomena are engaged in the world,

original: 'das pa ni 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes mi brjod de /
translated: the past is not said to be devoid of the characteristic of the past.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dus gnyis par sbyar ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dus gnyis par sbyar ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: The two times of the present and future are applied in the same way.

original: ji ltar skyes bu bud med cig la 'dod chags spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu bud med cig la 'dod chags spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: For example, when a man engages in sexual intercourse with a woman,

original: gzhan khyad par can dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan khyad par can dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: he is not said to be free of desire for other special women.

original: gsum pa ni btsun pa dbyig gi bshes gnyen gyis 'di ltar gnas skabs mi mtshungs pas dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni btsun pa dbyig gi bshes gnyen gyis 'di ltar gnas skabs mi mtshungs pas dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
translated: The Venerable Vasumitra explains: The three times are different because their states are not the same.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /🔽gnas skabs nas gnas skabs su gyur pa la /
analyzed: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe / gnas skabs nas gnas skabs su gyur pa la /
translated: when phenomena are engaged in the world,

original: gzhan dang gzhan du zhes ston te /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du zhes ston te /
translated: they are taught to be different from one state to another

original: gnas skabs la bye brag yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs la bye brag yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because their states are differentiated.

original: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not different in substance,🔽just as when one moves a single unit to the place of the tens, it is called ten,🔽when it is moved to the place of the hundreds, it is called one hundred,

original: ji ltar shod cig bskyod nas grangs gcig gi gnas su bzhag pa'i tshe ni gcig ces bya ba dang / brgya'i steng du bzhag pa'i tshe ni brgya zhes bya ba dang / stong gi tshe'i steng du bzhag pa'i tshe ni stong zhes brjod pa bzhin no zhe'o //🔽bzhi pa ni btsun pa rtogs pa'i lhas 'di ltar dus mi mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar shod cig bskyod nas grangs gcig gi gnas su bzhag pa'i tshe ni gcig ces bya ba dang / brgya'i steng du bzhag pa'i tshe ni brgya zhes bya ba dang / stong gi tshe'i steng du bzhag pa'i tshe ni stong zhes brjod pa bzhin no zhe'o // bzhi pa ni btsun pa rtogs pa'i lhas 'di ltar dus mi mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: and when it is moved to the place of the thousands, it is called one thousand.

original: dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dus gsum tha dad do zhes bshad de /
translated: The Venerable Bodhayasa explains: The three times are different because their times are not the same.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos rnams 'jig rten na 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: When phenomena engage the world,

original: snga phyi phan tshun sdod pas /
analyzed: snga phyi phan tshun sdod pas /
translated: they are mutually sequential and simultaneous.

original: ming tha dad par rnam par gzhag ste /🔽ji ltar bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: ming tha dad par rnam par gzhag ste / ji ltar bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang bya /
translated: Therefore they are posited as different names.🔽Just as one woman is called mother and daughter.

original: bu mo zhes kyang bya zhes brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: bu mo zhes kyang bya zhes brjod do zhe'o //
translated: This is said to be the case.🔽Although there are four explanations, the third is best.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhis bshad pa yod kyang gsum pa bzang ste de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas @26a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhis bshad pa yod kyang gsum pa bzang ste de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas @26a * //
translated: Therefore the treatise Kṣaṇabhanghbhāṣya says:

original: pa las / de dag la ni tshig rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: pa las / de dag la ni tshig rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: They have four terms:

original: dngos po mtshan nyid gnas skabs sdod 'gyur te //🔽gsum la byed pa la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: dngos po mtshan nyid gnas skabs sdod 'gyur te // gsum la byed pa la ni brten nas su //
translated: Entity, characteristic, state, and transformation.🔽The best is the third,

original: dus su rnam par gzhag pas mchog tu bzang //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dus su rnam par gzhag pas mchog tu bzang // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: which is posited as time in dependence on activity.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa gzhan rnam pa gsum pa dag sun 'byin pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa gzhan rnam pa gsum pa dag sun 'byin pa las /
translated: Other commentaries on this text refute the third position.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag las /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag las /
translated: From among those four assertions of the Sarvāstivāda,

original: dang po ni chos rnams rnam par 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dang po ni chos rnams rnam par 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: the first is when phenomena are apprehended.

original: mu stegs grangs can gyi rigs nyid du rnam par gzhag go / gnyis pa ni dus kyi mtshan nyid 'dren pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pas dus gsum po kun la yang /🔽dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid yod pa bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs grangs can gyi rigs nyid du rnam par gzhag go / gnyis pa ni dus kyi mtshan nyid 'dren pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pas dus gsum po kun la yang / dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid yod pa bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The tīrthikas posit the self as the nature of the elements.🔽The second is the assertion that the three times exist in every moment of consciousness because the three times are apprehended as if they had characteristics that define them as the three times.

original: bzhi pa ni snga phyi phan tshun sdod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pas dus gcig gi chos la dus gsum yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni snga phyi phan tshun sdod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pas dus gcig gi chos la dus gsum yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The fourth is the assertion that the three times exist in a single phenomenon because the three times are posited as being mutually present.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi snga phyi'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi snga phyi'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: the past and future moments of the past are called the past and future,

original: bar ma ni da ltar zhes bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: bar ma ni da ltar zhes bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs te /
translated: and the middle one is called the present.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The same would be true of the future and the present.

original: rnam pa bzhi las gsungs pa mchog tu bzang ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi las gsungs pa mchog tu bzang ste /
translated: Among the four assertions, the last one is the best.

original: 'di ltar byed pa'i dbang gis gnas skabs tha dad la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa'i dbang gis gnas skabs tha dad la /
translated: The three times are posited as different states due to their function.

original: gnas skabs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because their states are not the same,

original: dus rnam par gzhag pa yang tha dad de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus rnam par gzhag pa yang tha dad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: their times are also different.

original: chos rnams gang gi tshe bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams gang gi tshe bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, when a dharma does not perform its activity, it is called future.

original: gang gi tshe byed pa de'i tshe ni da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed pa de'i tshe ni da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When it performs its activity, it is called present.

original: gang gi tshe byas nas 'gags pa de'i tshe ni 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byas nas 'gags pa de'i tshe ni 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When it has performed its activity and ceased, it is called past.

original: ngo bo nyid tha dad par gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tha dad par gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not assert that they are different in their intrinsic reality.

original: gal te de ltar na da ltar yod pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yod pa de dag kyang skal ba mtshungs pas bsdus pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na da ltar yod pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yod pa de dag kyang skal ba mtshungs pas bsdus pa yin na /
translated: If that is so, then the present eye faculty and so on that exist are also subsumed by homogeneous collection.

original: de dag la byed pa ji lta bu zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de dag la byed pa ji lta bu zhig yod ce na /
translated: What function do they have?

original: ci de dag 'bras bu len cing 'bras bu 'byin nus pa ma yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci de dag 'bras bu len cing 'bras bu 'byin nus pa ma yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: They are said to be unable to take or give results.

original: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //🔽gnyis pa mdo sde @26b tshad mar byed pa'i sde pa rnams ni 'di skad du chos thams cad la rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhung rab tu bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i rigs pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do // gnyis pa mdo sde @26b tshad mar byed pa'i sde pa rnams ni 'di skad du chos thams cad la rang bzhin med do //

original: da ltar gyi dus ni yod do //🔽dus gnyis ni med do zhes rnam par 'jog ste /🔽ku ma ra ta dang / shi ri ra ta la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽slob dpon mang po gzhan mi mthun par smra ba dag ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang mthun pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /🔽// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus ni yod do //🔽dus gnyis ni med do zhes rnam par 'jog ste /🔽ku ma ra ta dang / shi ri ra ta la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽slob dpon mang po gzhan mi mthun par smra ba dag ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang mthun pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /🔽// / bam po gsum pa /
translated: And the treatise masterly explains in accordance with the Abhidharmakośa.

original: de la gnyis pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / gsum pa nges pa'i don ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de la gnyis pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / gsum pa nges pa'i don ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: In the Viniścayasaṅgraha it says:

original: de las ji skad du sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu bdud kyi las cher g-yos /
analyzed: de las ji skad du sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu bdud kyi las cher g-yos /
translated: After the Buddha passed into nirvāṇa, the works of Māra increased greatly.

original: sde pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa rnams so so nas rab tu langs te /
analyzed: sde pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa rnams so so nas rab tu langs te /
translated: The various schools of tenets arose,🔽and most of them clung to views that were distorted.

original: phal cher g-yos pa nyid du lta ba la mngon par zhen pas byang chub sems dpa' klu sgrub sa rab tu dga' ba brnyes pas theg pa chen po mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi gsung rab la brten nas bstan bcos dbu ma la sogs pa mdzad
analyzed: phal cher g-yos pa nyid du lta ba la mngon par zhen pas byang chub sems dpa' klu sgrub sa rab tu dga' ba brnyes pas theg pa chen po mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi gsung rab la brten nas bstan bcos dbu ma la sogs pa mdzad
translated: The bodhisattva Nāgārjuna, having attained the ground of Supreme Joy, composed the treatises such as the Mūlamadhyamaka based on the Mahāyāna scriptures of emptiness that are free of characteristics.

original: de / yang dag pa nyid kyi don rgya cher bstan nas yod par lta ba de dag rab tu bsal to ;
analyzed: de / yang dag pa nyid kyi don rgya cher bstan nas yod par lta ba de dag rab tu bsal to ;
translated: He taught the meaning of suchness extensively and thoroughly refuted those views of existence.

original: /'phags pa'i lha la sogs pa bstan bcos kyi mkhan po chen por grags pa rnams kyis bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa la sogs pa byas nas don chen po rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: /'phags pa'i lha la sogs pa bstan bcos kyi mkhan po chen por grags pa rnams kyis bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa la sogs pa byas nas don chen po rgya cher bstan te /
translated: The great masters of the treatises, such as Āryadeva, composed extensive treatises such as the Hundred Stanzas, and taught the great meaning extensively.

original: des na sems can rnams stong pa nyid du lta ba la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: des na sems can rnams stong pa nyid du lta ba la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Therefore, sentient beings are attached to the view of emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thogs med sa dang po brnyes pas chos kyi 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par rtogs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thogs med sa dang po brnyes pas chos kyi 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par rtogs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Asaṅga, having attained the first ground, had the realization of the great magical power of the light of Dharma samādhi.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal mngon sum du mthong ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal mngon sum du mthong ba /
translated: He directly saw the face of Ārya Maitreya.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa bshad par gsol te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa bshad par gsol te /
translated: He requested the explanation of the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: 'dir rig pa mthar ma gtugs pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'dir rig pa mthar ma gtugs pa ci yang med do //
translated: Here, there is nothing that is not included in knowledge.

original: dngos po mi zad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: dngos po mi zad pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not an inexhaustible thing.

original: tshig 'bru rnam par ma bshad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: tshig 'bru rnam par ma bshad pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not explained by words.

original: don ma brjod pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: don ma brjod pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not expressed by meaning.

original: the tshom ma bsal ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: the tshom ma bsal ba ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not resolved by doubt.

original: so so'i 'dzin pa rnam par ma gzhig pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: so so'i 'dzin pa rnam par ma gzhig pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not destroyed by the individual apprehensions.

original: spyod pa rnams ma spyad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: spyod pa rnams ma spyad pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not practiced in the conduct.
