original: @27a * // 'bras bu mngon sum mi byed pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: @27a * // 'bras bu mngon sum mi byed pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is not actualized as a result.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / theg pa gzhan rnams kyi phyir rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / theg pa gzhan rnams kyi phyir rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is explained extensively for the bodhisattvas and for those of other vehicles.

original: de ltar 'grel pa de las gzhung rnam pa gnyis bshad zin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'grel pa de las gzhung rnam pa gnyis bshad zin mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although the two texts have already been explained in that commentary,

original: gzhung rnam pa gnyis po de dag re re la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzhung rnam pa gnyis po de dag re re la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: each of those two texts has three explanations.

original: de la mtshan nyid med pa'i gzhung la slob dpon gsum gyis 'di skad du bstan te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid med pa'i gzhung la slob dpon gsum gyis 'di skad du bstan te /
translated: Regarding the text that lacks characteristics, three masters taught as follows.

original: kha cig ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum zhib tu bshad dgos so zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum zhib tu bshad dgos so zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the three natures must be explained in detail from the three natures.

original: bha bya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bha bya la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is Bhavaviveka and so on.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos lag na rin po che tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos lag na rin po che tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: Therefore the Ratnakarandodghata composed by Nagarjuna says:

original: yang dag ngo bo nyid du 'dus byas stong //
analyzed: yang dag ngo bo nyid du 'dus byas stong //
translated: The conditioned is empty of an intrinsic reality.

original: sgyu ma ji bzhin rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgyu ma ji bzhin rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises from conditions, like an illusion,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang yang dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang yang dag yod ma yin //
translated: The unconditioned also does not have true existence.

original: ma byung nam mkha'i me tog rab tu 'dra //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma byung nam mkha'i me tog rab tu 'dra // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is just like a sky flower that does not occur.

original: kha cig ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis yongs su btsal bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kha cig ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis yongs su btsal bar ma zad kyi /
translated: Some say: Not only is the twofold intrinsic reality investigated,

original: yongs su grub ba'i ngo bo nyid ni mi btsal te /
analyzed: yongs su grub ba'i ngo bo nyid ni mi btsal te /
translated: but also the consummate intrinsic reality is not investigated.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde dag la brtags pa'i btsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde dag la brtags pa'i btsal ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is investigated in the sūtras,

original: chos yongs su btsal bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: chos yongs su btsal bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: but it is not an object of investigation of the Dharma.

original: kha cig ni rnam pa gsum la kun brtags pa nyi tshe btsal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam pa gsum la kun brtags pa nyi tshe btsal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Some say: The three aspects are investigated in terms of the limited investigation of the imaginary.

original: ji ltar mdo 'di las 'og nas ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum bstan pas /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo 'di las 'og nas ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum bstan pas /
translated: For example, as this sūtra explains later, the three types of realitylessness are taught,

original: kun brtags yongs su btsal ba gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kun brtags yongs su btsal ba gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: and the imaginary is said to be investigated.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although such a threefold explanation exists,

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gi dgongs pa ni rnam par bshad pa phyi ma yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gi dgongs pa ni rnam par bshad pa phyi ma yin par dgongs so //
translated: The master Hyanacandra thinks that the latter explanation is correct.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i nges pa'i don la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i nges pa'i don la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Maitreya's Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes has three explanations of the ultimate.

original: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa na re /
analyzed: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa na re /
translated: The first is that the master Bhāviveka says:

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum rab tu btsal nas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum rab tu btsal nas /
translated: Having thoroughly investigated the three natures,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa gsum rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa gsum rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the three absences of nature are posited.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid btsal nas /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid btsal nas /
translated: Having investigated the imagined nature,

original: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the imagined characteristic is posited as an absence of nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su btsal nas /
translated: Having investigated the dependent nature,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba med pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the dependent nature's production is posited as an absence of nature.

original: @27b yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid btsal nas /
analyzed: @27b yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid btsal nas /
translated: Having investigated the consummate nature,

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: the consummate nature

original: ngo bo nyid med par rnam par gzhag go zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par rnam par gzhag go zhes bshad de /
translated: is posited as an absence of nature.

original: slob dpon bha bya dang / bye brag yod pa yang ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ni bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo yin la /
analyzed: slob dpon bha bya dang / bye brag yod pa yang ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ni bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo yin la /
translated: Master Bhavaviveka says: The three kinds of reality are the door to the classification of the truths.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum gyi don ni rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pas /🔽slob dpon bha bya ltar yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum gyi don ni rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pas / slob dpon bha bya ltar yongs su btsal nas /
translated: The three kinds of unreality are not the door to the classification of the truths.

original: rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should not seek the classification of the truths in the manner of master Bhavaviveka.

original: gnyis pa ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis btsal bar zad kyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis btsal bar zad kyi /
translated: The second says: One should seek only the two kinds of reality.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi btsal te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi btsal te /
translated: One should not seek the perfected reality,

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa dag ni stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa dag ni stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because that which arises from causes and conditions is emptiness.

original: gsum pa ni kun brtags pa btsal bar zad kyi /
analyzed: gsum pa ni kun brtags pa btsal bar zad kyi /
translated: The third says: One should seek only the imagined reality.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis btsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis btsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: One should not seek the two kinds of reality,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhe'o //🔽de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhe'o // de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang /
translated: because the two kinds of reality are not the domain of the imagination.

original: bshad pa phyi ma yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa phyi ma yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, although there are these three explanations, the latter two are not correct.

original: mdo sde 'di nyid la yi ge dang mthun zhing don 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nyid la yi ge dang mthun zhing don 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this very sūtra is consistent with the words and does not contradict the meaning.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum la zab pa dang / mi zab pa ltar yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum la zab pa dang / mi zab pa ltar yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are there profound and nonprofound aspects in the three turnings of the wheel of dharma?

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis te /🔽dang po ni slob dpon bha bya la sogs pas 'di skad du bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo dang po ni nyan thos kyi gsung rab yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis te / dang po ni slob dpon bha bya la sogs pas 'di skad du bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo dang po ni nyan thos kyi gsung rab yin te /
translated: There are two explanations.

original: sems can stong pa 'ba' zhig ston cing chos stong pa nyid ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa ma yin no //🔽gnyis pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can stong pa 'ba' zhig ston cing chos stong pa nyid ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa ma yin no // gnyis pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is that the master Bhāviveka and so on say that the first wheel of dharma of the four truths is the scriptural collection of the śrāvakas because it is not profound, for it teaches only the emptiness of sentient beings and does not teach the emptiness of phenomena.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las ngo bo nyid gsum la sogs pa ston cing dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /🔽shin tu zab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las ngo bo nyid gsum la sogs pa ston cing dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir / shin tu zab pa ma yin no //
translated: The second is the Mahāyāna with signs, such as the noble Unraveling the Intention Sūtra, which teaches the three natures and so on and is not very profound because it has reference points.

original: gsum pa mtshan ma med pa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa mtshan ma med pa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the signless Mahāyāna, such as the Perfection of Wisdom Sūtras.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams las chos rnams stong pa nyid du ston cing dmigs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams las chos rnams stong pa nyid du ston cing dmigs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom teaches that phenomena are emptiness and is non-apprehending,

original: shin tu zab pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: shin tu zab pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: it is very profound.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pas mdo sde la brten nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pas mdo sde la brten nas /
translated: Second, the master Dharmapāla and others, based on the sūtras, say:

original: 'di skad du dang po ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad du dang po ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: First, the four noble truths were taught.

original: de'i 'og tu mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
translated: After that, the teaching without characteristics was given.

original: tha mar ni nges pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: tha mar ni nges pa'i don bstan te /
translated: In the end, the definitive meaning was taught.

original: @28a * // bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @28a * // bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the wheel of dharma of the four truths is as explained above.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo phyi ma gnyis ni mtshan nyid med pa ston pas don la zab mi zab ces bstan du med do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo phyi ma gnyis ni mtshan nyid med pa ston pas don la zab mi zab ces bstan du med do //
translated: The meaning of the latter two wheels of dharma cannot be taught as profound or not profound because they teach without characteristics.

original: gsung rab rnam pa gnyis la nges pa ma yin pa zhes brjod pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa yang rnam pa gsum yod pa dang / med pa'i rigs pa gsal bar rab tu phye nas bstan pa'i phyir ni nges pa'i don ces brjod la /
analyzed: gsung rab rnam pa gnyis la nges pa ma yin pa zhes brjod pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa yang rnam pa gsum yod pa dang / med pa'i rigs pa gsal bar rab tu phye nas bstan pa'i phyir ni nges pa'i don ces brjod la /
translated: Also, the two kinds of scriptures are called “indeterminate” because they do not clearly distinguish the three kinds of unreality and the reasoning of existence and non-existence, and they are called “determinate” because they teach the three kinds of unreality and the reasoning of existence and non-existence in a clear way.

original: gsang ba'i rnam pas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs par bstan pa'i phyir ni ma nges pa'i don zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gsang ba'i rnam pas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs par bstan pa'i phyir ni ma nges pa'i don zhes bshad de /
translated: And they are called “indeterminate” because they teach all things as unreal in a hidden way.

original: don la zab pa dang / zab pa ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes brjod pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //🔽ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las ngo bo nyid gang btsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don la zab pa dang / zab pa ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes brjod pa ni ma yin no zhe'o // ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las ngo bo nyid gang btsal ba'i phyir /
translated: But they are not called “determinate” and “indeterminate” because of the profundity or non-profundity of their meaning.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: From among the three kinds of unreality, which unreality is sought by the investigation of which reality?

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gi bshad pa dang sbyar na ni kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig btsal bas so //
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gi bshad pa dang sbyar na ni kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig btsal bas so //
translated: If it is applied to the explanation of the master Dharmapāla, it is the imagined alone that is sought by the investigation.

original: slob dpon bha byas bshad pa dang sbyar na ni /
analyzed: slob dpon bha byas bshad pa dang sbyar na ni /
translated: If it is applied to the explanation of the master Bhāviveka,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig btsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig btsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is only the other-dependent entity that is sought.

original: bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like the one hundred thousand verse Extensive Transcendent Wisdom Scripture.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis gzhung rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis gzhung rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Master Dharmottara presents the treatise as follows:

original: bshad pa las 'byung ba kun tu brtags pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa las 'byung ba kun tu brtags pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid ni med pa yin no //
translated: The imagined reality that appears in the explanation does not exist.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The reality that arises from causes and conditions does exist.

original: don 'di bsgrub ba'i phyir mdo sde las 'byung ba'i khungs bstan pa /
analyzed: don 'di bsgrub ba'i phyir mdo sde las 'byung ba'i khungs bstan pa /
translated: To prove this point, he cites a passage from the scriptures:

original: kun tu rtog pa dag ni med pa yin //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa dag ni med pa yin //
translated: Imagined realities do not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni ngo bo nyid yod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni ngo bo nyid yod do //
translated: Other-dependent realities do exist.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog stong 'jig na //🔽sgro 'dogs skur 'debs mtha' gnyis lhung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog stong 'jig na // sgro 'dogs skur 'debs mtha' gnyis lhung bar 'gyur //
translated: When you destroy the false imagination,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: you fall into the two extremes of superimposition and deprecation.

original: zhes bshad do //🔽slob dpon bha byas dpyad de bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bshad do // slob dpon bha byas dpyad de bshad pa /
translated: He explains:

original: mdo sde 'di las ming ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las ming ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
translated: This scripture says that names are imagined.

original: don ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: don ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The meaning is the dependent nature.

original: ming de ni don la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa'o //
analyzed: ming de ni don la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa'o //
translated: The name does not exist in the object, so it is said to be nonexistent.

original: don ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin pas /
analyzed: don ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin pas /
translated: The object is not nonexistent because it exists in the world.

original: gtan tshigs 'dis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par bsdus pa 'di mi rung ngo zhes slob @28b dpon chos skyong gis ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par bsdus pa 'di mi rung ngo zhes slob @28b dpon chos skyong gis ni 'di skad du /
translated: Thus the master Dharmapāla says:

original: rnam par bshad pa 'di mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'di mi rung ste /
translated: This explanation is untenable.

original: don 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts the meaning.

original: gal te ming don la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ming don la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa yin na /
translated: If the name does not exist in the object, it is nonexistent.

original: don yang ming la med pa yin na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: don yang ming la med pa yin na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: If the object does not exist in the name, how could it exist?

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par brtags pa rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med na /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par brtags pa brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par brtags pa rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med na / yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par brtags pa brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: If the nature of expression that is the imagined object of expression does not exist,

original: ci yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: how could the nature of the object of expression that is the imagined object of expression exist?

original: kun rdzob tu brtags pa tsam du rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba med na yang 'dra ba med na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu brtags pa tsam du rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba med na yang 'dra ba med na /
translated: and that they are merely imputed conventionally, and that if the object of expression does not exist, the expression does not exist,

original: yod na yang mnyam du yod pa yin la ci'i phyir /
analyzed: yod na yang mnyam du yod pa yin la ci'i phyir /
translated: and if it does exist, they exist equally.

original: mdo sde las gcig ni yod la gcig ni med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde las gcig ni yod la gcig ni med ces gsungs te /
translated: Why does the scripture say that one exists and one does not?

original: de'i phyir khyod kyi smra ba 'di mdo sde'i don dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyi smra ba 'di mdo sde'i don dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore your statement is not in accord with the meaning of the scripture.

original: kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid med par yid ches par byas te /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid med par yid ches par byas te /
translated: You should believe that the imagined nature does not exist,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi brdzun du rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi brdzun du rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is posited as false for worldly people.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes te /
translated: The dependent nature is born from causes and conditions,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyis byas pa ma yin pas yod pa nyid du yid ches par bya'o zhes sun 'byin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyis byas pa ma yin pas yod pa nyid du yid ches par bya'o zhes sun 'byin to //
translated: and since it is not created by an unreal mind, you should believe that it exists.

original: slob dpon bha byas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon bha byas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Master Bhavaviveka refutes this, arguing that the dependent nature does not exist,🔽because it is not a real entity.

original: mdo sde las 'byung ba'i khungs bstan pa /🔽cung zad skye ba'i chos ni gang yang med //
analyzed: mdo sde las 'byung ba'i khungs bstan pa / cung zad skye ba'i chos ni gang yang med //
translated: The teaching of the scriptural source🔽There is no existent thing whatsoever that arises

original: cung zad 'gag par 'gyur ba'i chos kyang med //
analyzed: cung zad 'gag par 'gyur ba'i chos kyang med //
translated: Nor is there any existent thing whatsoever that ceases.

original: rnam dag lta bas chos rnams rab brtags na //
analyzed: rnam dag lta bas chos rnams rab brtags na //
translated: When one thoroughly investigates phenomena with the pure view,

original: yod pa 'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: yod pa 'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin no // zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: They are neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gi bshad pa 'dis kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub mi nus te /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gi bshad pa 'dis kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub mi nus te /
translated: The master Dharmottara’s explanation also cannot prove that the dependent nature does not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i dgongs pa ni kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba de dag gis ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par rnam par brtags pa dang bral ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pas 'jig rten rnams rab tu brtags na /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i dgongs pa ni kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba de dag gis ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa dang / skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par rnam par brtags pa dang bral ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pas 'jig rten rnams rab tu brtags na /
translated: The thought of this verse is that when worldly beings thoroughly investigate with the pure view that is free of the conceptualization of the imagined nature’s attributes that are expressed and the expression that expresses them, they see that the nature of those is empty, unborn, and unceasing.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par mthong ngo zhes ston pas /🔽de'i phyir 'di gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub @29a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par mthong ngo zhes ston pas / de'i phyir 'di gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub @29a * //
translated: Because it arises from causes and conditions, it is seen to be neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, this does not prove that the dependent nature does not exist.

original: slob dpon bha byas gal te tshig tu smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon bha byas gal te tshig tu smras pa /
translated: The master Bhāviveka says:

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na /
translated: If the dependent nature exists,

original: ci'i phyir mdo sde las chos thams cad mi stong pa gang yang med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo sde las chos thams cad mi stong pa gang yang med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: why did the sūtra say, “There is not a single phenomenon that is not empty”?

original: gzhan yang mdo sde las gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis med do zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid skye ba gang yang med pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde las gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis med do zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid skye ba gang yang med pas /
translated: Moreover, the sūtra says, “Phenomena such as form do not exist by nature,” and “Since there is no arising of the essence of any phenomenon,

original: sngon yod pa dang / sngon med pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sngon yod pa dang / sngon med pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: the name ‘previously existent’ or ‘previously nonexistent’ is not observed.”

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa 'di la yang dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa 'di la yang dgongs pa yin te /
translated: The master Dharmākara explains that this also has a special intention.

original: dgongs pa de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: dgongs pa de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the intention behind that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: mdo sde 'di rnams las kun tu brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid 'jig par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di rnams las kun tu brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid 'jig par mdzad kyi /
translated: These sūtras destroy the imagined essential nature.

original: thams cad med do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad med do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not say that everything is nonexistent.

original: dgongs pa 'di lta bu yod par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di lta bu yod par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that this is the intention?

original: mdo sde gzhan las gsal bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las gsal bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is clearly stated in other sūtras.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gsungs te /🔽ngas mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang bzhin la dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gsungs te / ngas mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang bzhin la dgongs nas /
translated: It is as follows.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med do zhes bshad de /🔽gal te la la zhig sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med do zhes bshad de / gal te la la zhig sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas /
translated: The Bhagavat said, “I explained that all phenomena lack an essential nature with the intention of the nature of their being related.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rang bzhin gyis med do zhes zer na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rang bzhin gyis med do zhes zer na /
translated: If someone, adhering to the literal meaning, said, ‘The phenomena of affliction and purification do not exist essentially,’

original: stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba de ni log par lta ba zhes bya ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba de ni log par lta ba zhes bya ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: that misapprehension of emptiness would be called ‘wrong views.’

original: de la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi kun tu brtags pa rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi kun tu brtags pa rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.🔽The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa rnams la dgongs pa 'di lta bu yod par shes so //🔽gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /🔽bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis yod pa dang med pa'i don gsal bar bcad de /🔽kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thams cad du med pa zhas bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa rnams la dgongs pa 'di lta bu yod par shes so // gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis yod pa dang med pa'i don gsal bar bcad de / kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thams cad du med pa zhas bya'o //
translated: The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.🔽The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.🔽The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.🔽The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.🔽The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.🔽The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature of the imagined and the dependent.🔽The nature of the imagined is the nature of the imagined, which is the imagined nature of the dependent and the real.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa rnams ni yod do zhes brjod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa rnams ni yod do zhes brjod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The dependent is the dependent nature, which is the dependent nature of the imagined and the real.🔽The real is the real nature, which is the real nature

original: gzhan yang mdo sde gzhan dag las kun @29b tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde gzhan dag las kun @29b tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in other sūtras it says that phenomena are not produced by an imagined nature.🔽It says that phenomena included in the dependent nature are produced from causes and conditions.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa'i chos rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde mang po las chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa'i chos rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo sde mang po las chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: Moreover, in many sūtras it says that phenomena are essenceless,

original: skye ba dang 'gag ba la sogs pa med kyang thams cad du rab tu dbye bar bya'i /🔽sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag ba la sogs pa med kyang thams cad du rab tu dbye bar bya'i / sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas /
translated: that they do not arise or cease, and so forth, and that they should be differentiated in every way.

original: nges pa'i don yin no zhes bzung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don yin no zhes bzung du mi rung ste /
translated: But it is not suitable to take them literally and hold that they are of definitive meaning.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa tsam du yang chos rnams med do zhes stong pa nyid du nyes par bzung nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa tsam du yang chos rnams med do zhes stong pa nyid du nyes par bzung nas /
translated: It is said that one should not apprehend emptiness wrongly, thinking that phenomena do not exist even as conventional truths,

original: log par lta ba chen po bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba chen po bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: and that one should not cultivate the great wrong view.

original: slob dpon bha byas yang gtan tshigs kyis bsgrubs te smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon bha byas yang gtan tshigs kyis bsgrubs te smras pa /
translated: The master Bhavya also argues by means of a syllogism:

original: smra ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This statement is not reasonable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo las gzhan dang gzhan du rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo las gzhan dang gzhan du rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is differentiated in other sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis 'di skad du /
translated: The Bhagavat himself said this:

original: mdo sde gang du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde gang du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
translated: “Those sūtras that teach emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-composition, non-arising, non-cessation, essencelessness, the absence of sentient beings,

original: srog med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sgo la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: srog med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i sgo la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: the absence of life-force, the absence of owner, the absence of person, the door of liberation, and so on are called sūtras of definitive meaning.”

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa /
translated: The master Dharmāśoka explains:

original: bdag gis smras pa 'di rigs pa dang shin tu mthun te /
analyzed: bdag gis smras pa 'di rigs pa dang shin tu mthun te /
translated: “What I have said is very much in accord with reasoning.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan dag las bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan dag las bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Because in other sūtras the Bhagavat himself has distinguished definitive and provisional sūtras.

original: ngas kun tu brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas mdo sde gzhan dag las chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: ngas kun tu brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas mdo sde gzhan dag las chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: With the imagined intrinsic reality in mind, in other sūtras the Lord taught that all phenomena are natureless, non-arisen, non-ceasing, primordially peaceful, and naturally passed beyond sorrow.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas ni sems can rnams kyi sems skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'khor bar 'jug pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan to zhes gsungs so //🔽gzhan yang mdo sde gzhan dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis @30a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas ni sems can rnams kyi sems skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'khor bar 'jug pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan to zhes gsungs so // gzhan yang mdo sde gzhan dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis @30a * //
translated: With the relative intrinsic reality in mind, he taught that the minds of sentient beings arise, cease, and engage in cyclic existence.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: Moreover, in other sūtras the Lord said:

original: sha ra dva ti'i du gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i du gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, form is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is empty of intrinsic nature,

original: skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: it is non-arisen and non-ceasing.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is non-arisen and non-ceasing,

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: it is uncontaminated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: The same is true of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: 'di ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This is because the Buddha taught that the imagined nature is empty of intrinsic reality, and that it is devoid of origination, cessation, and so forth.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid gsungs te /
translated: The other-dependent nature is said to be empty because it is devoid of the imagined nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not empty of the ultimate, of the perfected, of the unmistaken, of the unborn, of cessation, and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dang de dag ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dang de dag ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las /
translated: The Tathāgata taught that the other-dependent nature and the perfected nature exist.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The imagined nature is empty.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis ni yod pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis ni yod pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The other-dependent nature and the perfected nature exist.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: stong pa nyid du bstan pa gsung rab dag la dgongs pa yod pas sgra ji bzhin du chos rnams med do zhes skur bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bstan pa gsung rab dag la dgongs pa yod pas sgra ji bzhin du chos rnams med do zhes skur bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not deprecate things by literally taking them to be nonexistent, because the scriptures that teach emptiness have a further intention.

original: sgra ji bzhin du don 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni theg pa chen po la skur pa 'debs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du don 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni theg pa chen po la skur pa 'debs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that those who take the meaning literally deprecate the Great Vehicle.🔽Moreover, a sutra declares:

original: gzhan yang mdo sde las rab 'byor gzugs zhes bya ba'i gzugs rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde las rab 'byor gzugs zhes bya ba'i gzugs rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Subhuti, forms called “forms” should be understood to be essentially natureless.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed la sogs pa rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed la sogs pa rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: The same is said in detail for feelings, discriminations, composites, and so forth.

original: mdo sde'i dgongs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas rab tu phye ba tshig dang bral ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde'i dgongs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas rab tu phye ba tshig dang bral ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: The thought of the sutra is this: The dependent nature is distinguished by the essencelessness of the imagined nature, and it is natureless in terms of the nature of things that are free from verbal proliferation.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba gsungs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba gsungs so zhes ston to //
translated: The master Nāgārjuna taught that the dependent nature is the nature that is without nature.

original: slob dpon bha byas gal te tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon bha byas gal te tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: The master Bhāviveka says in verse:

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gal te yang dag par yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gal te yang dag par yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the dependent nature does not exist,

original: 'o na ni mdo sde las gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni mdo sde las gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it contradicts the sūtras.

original: mdo sde las ni /
analyzed: mdo sde las ni /
translated: For the sūtras say:

original: chos rnams rkyen las byung ba ste //
analyzed: chos rnams rkyen las byung ba ste //
translated: All phenomena arise from conditions.

original: rkyen dang chos gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang chos gnyis med pa'o //
translated: There are no phenomena apart from conditions.

original: gang gis @30b de ltar rab shes na //
analyzed: gang gis @30b de ltar rab shes na //
translated: Those who know this well

original: rten 'brel rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten 'brel rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to understand dependent origination.

original: gal te chos ni rkyen las skyes //
analyzed: gal te chos ni rkyen las skyes //
translated: If phenomena arise from conditions,

original: chos de yong gis rang bzhin med //
analyzed: chos de yong gis rang bzhin med //
translated: then phenomena do not intrinsically exist.

original: gal te chos ni rang bzhin med //🔽chos ni rkyen las byung ba min //
analyzed: gal te chos ni rang bzhin med // chos ni rkyen las byung ba min //
translated: If phenomena do not intrinsically exist,

original: zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: then phenomena do not arise from conditions.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa /
translated: The master Dharmottara explains:

original: de ltar mdo sde gnyis las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rang bzhin med do zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde gnyis las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rang bzhin med do zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the explanation of the absence of intrinsic reality of things that are dependently arisen in the two sūtras.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two kinds of things that are dependently arisen:

original: kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the imagined and the other-dependent natures.

original: 'dir dgongs pas kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par ston cing gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pas kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par ston cing gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the imagined nature is taught to be nonexistent, but the other-dependent nature is not taught to be nonexistent.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gzod ma nas rang bzhin med do zhes bshad pa ni rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gnyis kyang med par skur bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gzod ma nas rang bzhin med do zhes bshad pa ni rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gnyis kyang med par skur bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If the other-dependent nature is explained to be essentially beginningless and nonexistent, then this deprecates both the phenomena of affliction and purification,

original: stong pa nyid nyes par zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyes par zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and it is called “the misapprehension of emptiness.”

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: It is said to be harmful to both oneself and others.

original: slob dpon bha byas yang smras pa //
analyzed: slob dpon bha byas yang smras pa //
translated: Master Bhāviveka also says:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa 'di su zhig bzlog par nus te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa 'di su zhig bzlog par nus te /
translated: Who can stop this false imagination?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba thob par gyur ba'i tshe rang nyid kyis bsal bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba thob par gyur ba'i tshe rang nyid kyis bsal bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: When one obtains the right view, it will be eliminated by itself.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa /
translated: Ācārya Dharmapāla explains:

original: gal te rkyen las 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de dag kyang kun brtags dang 'dra bar thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rkyen las 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de dag kyang kun brtags dang 'dra bar thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin na /
translated: If these minds and mental factors that arise from conditions are all empty of intrinsic reality like the imagined,

original: 'o na ni nam mkha'i me tog 'dra bas /
analyzed: 'o na ni nam mkha'i me tog 'dra bas /
translated: then they are like flowers in the sky.

original: ji ltar srid pa gsum gyi sems can 'chi zhing skye shi'i 'khor ba byed par nus /
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa gsum gyi sems can 'chi zhing skye shi'i 'khor ba byed par nus /
translated: How can they perform the function of sentient beings in the three realms of existence being born and dying and transmigrating?

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the dependent nature is not devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dang po'i dgongs pa yang nges par de 'dra'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dang po'i dgongs pa yang nges par de 'dra'o //
translated: The intention of the author of the treatise is definitely like that.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa'i 'ching ba dag ni stong pa nyid mngon par rtogs pas rab tu sel te zhes bshad /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa'i 'ching ba dag ni stong pa nyid mngon par rtogs pas rab tu sel te zhes bshad /
translated: If that were not so, why would the following have been said: “The bonds of unreal imagination are completely eliminated through the realization of emptiness”?

original: rus sbal gyi sbus 'ching ba'i bya ba byed pa dang / ri bong gi rva mngon sum du rtogs pa dang / yongs su bsal bar byed nus par sus mthong ste /🔽de nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos ni yod @31a * //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi sbus 'ching ba'i bya ba byed pa dang / ri bong gi rva mngon sum du rtogs pa dang / yongs su bsal bar byed nus par sus mthong ste / de nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos ni yod @31a * //
translated: Who has ever seen the hole of a tortoise or the horn of a rabbit function as a bond, or who has ever seen the realization of the horn of a rabbit or the hole of a tortoise be something that can be eliminated?

original: la sems las logs shig na yul yod par yongs su bzung bde dag ni med bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: la sems las logs shig na yul yod par yongs su bzung bde dag ni med bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should understand that although the phenomena of mind and mental factors exist, the objects that are held to exist separately from the mind do not exist.

original: zhib tu bshad pa ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no zhe'o //🔽sde snod gsum pa dag gis bshad pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: zhib tu bshad pa ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no zhe'o // sde snod gsum pa dag gis bshad pa las 'byung ba /
translated: The detailed explanation is like that which occurs in that text.🔽The three scriptural collections explain that the three turnings of the wheel of dharma

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum po de yang ;
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum po de yang ;
translated: occurred as follows.

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya lhag tsam lon pa na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya lhag tsam lon pa na /
translated: More than one hundred years after the Buddha passed into nirvāṇa,

original: sde pa nyi shu'i slob dpon rnams so so nas rang gi rig pas chos kyi 'khor lo dang po'i rnam par bshad pa dag byas so //
analyzed: sde pa nyi shu'i slob dpon rnams so so nas rang gi rig pas chos kyi 'khor lo dang po'i rnam par bshad pa dag byas so //
translated: The masters of the twenty schools each explained the first wheel of Dharma according to their own understanding.

original: de nas sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas lo nyis brgya lon pa'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' klu sgrub kyis mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas lo nyis brgya lon pa'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' klu sgrub kyis mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas /
translated: Then, two hundred years after the Buddha passed into nirvāṇa, the bodhisattva Nāgārjuna, relying on the Perfection of Wisdom sūtras,

original: bstan bcos rnams mdzad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams mdzad de /
translated: composed treatises.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / dbu ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / dbu ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom, the Middle Way, and so on.

original: de dag las rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid spangs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: de dag las rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid spangs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul rab tu bstan to //
translated: In those, he taught the mode of non-entityness by refuting the imagined nature.

original: de nas 'phags pa'i lha la sogs pas gzhung de yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa'i lha la sogs pas gzhung de yang dag par blangs te /
translated: Then Āryadeva and so on took up those texts

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing spel to //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing spel to //
translated: and spread them by passing them from one to another.

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i lo dgu brgya lon pa na byang chub sems dpa' byams pas mdo sde dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i lo dgu brgya lon pa na byang chub sems dpa' byams pas mdo sde dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa la brten nas /
translated: Nine hundred years after the Buddha passed into nirvana, the bodhisattva Maitreya, on the basis of the sutra the Definitive Explanation of the Profound Thought,🔽

original: bstan bcos mdzad de 'di lta ste /🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad de 'di lta ste / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nine hundred years after the Buddha’s parinirvāṇa, the bodhisattva Maitreya composed treatises such as the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention and the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes.🔽 Relying on those,

original: slob dpon thogs med dang dbyig gnyen gyis gzhung de yang dag par blangs nas rab tu spel te /
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med dang dbyig gnyen gyis gzhung de yang dag par blangs nas rab tu spel te /
translated: the masters Asaṅga and Vasubandhu took up those texts and spread them.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ro gcig pas stong pa dang yod par smra bas de dag la rtsod par gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos ro gcig pas stong pa dang yod par smra bas de dag la rtsod par gyur pa med do //
translated: At that time, there was no dispute between those who propounded emptiness and those who propounded existence because the Buddha’s teachings had a single taste.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon nye ba'i 'od na re /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon nye ba'i 'od na re /
translated: Therefore, the master Udayanāśraya said,

original: lo stong gi mdun rol du ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ro gcig go //
analyzed: lo stong gi mdun rol du ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ro gcig go //
translated: “For a thousand years after the Buddha’s passing, the Buddha’s teachings had a single taste.”

original: de tshun chad nas ni dran pa dang shes rab khad kyis 'gags pas stong pa dang yod pa'i rtsod par smra ba rnams 'jig rten na rgyas par gyur to zhes bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: de tshun chad nas ni dran pa dang shes rab khad kyis 'gags pas stong pa dang yod pa'i rtsod par smra ba rnams 'jig rten na rgyas par gyur to zhes bshad do zhe'o //
translated: Since then, memory and wisdom have gradually ceased, and the disputes about emptiness and existence have spread in the world.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtsod par gyur pa rnam par bshad pa yang /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtsod par gyur pa rnam par bshad pa yang /
translated: Here, the disputes of the bodhisattvas are explained

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab shin tu zab bas de dag phan tshun brag ca lta bu'i tshul du sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu @31b bstan pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab shin tu zab bas de dag phan tshun brag ca lta bu'i tshul du sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu @31b bstan pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to show that they are like echoes, mutually teaching the Buddha’s Dharma through the extremely profound scriptures of the Tathāgata.

original: mu stegs grangs can dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par grol ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs grangs can dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par grol ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Tīrthika Sāṃkhya also teaches that the Tathāgata is a bodhisattva liberated from all afflictions.

original: skyes bu chen po gnyis nang gi chos kyi gang zag shes rab dang dbang bo shin tu rno ba rang gis 'phags pa'i gsung rab dang 'grel par mi mdzad pa dang lta ci smos te de lta bas na de dag gis de ltar bshad pa yang /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po gnyis nang gi chos kyi gang zag shes rab dang dbang bo shin tu rno ba rang gis 'phags pa'i gsung rab dang 'grel par mi mdzad pa dang lta ci smos te de lta bas na de dag gis de ltar bshad pa yang /
translated: The second type of great being is a person of the inner Dharma. He has extremely sharp wisdom and faculties. He does not need to rely on the scriptures and commentaries of the noble ones.🔽

original: bstan pa rgya cher spel pa'i phyir yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa rgya cher spel pa'i phyir yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The two kinds of great beings are persons who are internal with respect to the Dharma. They are of extremely sharp faculties. They do not compose treatises on the scriptures and commentaries of the noble ones. How much less would they compose treatises on the scriptures of the tīrthikas! Therefore, you should understand that their explanations are for the sake of propagating the teachings.

original: mdo sde 'di nad tha dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gzhung las ni bden pa gnyis dang ngo bo nyid gsum dang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nad tha dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gzhung las ni bden pa gnyis dang ngo bo nyid gsum dang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhung ngo //
translated: The treatise that sets forth the two truths, the three natures, śamatha, vipaśyanā, and so on is the scripture that follows from the different illnesses.

original: sde tha dad bas rab tu phye ba'i gzhung las ni mtshungs pa med pa rnam pa gsum brjod par bya ba'i gzhung du ston to //
analyzed: sde tha dad bas rab tu phye ba'i gzhung las ni mtshungs pa med pa rnam pa gsum brjod par bya ba'i gzhung du ston to //
translated: The treatise that distinguishes the different classes of scriptures sets forth the scripture that is to be explained as the three kinds of unequaled scriptures.

original: dus kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'i gzhung las ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi dbang du mdzad nas rnam par bshad pa'i gzhung las ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'i gzhung yin no //
translated: The treatise that explains the scriptures from the perspective of time is the scripture that teaches the definitive meaning.

original: de la gsum pa gnas dang gang gi ched du gsungs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gsum pa gnas dang gang gi ched du gsungs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The third part of the treatise is called “The Place and Purpose of the Teaching.” It has two sections:

original: bstan pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / bstan pa gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / bstan pa gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the place of the teaching and the purpose of the teaching.

original: bstan pa'i gnas bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'i gnas bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The place of the teaching is as follows.

original: 'phags pa'i gsung rab la sgo mang du yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gsung rab la sgo mang du yod mod kyi /
translated: Although the scriptures of the noble ones have many doors,

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: if they are summarized,

original: sde snod gsum dang sde snod gnyis dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: sde snod gsum dang sde snod gnyis dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: they are the three scriptural collections, the two scriptural collections, and the twelve branches of scripture.

original: de la sde snod gsum zhes bya ba yang dang po ni mdo sde'i sde snod de /
analyzed: de la sde snod gsum zhes bya ba yang dang po ni mdo sde'i sde snod de /
translated: The three scriptural collections are as follows. The first is the scriptural collection of sutra.

original: s'u tra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs nas mthun pa'i mdo sde zhes 'dren te /
analyzed: s'u tra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs nas mthun pa'i mdo sde zhes 'dren te /
translated: If one derives it from the term sutra, it is called “harmonious sutra.”

original: mthun pa'i rigs pa dang / sems can mos pa dang 'tsham par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i rigs pa dang / sems can mos pa dang 'tsham par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is harmonious with the reasoning and the dispositions of sentient beings.

original: mdo zhes bya ba ni brgyus pa dang bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: mdo zhes bya ba ni brgyus pa dang bsdus pa ste /
translated: Sutra means “continuous” and “collected.”

original: don rnams brgyus shing sems can bsdus pas don 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mdo sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don rnams brgyus shing sems can bsdus pas don 'di gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mdo sde zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “piṭaka” is also used because it contains the meaning and attracts sentient beings, since it possesses these two meanings.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dul ba'i sde snod de lus dang ngag gi las mi dge ba yan lag bdun 'dul bar byed pa 'am /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dul ba'i sde snod de lus dang ngag gi las mi dge ba yan lag bdun 'dul bar byed pa 'am /
translated: The second is the Vinaya Piṭaka, because it subdues the seven types of unwholesome actions of body and speech.

original: yang na las rnam pa gsum 'dul zhing mi dge ba las log pa'i phyir 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na las rnam pa gsum 'dul zhing mi dge ba las log pa'i phyir 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or it is called “Vinaya” because it subdues the three types of actions and turns one away from unwholesome actions.

original: gsum pa ni chos mngon pa'i sde snod de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni chos mngon pa'i sde snod de /
translated: The third is the Abhidharma Piṭaka,

original: 'dis yul mngon du byed pa dang 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis yul mngon du byed pa dang 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to perceive objects and the results of actions.

original: ma mo zhes kyang bya ste /🔽shes rab @32a * //
analyzed: ma mo zhes kyang bya ste / shes rab @32a * //
translated: It is also called “mātṛkā”

original: kyi rtsa ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi rtsa ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates the root of wisdom.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum po thams cad kyis yongs su shes bar bya ba'i don sdud cing sbed pas na sde snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum po thams cad kyis yongs su shes bar bya ba'i don sdud cing sbed pas na sde snod ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called “piṭaka” because it collects and conceals the meaning that is to be fully understood in all three aspects.

original: de la sde snod gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sde snod gsum po de dag nyid la theg pa 'og ma dang gong ma'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la sde snod gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sde snod gsum po de dag nyid la theg pa 'og ma dang gong ma'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The two scriptural collections are so called because these three scriptural collections are divided into the lower and higher vehicles.

original: des na sde snod gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na sde snod gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are two scriptural collections:

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod do //
translated: the śrāvaka scriptural collection and the bodhisattva scriptural collection.

original: sde snod rnam pa 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas mdo 'di nyid las rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: sde snod rnam pa 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas mdo 'di nyid las rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //
translated: The characteristics of these two scriptural collections are extensively distinguished in this very sūtra below.

original: de la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve branches of scripture are as follows:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: the sūtra collection, the geya collection, the vyākaraṇa collection, the gāthā collection, the udāna collection, the nidāna collection, the avadāna collection, the itivṛttaka collection, the jātaka collection, the vaipulya collection, the adbhūtadharma collection, and the upadeśa collection.

original: skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde rnams te /
analyzed: skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde rnams te /
translated: The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas rgya cher rnam par 'byed do //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa rang gcig gi gsung rab de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas rgya cher rnam par 'byed do // de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa rang gcig gi gsung rab de dag kyang /
translated: The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.🔽The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.

original: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams so so nag bshad pa mi mthun pas chos kyi kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa gcig ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams so so nag bshad pa mi mthun pas chos kyi kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa gcig ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.

original: gsung gcig go zhes zer te /🔽la shi ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsung gcig go zhes zer te / la shi ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.

original: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /🔽yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bshad de /🔽tham bu chim lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di lta ste / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes bshad de / tham bu chim lta bu'o //
translated: The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.

original: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.🔽The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Discipline.🔽The word of the Discipline is the Vinaya, the other twelve divisions of the canon are the word of the Teaching.🔽The word of the Teaching is the Sūtras, the other twelve

original: ji ltar slob dpon sde snod gsum pa hyan tsang gis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa la brten nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / nges pa'i don zhes bya ba gong du bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon sde snod gsum pa hyan tsang gis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa la brten nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / nges pa'i don zhes bya ba gong du bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the master Tripiṭaka Master Yānjīng, relying on the noble Unraveling the Intent and so forth, explained the four noble truths, the absence of characteristics, and the definitive meaning as mentioned above.

original: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste dang po ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste dang po ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say the teaching is of four kinds: The first is the teaching of the four noble truths, such as

original: lung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung la sogs pa'o //
translated: the sūtras and so forth.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'i bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'i bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the teaching of the absence of characteristics, such as

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: the Perfection of Wisdom sūtras.

original: gsum pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa @32b ste ;
analyzed: gsum pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa @32b ste ;
translated: The third is the teaching of the characteristics of phenomena,

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as the noble Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra and so forth.

original: bzhi pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bstan pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the teaching of the Yogācāra,

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as the noble Buddhâvataṃsaka Sūtra and so forth.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa ni 'di skad du /
translated: The master Bhūyasena says:

original: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa lnga'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig bstan pa ni rnam pa lnga'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: The teaching is fivefold.

original: dang po ni bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dang po ni bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The first is the four noble truths.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The second is the teaching of the lack of defining characteristics.

original: gsum pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ste /
translated: The third is the teaching of the Yogacarin.

original: don sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning is as explained above.

original: bzhi pa ni shin tu bde ba'i theg pa chen po'i ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni shin tu bde ba'i theg pa chen po'i ste /
translated: The fourth is the vehicle of the Great Vehicle of Ease.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las shin tu bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las shin tu bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the explanation of the result of nirvana of great ease in the noble Nirvana Sutra.

original: lnga pa ni theg pa chen po yongs su srung ba ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni theg pa chen po yongs su srung ba ste /
translated: The fifth is the teaching that protects the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa la sogs pa las lha'i rgyal po rnams yul yongs su bsrung bar bshad pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa la sogs pa las lha'i rgyal po rnams yul yongs su bsrung bar bshad pa lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: It is like the explanation of the protection of the realm of the kings of the gods in the noble Golden Light and so on.

original: slob dpon sde snod gsum pa pas mdo sde 'di ni sde snod rnam pa gnyis las byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: slob dpon sde snod gsum pa pas mdo sde 'di ni sde snod rnam pa gnyis las byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus so //
translated: The master Tripiṭaka master says: This sūtra is included in the two collections, in the bodhisattva collection.

original: sde snod gsum las ni mdo sde'i sde snod kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: sde snod gsum las ni mdo sde'i sde snod kyis bsdus so //
translated: In the three collections, it is included in the sūtra collection.

original: yang na chos mngon pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: yang na chos mngon pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus te /
translated: Or else, it is included in the Abhidharma Piṭaka,

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed cing /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed cing /
translated: because it analyzes the characteristics of the dharmas

original: shes pa rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and generates the wisdom of discernment.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis pa ni gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sdes bsdus so //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis pa ni gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sdes bsdus so //
translated: The twelve branches of the scriptures are included in the Vaibhāṣika Piṭaka.

original: yang na mdo'i sdes bsdus par blta'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na mdo'i sdes bsdus par blta'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Or else, it is said that they are seen to be included in the Sūtra Piṭaka.

original: de la bstan pa gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bstan pa gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the purpose for which it was taught is also twofold:

original: gsung rab thams cad kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa spyir bstan pa dang / mdo sde 'di nyid kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rab thams cad kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa spyir bstan pa dang / mdo sde 'di nyid kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the general purpose for which all the scriptures were taught, and the purpose for which this very sūtra was taught.

original: gsung rab thams cad kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa yang tshad med mod kyi /
analyzed: gsung rab thams cad kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa yang tshad med mod kyi /
translated: Although the purpose for which all the scriptures were taught is immeasurable,

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi kho na'o //
translated: in brief, there are only four types.

original: de la dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold:

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dag go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dag go //
translated: those who are not destined for nirvana and those who are destined for nirvana.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dag ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dag ni /
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, “Those who are destined for nirvana

original: sa bon yongs su tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon yongs su tshang ba yin no //
translated: have complete seeds.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag ni byang chub sems dpa' gsum gyi sa bon med pa yin no zhes bstan to //🔽gnyis pa @33a * //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag ni byang chub sems dpa' gsum gyi sa bon med pa yin no zhes bstan to // gnyis pa @33a * //
