translated: Those who are not destined for nirvana lack the seeds of the three kinds of bodhisattvas.”

original: ni kha cig las rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ni kha cig las rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad de /
translated: The second is explained in some sources as being of three kinds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the group destined for rightness, the group destined for wrongness, and the indeterminate group.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The commentary to the Mahāyāna Sūtrālaṃkāra says, “The group destined for rightness is

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can dag go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can dag go //
translated: those who are destined for nirvana.

original: log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi chos can ma yin pa dag go zhes bshad do //
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi chos can ma yin pa dag go zhes bshad do //
translated: The third is the group definitely destined for error, who are not destined for nirvana.🔽The fourth is the group not destined, who are neither destined for nirvana nor for error.

original: gsum pa ni kha cig las rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni kha cig las rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Some say that there are four types,

original: ji ltar legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: as the Sutra on the Exposition of the Good Qualities of the Buddha says:

original: 'dul bar bya ba'i sems can ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: 'dul bar bya ba'i sems can ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four types of sentient beings to be trained:

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can dag nyan thos kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag rang sangs rgyas kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag sangs rgyas kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can dag nyan thos kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag rang sangs rgyas kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag sangs rgyas kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur pa dang /
translated: those who are the śrāvaka type and will attain the śrāvaka path; those who are the pratyekabuddha type and will attain the pratyekabuddha path; those who are the buddha type and will attain the buddha path;

original: lha dang mi'i rigs can dang lha dang mi'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i rigs can dang lha dang mi'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: and those who are the type of gods and humans and will attain the happiness of gods and humans.

original: bstan bcos yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Treatise on the Compendium of Abhidharma also explains in accordance with this.

original: gsum pa gang zag de dag yongs su smin par bya ba dang / mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi yod do //🔽nyan thos kyi rigs can dag ni nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni bla na med pa'i theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gsum pa gang zag de dag yongs su smin par bya ba dang / mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi yod do // nyan thos kyi rigs can dag ni nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni bla na med pa'i theg pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: In brief, there are four types.

original: rigs med pa dag ni bde 'gro'i lam gyis yongs su smin par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs med pa dag ni bde 'gro'i lam gyis yongs su smin par bya ba ste /
translated: Those of the sravaka lineage are brought to full maturation by the sravaka vehicle, those of the pratyekabuddha lineage are brought to full maturation by the pratyekabuddha vehicle, those of the buddha lineage are brought to full maturation by the unsurpassed vehicle, and those without lineage are brought to full maturation by the path of the happy destinies.

original: 'di ltar gang zag bzhi po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos bzhi po 'di dag gis yongs su smin par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag bzhi po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos bzhi po 'di dag gis yongs su smin par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, those four types of persons are brought to full maturation by the Tathagata and the bodhisattvas through these four dharmas.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang bstan bcos yongs su 'dzin pa las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang bstan bcos yongs su 'dzin pa las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: This is also explained in accord with the Yogacarabhumi in the section on the full maturation of the treatise.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can dag ni theg pa gsum gyi rigs can las gud na med de /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can dag ni theg pa gsum gyi rigs can las gud na med de /
translated: Those of unfixed potential are not separate from those of the three potentials.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma bshad do //
translated: They are not explained separately because they are included in the bodhisattva potential.

original: bzhi pa ni kha cig las rnam pa lnga'o zhes bshad de /🔽@33b 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni kha cig las rnam pa lnga'o zhes bshad de / @33b 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth is explained in some sources as fivefold.

original: snga ma bzhi'i steng du yang rigs ma nges pa bsnan na rigs rnam pa lngar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhi'i steng du yang rigs ma nges pa bsnan na rigs rnam pa lngar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the above four plus the unfixed potential, making five potentials.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Laṅkā Sutra declares:

original: rigs ni rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five kinds of potential:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs can dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i rigs can dang / theg pa ma nges pa'i rigs dang / rigs med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs can dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i rigs can dang / theg pa ma nges pa'i rigs dang / rigs med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: those with the śrāvaka vehicle potential, those with the pratyekabuddha vehicle potential, those with the bodhisattva vehicle potential, those with the unfixed vehicle potential, and those without potential.

original: gal te theg pa gsum gyi sa bon ma tshang ba la rigs med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te theg pa gsum gyi sa bon ma tshang ba la rigs med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Those who lack the seeds of the three vehicles are called those without potential.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'i rigs med pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las gsungs pa'i rigs med pa ste /
translated: The noble Sutra on Entering Lanka speaks of the absence of potential.

original: ji ltar brda sprod cing rnam par bshad par byas te /
analyzed: ji ltar brda sprod cing rnam par bshad par byas te /
translated: How is this to be interpreted?🔽The sutra itself, in four chapters,

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid bam po bzhir byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid bam po bzhir byas pa las /
translated: says:

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The great bodhisattva Mañjuśrī asked the Bhagavat,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di la gtan du mya ngan las mi 'da' ba gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di la gtan du mya ngan las mi 'da' ba gang lags /
translated: “Bhagavat, who is it that does not pass into complete nirvāṇa?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat replied,

original: blo gros chen po 'dod chen pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'dod chen pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there are two kinds of those with great desires.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'dod chen pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'dod chen pa nyid do //
translated: There are bodhisattvas with great desires and there are those with the desires of ordinary beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chen pa ni chos thams cad gzod ma nas mya ngan las 'das par shes nas gtan du mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chen pa ni chos thams cad gzod ma nas mya ngan las 'das par shes nas gtan du mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Among them, bodhisattvas with great desires, knowing that all phenomena are primordially in nirvāṇa, do not pass into complete nirvāṇa.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pa'i 'dod chen pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pa'i 'dod chen pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not have the desires of those who have abandoned all roots of virtue.

original: blo gros chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pa'i 'dod chen pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brgya la gal te dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: blo gros chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pa'i 'dod chen pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brgya la gal te dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro ;
translated: “Mahāmati, even the extremely greedy who have abandoned all roots of virtue may, by the blessing of the Tathāgata, at some point generate roots of virtue.

original: ; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathāgatas do not abandon any sentient being.”

original: de ltar de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chen pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chen pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the extremely greedy bodhisattvas do not attain nirvāṇa.”

original: rigs med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rigs med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who lack the lineage are of two types:

original: dus kyi mtha' la ltos pa dang / gtan du ba'o //
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' la ltos pa dang / gtan du ba'o //
translated: those who depend on the end of time and those who are permanent.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras says, “Those who will not attain nirvāṇa are of two types:

original: dus kyi mtha' la ltos pa dang / gtan du ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' la ltos pa dang / gtan du ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: those who depend on the end of time and those who are permanent.”

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ni dang po las dgongs te @34a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ni dang po las dgongs te @34a * //
translated: The noble Sūtra on Entering Lanka is intended for the first.

original: gsungs la / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las phyi ma la bsams te bstan pa ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gsungs la / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las phyi ma la bsams te bstan pa ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: But the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra teaches the latter, and there is no contradiction.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las rigs can rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las rigs can rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /
translated: Moreover, the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra distinguishes two kinds of lineages.

original: dang po ni dge pa'i rtsa ba spangs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni dge pa'i rtsa ba spangs pa ste /
translated: The first is the lineage that has abandoned the roots of goodness.

original: de dus kyi mtha' la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de dus kyi mtha' la ltos pa'o //
translated: It is said to depend on the end of time.

original: gnyis pa ni gtan du ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gtan du ba ste /
translated: The second is the eternal lineage.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje can yin par bstan pas /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje can yin par bstan pas /
translated: It is said to be the compassionate bodhisattva.

original: mdo sde'i rgyan las gtan du rigs med par bshad pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde'i rgyan las gtan du rigs med par bshad pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not like the statement in the Ornament of the Scriptures of the Great Vehicle that there is no eternal lineage.

original: rigs nges pa'i theg pa gnyis po de dag lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa'i tshe /🔽sems can yin nam /
analyzed: rigs nges pa'i theg pa gnyis po de dag lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa'i tshe / sems can yin nam /
translated: When these two vehicles of definite lineage enter the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder,🔽are they sentient beings or not?

original: 'on te sems can ma yin pa zhes brjod /
analyzed: 'on te sems can ma yin pa zhes brjod /
translated: Are they sentient beings or not?

original: sems can gyis bsdus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyis bsdus pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not included among sentient beings,

original: mngon sum gyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the consciousness of the five sense organs.

original: gal te de lta na 'on ni sems can 'grib pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'on ni sems can 'grib pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then sentient beings would have the fault of decreasing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thog ma med pa'i phyir ni 'phel ba med la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i phyir ni 'phel ba med la /
translated: Because there is no beginning, there is no increase.

original: tha ma med pa'i phyir ni 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: tha ma med pa'i phyir ni 'grib pa med do //
translated: Because there is no end, there is no decrease.

original: gal te 'phel ba yod par gyur na ni 'grib pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'phel ba yod par gyur na ni 'grib pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were increase, there would also be decrease.

original: gal te 'grib pa yod na ci'i phyir mdo las sems can thams cad ni 'phel ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: gal te 'grib pa yod na ci'i phyir mdo las sems can thams cad ni 'phel ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa'o zhes gsungs /
translated: If there were decrease, why did the sutra state, “All sentient beings are without increase and without decrease”?🔽If you previously said that there is increase and decrease, then you should be refuted later.

original: sngar 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod do zhes smras na ni phyis gdod klan kar bya ba yin na yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa zhes brjod pa ni bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa yod de /
analyzed: sngar 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod do zhes smras na ni phyis gdod klan kar bya ba yin na yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa zhes brjod pa ni bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa yod de /
translated: However, the statement “increase and decrease” has two explanations.

original: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa la sogs pas so so'i gzhung rnams la brten nas mu rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa la sogs pas so so'i gzhung rnams la brten nas mu rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
translated: The first is that masters such as Parśva state that there are four possibilities based on their individual texts.

original: dang po ni thog ma yod la tha ma med par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni thog ma yod la tha ma med par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The first is the assertion that the world has a beginning but not an end.

original: ji ltar 'dul ba phyogs lnga pa'i gzhung las mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba phyogs lnga pa'i gzhung las mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the explanation in the Five Part Vinaya that the world is not a dharma subject to nirvana.

original: gnyis pa ni thog ma med pa dang tha ma yod par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thog ma med pa dang tha ma yod par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The second is the assertion that the world has no beginning but does have an end.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde tshang mar byed pa sde pa'i gzhung lta bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde tshang mar byed pa sde pa'i gzhung lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the explanation in the Sarvastivada scriptures and the Sammitiya scriptures.

original: gsum pa ni thog ma dang tha ma yod par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni thog ma dang tha ma yod par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The third is the assertion that the world has a beginning and an end.

original: 'dul ba phyogs lnga pa'i sde pa dag mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba phyogs lnga pa'i sde pa dag mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the explanation in the Five Part Vinaya that the world is a dharma subject to nirvana.

original: bzhi pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med par @34b 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med par @34b 'dod pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the assertion that the world has neither a beginning nor an end.

original: mdo sde tshad mar byed pa'i sde pa'i gzhung gi mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i gzhung las sems can thams cad ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mdo sde tshad mar byed pa'i sde pa'i gzhung gi mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i gzhung las sems can thams cad ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: The scriptures of the school that accepts the sutras as valid teach that the dharmin is not nirvana, and the scriptures of the Mahayana teach that all sentient beings are without beginning and end.

original: de lta bas na gzhung dag la ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod pa'i skyon yod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhung dag la ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa yod pa'i skyon yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, there is the fault of increase and decrease in those scriptures.

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i skyon med do //
translated: But when applied to the scriptures of the Mahayana, there is no fault of increase and decrease.

original: yang na theg pa chung du du'i gzhung gis mu dang po bkol ba la'o //
analyzed: yang na theg pa chung du du'i gzhung gis mu dang po bkol ba la'o //
translated: Or else, the scriptures of the Hinayana apply the first alternative.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon hyan tsang gis theg pa chung du'i gzhung la brten nas bshad pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon hyan tsang gis theg pa chung du'i gzhung la brten nas bshad pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The second is the meaning explained by the Acarya Hasangadhara based on the scriptures of the Hinayana, as explained above.

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhung la brten nas ni mu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhung la brten nas ni mu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Based on the scriptures of the Mahayana, there are two alternatives.

original: dang po ni thog ma med pa la tha ma yod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po ni thog ma med pa la tha ma yod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is that which has no beginning but does have an end.

original: rigs nges pa'i theg pa pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rigs nges pa'i theg pa pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two kinds of persons who are definite in lineage.

original: gnyis pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second kind are those who are indefinite in lineage.

original: rigs med pa'i sems can dang / gzhan rigs nges pa dang / rigs nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: rigs med pa'i sems can dang / gzhan rigs nges pa dang / rigs nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: They are sentient beings who lack the lineage, those who are definite in another lineage, and those who are definite in the lineage of bodhisattvas.

original: mdo'i sde las 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med par gsungs pa ni don gyi ngo bo nyid la dgongs te /
analyzed: mdo'i sde las 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med par gsungs pa ni don gyi ngo bo nyid la dgongs te /
translated: The statement in the sutras that there is no increase or decrease is intended in terms of the nature of reality.

original: bstan pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //🔽bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na de dag las 'di ltar skyon rnam pa lngas rigs yod pa dang med pa'i sems can rnam par gzhag par bsgrubs la /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir nyes pa med do // bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na de dag las 'di ltar skyon rnam pa lngas rigs yod pa dang med pa'i sems can rnam par gzhag par bsgrubs la /
translated: There is no fault in teaching that.🔽If this is applied to the Yogācāra Levels and its commentary, it proves that sentient beings are classified as having or lacking the lineage on the basis of five faults.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i bstan bcos las ni 'di ltar skyon rnam pa lngas rigs med pa'i sems can rnam par gzhag par sgrub na ji ltar brda sprod cing rnam par bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i bstan bcos las ni 'di ltar skyon rnam pa lngas rigs med pa'i sems can rnam par gzhag par sgrub na ji ltar brda sprod cing rnam par bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: But if it is applied to the treatise Teaching the Nature of the Buddha, it proves that sentient beings are classified as lacking the lineage on the basis of five faults.

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gis 'di skad du /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gis 'di skad du /
translated: Master Xangzang explains:

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i bstan bcos de las rigs med pa'i rnam pa gsum la sogs pa ston pa de phal cher gzhung dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i bstan bcos de las rigs med pa'i rnam pa gsum la sogs pa ston pa de phal cher gzhung dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The three types of those who lack the lineage and so on taught in the treatise revealing the essence of buddha nature are mostly not in accord with the scriptures.

original: tshad mar bzung du mi rung ngo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: tshad mar bzung du mi rung ngo zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore they are not suitable to be taken as valid.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni rigs lnga bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni rigs lnga bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive differentiation is like that occurring in the teaching of the five lineages.

original: de la mdo sde 'di nyid kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rigs lnga las ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / rigs ma nges pa dag gi phyir gsungs pa @35a * //
analyzed: de la mdo sde 'di nyid kyi gang gi phyir gsungs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rigs lnga las ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / rigs ma nges pa dag gi phyir gsungs pa @35a * //
translated: In this sutra itself, the teaching of why it was taught is that it was taught for bodhisattvas and those of unfixed lineage.

original: yin te / de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las //
analyzed: yin te / de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las //
translated: Therefore the sutra continues:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is profound and subtle.

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung bzhin 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung bzhin 'bab //
translated: All seeds flow in it like a river.

original: bdag tu rtog bar gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog bar gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: If it were thought of as a self, that would be unacceptable.

original: de ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
analyzed: de ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
translated: Therefore I have not taught it to the childish.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na /
translated: There are other ways of classifying the perfections.🔽

original: mdo sde 'di ni rigs rnam pa bzhi'i ched du gsungs pas /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di ni rigs rnam pa bzhi'i ched du gsungs pas /
translated: In other words, this sutra was taught for the four kinds of potential.

original: rigs med pa ma gtogs te /
analyzed: rigs med pa ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for those without potential,

original: 'og nas mdo las rigs nges pa'i theg pa pa gsum dang / rigs ma nges pa'i theg pa ba 'ba' zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og nas mdo las rigs nges pa'i theg pa pa gsum dang / rigs ma nges pa'i theg pa ba 'ba' zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sutra teaches that there are three kinds of potential that are fixed and one kind that is not fixed.

original: gzhan yang theg pa thams cad la gzhol ba dag gi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa thams cad la gzhol ba dag gi phyir /
translated: Moreover, it was taught for those who are oriented to all vehicles.

original: gsum pa nges pa'i don gyi mdo 'di gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: gsum pa nges pa'i don gyi mdo 'di gsungs pa'am /
translated: The third explanation is that this sutra of the ultimate was taught for those of the three fixed potentials and the one unfixed potential.

original: yang na mdo sde 'di ni rigs lnga po thams cad kyi ched du yang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mdo sde 'di ni rigs lnga po thams cad kyi ched du yang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Or else, this sutra was taught for all five potentials,

original: theg pa pa thams cad la rnam par phye ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa pa thams cad la rnam par phye ba myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is classified as being for all vehicles.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang gnyis pa ni yang dag pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang gnyis pa ni yang dag pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Although there are these three explanations, the second is the correct one.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: The section beginning with Thus have I heard teaches the fourth topic, the explanation of the words.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: mdo sde rnam par 'byed pa dang / tshig gi don yang dag par bshad do //
analyzed: mdo sde rnam par 'byed pa dang / tshig gi don yang dag par bshad do //
translated: the analysis of the sutra and the explanation of the words.

original: de la mdo sde rnam par 'byed pa ni mdo sde 'di la dpe rnam pa gnyis bzhugs pas /
analyzed: de la mdo sde rnam par 'byed pa ni mdo sde 'di la dpe rnam pa gnyis bzhugs pas /
translated: The analysis of the sutra is as follows: Since this sutra has two versions,

original: dang po ni dpe rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni dpe rgyas pa ste /
translated: the first is the extensive version,

original: shu lo ka 'bum bzhugs so //
analyzed: shu lo ka 'bum bzhugs so //
translated: which consists of one hundred thousand ślokas.

original: gnyis pa ni bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bsdus pa ste /
translated: The second is the concise version,

original: shu lo ka stong lnga brgya bzhugs te /
analyzed: shu lo ka stong lnga brgya bzhugs te /
translated: which consists of one thousand five hundred ślokas.

original: mdo sde 'di'i dpe bsdus brgya gar la rnam pa gcig las mi bzhugs kyang /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i dpe bsdus brgya gar la rnam pa gcig las mi bzhugs kyang /
translated: Although this sutra has only one version in India,

original: snga phyis bsgyur ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga phyis bsgyur ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: because it was translated at different times,

original: dpe mi mthun pa bzhir gyur te /
analyzed: dpe mi mthun pa bzhir gyur te /
translated: there are four different versions.

original: dang po ni rgya rje song gi tshe /
analyzed: dang po ni rgya rje song gi tshe /
translated: The first was translated by the Indian king🔽.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po yon tan bzang pos mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo zhes bya bar bsgyur ba bam po gnyis bzhugs te /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po yon tan bzang pos mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo zhes bya bar bsgyur ba bam po gnyis bzhugs te /
translated: The Indian abbot Yönten Zangpo translated the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning in two volumes, calling it the Sutra of the Complete Liberation of the Intention.

original: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo 'di'i tha mar byung pa'i le'u gnyis po dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo 'di'i tha mar byung pa'i le'u gnyis po dag nyid yin no //
translated: These are the two chapters that occur at the end of this Sutra Unravelling the Profound Thought.

original: gnyis pa ni rgya rje 'gris phyi ma'i tshe rgya gar mkhan po bo de le'u cis zab mo rnam par grol ba'i mdo zhes bya ba rnams pa gcig bsgyur ba le'u bcu gcig @35b bzhugs te /🔽dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo 'di las don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rgya rje 'gris phyi ma'i tshe rgya gar mkhan po bo de le'u cis zab mo rnam par grol ba'i mdo zhes bya ba rnams pa gcig bsgyur ba le'u bcu gcig @35b bzhugs te / dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo 'di las don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u la /
translated: The second is the Sutra of Complete Liberation of the Profound, translated by the Indian abbot Bodhi in the later period of the Tibetan king Trisong Detsen. It has eleven chapters.

original: le'u bzhir phye ba'i phyir bcu gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: le'u bzhir phye ba'i phyir bcu gcig tu gyur te /
translated: The chapters that teach ultimate truth in this Sutra Unravelling the Profound Thought are divided into four chapters, making eleven.

original: gzhan ni bdun no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdun no //
translated: The other chapters are seven.

original: gsum pa ni rgya rje tshin gyi tshe rgya gar mkhan po yang dag bden pas tshig nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba'i mdo bam po gcig bsgyur ba'i le'u bzhi bzhugs te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rgya rje tshin gyi tshe rgya gar mkhan po yang dag bden pas tshig nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba'i mdo bam po gcig bsgyur ba'i le'u bzhi bzhugs te /
translated: The third is the one chapter of the Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Intention, one fascicle, translated during the time of Emperor Tsin Gi, by the Indian preceptor Yangdag Dendepa.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u la rnam pa bzhi phye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u la rnam pa bzhi phye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It has four chapters, because it is divided into four parts that teach ultimate truth.

original: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo 'di las 'byung ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ba nyid yin no ;🔽/ bzhi pa ni rgya rje thang gi tshe /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo 'di las 'byung ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ba nyid yin no ; / bzhi pa ni rgya rje thang gi tshe /
translated: It is the chapter that teaches ultimate truth that appears in this Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Profound Intention.

original: slob dpon sde snod gsum pa hyan tsang gis dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba'i mdo bam po lnga pa ste gcig tu bsgyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon sde snod gsum pa hyan tsang gis dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba'i mdo bam po lnga pa ste gcig tu bsgyur te /
translated: The fourth is the Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Profound Intention, five fascicles, translated during the time of Emperor Thang Gi by the preceptor of the Tripiṭaka, Yanzang.

original: le'u brgyad bzhugs so //
analyzed: le'u brgyad bzhugs so //
translated: It has eight chapters.

original: mdo sde 'di'i dpe de ltar mang nyung mi mthun par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i dpe de ltar mang nyung mi mthun par gyur pa yang /
translated: The number of fascicles of this sutra varies.

original: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Intention says:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u nyi tshe 'byung gi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i le'u nyi tshe 'byung gi /
translated: The chapter on the teaching of ultimate truth is complete.🔽The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning mentions two final chapters,🔽but the other six are incomplete. original: mdo sde 'di rgya gar gyi dpe dang po gcig pa yin na ci'i phyir mtshan tha dad pa'i bye brag spyod pa yod pas gsungs pas /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di rgya gar gyi dpe dang po gcig pa yin na ci'i phyir mtshan tha dad pa'i bye brag spyod pa yod pas gsungs pas /
translated: but the other six are incomplete. The Sutra Explaining the Five Aggregates mentions two final chapters,

original: de lta bas na snga ma'i phyogs gnyis yod pa kho na'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na snga ma'i phyogs gnyis yod pa kho na'o zhe'o //
translated: but the other

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there are three explanations,

original: re zhig bshad pa phyi ma la brten nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig bshad pa phyi ma la brten nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: for the time being, we will explain it based on the latter explanation.

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen bstan pa'i phyogs la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen bstan pa'i phyogs la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: In the context of teaching causes and conditions, there are two divisions:

original: yid ches par byed pa'i phyogs dang / gleng bslang ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i phyogs dang / gleng bslang ba'i phyogs so //
translated: the context of generating confidence and the context of introduction.

original: phyogs 'di gnyis la bye brag yod pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di gnyis la bye brag yod pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: There are also three general categories of differences between these two contexts.

original: @36a * // dang po ni ming tha dad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @36a * // dang po ni ming tha dad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: First, the different names are as follows:

original: yid ches par byed pa dang / gleng bslang ba'i gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa dang / gleng bslang ba'i gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: the context of generating confidence and the context of the introduction.

original: thun mong gi gleng gzhi dang mthun pa yin pa'i gleng gzhi zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: thun mong gi gleng gzhi dang mthun pa yin pa'i gleng gzhi zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the common context because it is in accord with the common context.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes kyang bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes kyang bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas /
translated: It is called thus have I heard and so on because

original: gzhan dag yid ches pa bskyed pas yid ches par byed pa'i gling gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag yid ches pa bskyed pas yid ches par byed pa'i gling gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: it generates confidence in others.

original: mdo kun las mthun par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo kun las mthun par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it occurs in all the sūtras in a similar way,

original: thun mong gi gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the common nidāna.

original: 'od zer gtong ba la sogs pas yang dag pa'i gzhung nyid gleng slong bar byed pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: 'od zer gtong ba la sogs pas yang dag pa'i gzhung nyid gleng slong bar byed pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because it causes the correct text to be recited by emitting light rays and so on,

original: gleng bslang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the nidāna of recitation.

original: mdo sde'i rjes su so so nas ming mthun pas thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde'i rjes su so so nas ming mthun pas thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is similar to the sūtra in name, it is called the uncommon nidāna.

original: gnyis pa ni dus tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dus tha dad pa ste /
translated: The second is a different time,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gleng bslang ba ni mdo sde'i mdun rol gyi gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gleng bslang ba ni mdo sde'i mdun rol gyi gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: because the Tathāgata’s nidāna is called the nidāna before the sūtra,

original: kun dga' bos gsol ba btab pa ni mdo sde'i 'og gi gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //🔽gleng gzhi de gnyis gsungs pa'i dus kyi bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol ba btab pa ni mdo sde'i 'og gi gleng gzhi zhes bya'o // gleng gzhi de gnyis gsungs pa'i dus kyi bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and Ānanda’s request is called the nidāna after the sūtra.

original: gsum pa ni gang zag tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang zag tha dad pa ste /
translated: The third is a different person,

original: dang po de bzhin gshegs pa'i gleng gzhi ni mdo sde las /
analyzed: dang po de bzhin gshegs pa'i gleng gzhi ni mdo sde las /
translated: because the first, the Tathāgata’s nidāna, is stated in the sūtras as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gleng bslang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gleng bslang ba'o //
translated: The Tathāgata’s recitation.

original: gnyis pa kun dga' bo'i gleng gzhi ni kun dga' bos gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa kun dga' bo'i gleng gzhi ni kun dga' bos gsol ba btab nas /
translated: The second, the introduction of Ananda, is that Ananda made a request

original: gleng gzhi 'di gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi 'di gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: and this introduction was spoken.

original: mdo sde 'di dang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa yid ches par byed pa nyid kyang gleng bslang ba ni med de yid ches par byed pa la don gyis gleng ba zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa yid ches par byed pa nyid kyang gleng bslang ba ni med de yid ches par byed pa la don gyis gleng ba zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: This sutra and the Buddha Land Sutra and so on are also not introductions that inspire confidence, but it is not contradictory to explain that they are introductions by implication that inspire confidence.

original: de la yid ches par byed pa la yang don rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: de la yid ches par byed pa la yang don rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: In that, there are three topics that inspire confidence.

original: dngos po mang nyung rnam par 'byed pa dang / dngos po bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa dang / dngos po'i rjes su rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po mang nyung rnam par 'byed pa dang / dngos po bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa dang / dngos po'i rjes su rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of many and few topics, the teaching of the intention of the explanation of the topics, and the explanation that differentiates in accordance with the topics.

original: dngos po mang nyung rnam par 'byed pa la yang rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: dngos po mang nyung rnam par 'byed pa la yang rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: The differentiation of many and few topics is also explained in three parts.

original: dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas /
analyzed: dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas /
translated: First, Master Samudramegha says:

original: mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i brjed byang byas pa las /
analyzed: mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i brjed byang byas pa las /
translated: In the notes on the perfection of wisdom sutra,

original: dngos po rnam pa bdun du phye ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa bdun du phye ste /
translated: The subject matter is divided into seven topics.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni thos pa'i chos smos pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni thos pa'i chos smos pa ste /
translated: Here it is said that the Dharma that is heard is mentioned.

original: mdo sde sde gcig @36b gi yi ge dang / don la nges pa kho nar yid ches par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde sde gcig @36b gi yi ge dang / don la nges pa kho nar yid ches par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the letter and the meaning of the one class of sutra, which is the Dharma that is heard.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni don nges par nus pa'i gang zag bstan pa dang / kun dga' bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni don nges par nus pa'i gang zag bstan pa dang / kun dga' bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “I” indicates the person who is able to understand the meaning, such as Ananda.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni gsung mngon sum du mnos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni gsung mngon sum du mnos pa'o //
translated: The word “heard” means that the teaching was received directly.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i chos de shin tu dus dang mtshan mar gyur par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i chos de shin tu dus dang mtshan mar gyur par bstan pa'o //
translated: The words “at one time” indicate that the Dharma that was heard was at a specific time and place.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i ston pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i ston pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The words “the Blessed One” indicate the teacher of the teaching.

original: rin po che mchog tu 'bar ba la sogs pas ni gsungs pa'i gnas yod par bstan to //
analyzed: rin po che mchog tu 'bar ba la sogs pas ni gsungs pa'i gnas yod par bstan to //
translated: The words “blazing with the splendor of the precious jewel” and so forth indicate the place where the teaching was given.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun chen po tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig pus thos pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun chen po tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig pus thos pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The words “with a great and immeasurable saṅgha of śrāvakas” and so forth indicate that the teaching was not heard alone.

original: dngos po bdun po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na dgos pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po bdun po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na dgos pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
translated: These seven topics are also summarized in four purposes.

original: de la dang po 'di skad ces bya bas ni thos pa'i chos rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang po 'di skad ces bya bas ni thos pa'i chos rab tu bstan to //
translated: The first one, “thus have I heard,” teaches the Dharma that is heard.

original: de'i 'og ma dag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni thos par nus pa'i gang zag rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma dag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni thos par nus pa'i gang zag rnam par 'byed do //
translated: The next one, “at one time,” distinguishes the persons who are able to hear.

original: de'i 'og ma gnyis kyis ni thos pa'i chos de sgrub bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gnyis kyis ni thos pa'i chos de sgrub bar byed do //
translated: The next two establish the Dharma that is heard.

original: tha ma gnyis kyis ni thos pa'i gang zag sgrub par byed do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: tha ma gnyis kyis ni thos pa'i gang zag sgrub par byed do zhes bshad de /
translated: The last two establish the persons who hear.

original: rgya cher ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the notes on the seven topics composed by Master Su­bhūti.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar na de de las gleng gzhi'i phyogs la don rnam pa drug tu phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar na de de las gleng gzhi'i phyogs la don rnam pa drug tu phye nas bstan te /
translated: The second is the six topics taught in the section on the introduction in the Perfection of Wisdom, which is composed by Master Nāgārjuna.

original: yid ches pa dang / thos pa dang / dus dang / bdag po dang / gnas dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa dang / thos pa dang / dus dang / bdag po dang / gnas dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The six perfections are the perfection of the teacher, the perfection of the retinue, the perfection of the time, the perfection of the place, the perfection of the teaching, and the perfection of the faith.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bstan bcos sgrol ma zhes bya ba mdzad pa las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bstan bcos sgrol ma zhes bya ba mdzad pa las kyang /
translated: In the treatise called Tārā composed by the master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: don rnam pa drug tu yong par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa drug tu yong par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “If you ask, ‘How many types of meaning are there?’

original: rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit,

original: san dhi nir mo tsa na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: san dhi nir mo tsa na zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is called Sandhinirmocana.

original: san dhi zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: san dhi zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: Sandhi has three meanings:

original: dang po ni rgya gar yul ba dag dngos po gnyis mtshams sbyor ba la yang sa na dhi zhes 'bod do //
analyzed: dang po ni rgya gar yul ba dag dngos po gnyis mtshams sbyor ba la yang sa na dhi zhes 'bod do //
translated: First, in the Indian country, it is called sandhi when two things are joined.

original: gnyis pa ni rus pa'i tshigs 'brel pa la yang san dhi zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rus pa'i tshigs 'brel pa la yang san dhi zhes zer ro //
translated: Second, it is said that sandhi is the connection of the joints of the bones.

original: gsum pa ni lam zab mo la yang san dhi zhes zer bas /🔽de nas lo ts'a ba rnams so so nas don re @37a * //
analyzed: gsum pa ni lam zab mo la yang san dhi zhes zer bas / de nas lo ts'a ba rnams so so nas don re @37a * //
translated: Third, it is said that sandhi is the profound path.

original: re la brten nas bsgyur ba yin te /
analyzed: re la brten nas bsgyur ba yin te /
translated: Then, each of the translators translated based on one meaning.

original: mdo sde 'di'i mtshan ni yang dag par na dgongs pa zab mo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i mtshan ni yang dag par na dgongs pa zab mo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The name of this sutra is the Profound Intention in Reality.

original: gzhan du na mdo sde 'di ni dpe las mtshan du btags pas tshigs zhes bya ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na mdo sde 'di ni dpe las mtshan du btags pas tshigs zhes bya ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Otherwise, this sutra is called the Gathas because it is named after the example, and it is also called the Sandhi because

original: 'di ltar don gyi tshigs dang / dngos po 'brel ba ji ltar rus pa'i tshigs phan tshun 'brel ba lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don gyi tshigs dang / dngos po 'brel ba ji ltar rus pa'i tshigs phan tshun 'brel ba lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is like a bone joint, with the meaning being the joint and the things being the connection between them.

original: nir mo tsa na zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa la bya ste /
analyzed: nir mo tsa na zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa la bya ste /
translated: Nirmochana means to explain.

original: rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: It means to explain.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon yang dag bden pas tshigs nges par 'grel pa'i mdo'i brjed byang byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon yang dag bden pas tshigs nges par 'grel pa'i mdo'i brjed byang byas pa las /
translated: Therefore, the master Bhadanta Sthiramati, in his notes on the Sandhinirmocana Sutra,

original: nges par 'grel pa ni rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'grel pa ni rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: says, Nirmocana means to explain.

original: tshigs ni sra ba dang mdud pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs ni sra ba dang mdud pa ste /
translated: Gatha means hard and knotted.

original: de la sra ba ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sra ba ni brtan pa'o //
translated: Among them, hard means firm.

original: mdud pa ni 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: mdud pa ni 'ching ba ste /
translated: Knotted means bound.

original: ji ltar shing dang mi'i rus pa'i tshigs dag las sra zhing brten pa'i dngos po dang / mdud pa'i 'ching ba dag yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar shing dang mi'i rus pa'i tshigs dag las sra zhing brten pa'i dngos po dang / mdud pa'i 'ching ba dag yod pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as there are hard and solid things and knots that bind in the joints of wood and human bones,

original: mdo sde 'di las bstan pa'i dgongs pa zab mo yang shin tu rtogs par dka' zhing shin tu dgrol bar dka' bas so so'i skye bo dang spyod pa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtogs shing shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir don 'di sra🔽ba dang mdud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las bstan pa'i dgongs pa zab mo yang shin tu rtogs par dka' zhing shin tu dgrol bar dka' bas so so'i skye bo dang spyod pa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtogs shing shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir don 'di sra ba dang mdud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: so too, the profound intended meaning taught in this sutra is extremely difficult to understand and extremely difficult to unravel, and therefore this meaning is called “hard” and “knots” because it is not to be understood or known by ordinary beings and by bodhisattvas on the first level.

original: mdo sde 'dis 'grol bar mdzad pa'i phyir tshigs nges par 'grel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'dis 'grol bar mdzad pa'i phyir tshigs nges par 'grel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because this sutra unravels them, it is called the definitive commentary on the knots.

original: gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos thams cad las shin tu phra zhing rtogs par dka' ba'i don 'byung ba de dag mdo sde 'dir bsdus nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa chen po'i bstan bcos thams cad las shin tu phra zhing rtogs par dka' ba'i don 'byung ba de dag mdo sde 'dir bsdus nas /
translated: Moreover, the meaning that occurs in all the treatises of the Great Vehicle, which is extremely subtle and difficult to understand, is summarized in this sutra

original: gsal bar rnam par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal bar rnam par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: and because it is clearly explained,

original: mdo sde 'dis tshigs nges par 'grel ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dis tshigs nges par 'grel ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: This sutra is called the definitive commentary on the verses.

original: rgya cher bshad pa ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa ni de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is as found in that very sutra.

original: de la mtshams sbyor ba rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i don so sor 'thor ba rnam par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyor ba rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i don so sor 'thor ba rnam par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therein, the one called the liberation of the connection is so called because it explains the individual scattered meanings of the connection.

original: mtshams sbyor ba rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the sutra of the liberation of the connection.

original: zab mo rnam par dgrol ba zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zab mo rnam par dgrol ba zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The one called the liberation of the profound should be understood in the same way.

original: de ni tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di rnam par bshad ba yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: de ni tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di rnam par bshad ba yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: That is called the correct explanation of the meaning of the words. The explanation of this sutra, in brief, has three types of explanations.

original: kha cig @37b ni mdo sde 'di las phyogs rnam pa lnga yod te /
analyzed: kha cig @37b ni mdo sde 'di las phyogs rnam pa lnga yod te /
translated: Some say that in this sutra there are five topics.

original: dang po ni bstan pa 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen gyi phyogs de /
analyzed: dang po ni bstan pa 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen gyi phyogs de /
translated: The first is the topic of the causes and conditions for the arising of the teaching.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u dang po nyid do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u dang po nyid do //
translated: That is the first chapter on the introduction.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi phyogs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi phyogs te /
translated: The second is the section on the domain of the unequaled.

original: de'i 'og ma le'u bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma le'u bzhi po dag go //
translated: The four chapters that follow are that.

original: gsum pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i spyod pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i spyod pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The third is the section on the practice of the unequaled.

original: de'i 'og ma le'u gnyis po dag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma le'u gnyis po dag go //
translated: The two chapters that follow are that.

original: bzhi pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i 'bras bu'i phyogs te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i 'bras bu'i phyogs te /
translated: The fourth is the section on the result of the unequaled.

original: tha ma'i le'u gcig go //
analyzed: tha ma'i le'u gcig go //
translated: The final chapter is that.

original: lnga pa ni bstan pa bzhin du yang dag par spyod pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: lnga pa ni bstan pa bzhin du yang dag par spyod pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The fifth is the section on the correct practice in accordance with the teaching.

original: mdo sde'i mjug tu mngon par bstod do zhes gsungs pa dag go zhe'o ;
analyzed: mdo sde'i mjug tu mngon par bstod do zhes gsungs pa dag go zhe'o ;
translated: It is the praise at the end of the sutra.

original: ; kha cig ni bstan pa 'di gcig la phyogs rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: ; kha cig ni bstan pa 'di gcig la phyogs rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Some say that this teaching has three aspects in one.

original: dang po ni gleng gzhi'i phyogs te /
analyzed: dang po ni gleng gzhi'i phyogs te /
translated: The first is the section on the nidana.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u dang po nyid do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u dang po nyid do //
translated: The first chapter itself is that.

original: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa'i gzhung nyid kyi phyogs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa'i gzhung nyid kyi phyogs te /
translated: The second is the section on the correct text.

original: le'u phyi ma bdun po dag go //
analyzed: le'u phyi ma bdun po dag go //
translated: The seven later chapters are that.

original: gsum pa ni bstan pa gnas pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni bstan pa gnas pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The third is the section on the duration of the teaching.

original: mdo sde'i mjug tu mngon par bstod do zhes pa dag yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: mdo sde'i mjug tu mngon par bstod do zhes pa dag yin no zhe'o //
translated: and the conclusion of the sutra is the praise.

original: kha cig ni mdo sde 'di gcig la phyogs rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni mdo sde 'di gcig la phyogs rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Some say that this sutra has two parts:

original: dang po ni le'u gcig gis bstan pa 'byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen bstan pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dang po ni le'u gcig gis bstan pa 'byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen bstan pa'i phyogs so //
translated: the first part is the chapter that teaches the causes and conditions for the arising of the teaching,

original: le'u phyi ma bdun ni 'phags pa'i gsung rab yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: le'u phyi ma bdun ni 'phags pa'i gsung rab yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and the seven later chapters are the part that explains the noble teachings.

original: mdo sde'i mjug tu bstan pa bzhin du yang dag par spyod pa gsungs pa yod mod kyi le'u rnams kyi nang na bka' bzhin du yang dag par spyod pa smos pa gcig kho nar ma zad de /
analyzed: mdo sde'i mjug tu bstan pa bzhin du yang dag par spyod pa gsungs pa yod mod kyi le'u rnams kyi nang na bka' bzhin du yang dag par spyod pa smos pa gcig kho nar ma zad de /
translated: Although the correct practice is taught in the conclusion of the sutra, it is not only mentioned once in the chapters as if it were the Buddha's word.

original: sde gcig gi nang du kun la yang bka' bzhin du bstan te /
analyzed: sde gcig gi nang du kun la yang bka' bzhin du bstan te /
translated: It is taught as the Buddha's word in every chapter.

original: de'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las /🔽dang po gsum po dag gis slob ma bstan //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las / dang po gsum po dag gis slob ma bstan //
translated: Therefore, in the verse summary,🔽the first three chapters teach the disciples,

original: 'og ma gsum ni ston pas gsungs par sgrub //
analyzed: 'og ma gsum ni ston pas gsungs par sgrub //
translated: and the three later chapters establish the teacher's teachings.

original: mdo sde gsung rab dag ni thams cad kyis //
analyzed: mdo sde gsung rab dag ni thams cad kyis //
translated: All the sutras and teachings

original: dngos po de dag thams cad de bzhin no //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po de dag thams cad de bzhin no // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: All these things are just so.

original: gsum pa slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa byas pa las ni rnam pa lngar bsdus te /
analyzed: gsum pa slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa byas pa las ni rnam pa lngar bsdus te /
translated: The third, the master Upagupta, in his commentary on the Buddha Land Sutra, summarizes it in five topics:

original: thams cad bdag nyid kyis thos pa dang / mdo sde gsungs pa'i dus /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid kyis thos pa dang / mdo sde gsungs pa'i dus /
translated: the time of hearing it all from the Buddha himself, the time of the sutra’s teaching,🔽the teacher of the teaching, the place of the teaching, and the assembly that heard it.🔽The fourth, the master Paramartha, in his commentary on the Buddha Land Sutra, summarizes it in four topics:

original: gsungs pa'i bdag po dang / gsungs pa'i gnas dang / nyan pa'i 'khor bstan pa @38a * //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i bdag po dang / gsungs pa'i gnas dang / nyan pa'i 'khor bstan pa @38a * // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the teacher, the place, the time, and the assembly.🔽The fifth, the master Vasubandhu, in his commentary on the Buddha Land Sutra, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.

original: de la dngos po bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dngos po bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The sixth, the master Asvabhāva, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:

original: the tshom rnam pa gsum bcad pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom rnam pa gsum bcad pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the teacher and the teaching.🔽The seventh, the master Sthiramati, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.

original: de la the tshom rnam pa gsum bcad pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la the tshom rnam pa gsum bcad pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las 'di skad du /
translated: The eighth, the master Nāgamitra, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.🔽The ninth, the master Śāntarakṣita, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.🔽The tenth, the master Haribhadra, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.🔽The eleventh, the master Kamalaśīla, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.🔽The twelfth, the master Atiśa, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.🔽The thirteenth, the master Abhayākaragupta, in his commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, summarizes it in two topics:🔽the teacher and the teaching.

original: 'dul ba phra mo las dge slong kun dga' bo seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas chos kyi sde snod 'don pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dul ba phra mo las dge slong kun dga' bo seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas chos kyi sde snod 'don pa'i tshe /
translated: In the Vinaya it says that when the monk Ānanda sat on a lion throne and recited the Dharma piṭaka,

original: de'i lus sangs rgyas ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i lus sangs rgyas ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: his body became endowed with the major and minor marks just like the Buddha.

original: seng ge'i khri las babs nas ni snga ma bzhin du gyur pas /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri las babs nas ni snga ma bzhin du gyur pas /
translated: When he got down from the lion throne, he was as before.

original: 'khor rnams mtshan ma de mthong nas the tshom rnam pa gsum skyes par gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor rnams mtshan ma de mthong nas the tshom rnam pa gsum skyes par gyur te /
translated: Seeing this sign, the assembly had three kinds of doubts.

original: ston pa chen po sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa thugs rje'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa las bzhengs nas yang chos zab mo gsung ba ma yin snyam du the tshom za ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin snyam du the tshom za ba dang /
analyzed: ston pa chen po sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa thugs rje'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa las bzhengs nas yang chos zab mo gsung ba ma yin snyam du the tshom za ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin snyam du the tshom za ba dang /
translated: They doubted that the great teacher, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, had risen from nirvāṇa out of compassion and was again teaching the profound Dharma, they doubted that the Tathāgata had not come to this world from another world system,

original: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas gcung yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas gcung yin te /
translated: and they doubted that Ānanda was the Buddha’s younger brother.

original: gcen gyi tsha ba mar 'os pa yin pas lus gyur nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhig ma yin nam snyam du the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: gcen gyi tsha ba mar 'os pa yin pas lus gyur nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhig ma yin nam snyam du the tshom za ba ste /
translated: Since the elder's nephew was worthy of respect, he thought, “Did he transform his body and manifestly attain buddhahood?”

original: the tshom za ba gsum bcad par dgongs pa'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsungs te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba gsum bcad par dgongs pa'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsungs te /
translated: In order to eliminate these three doubts, he said, “Thus have I heard,” and so on.

original: des kun dga' bo nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des kun dga' bo nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos pa yin gyi /
translated: This indicates that he himself directly heard it from the Bhagavan,

original: thugs rje chen pos mya ngan las 'das pa las bzhengs pa ma yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas gshags pa ma yin pa dang / kun dga' bo lus gyur te mngon par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa yang ma yin par bstan to zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos mya ngan las 'das pa las bzhengs pa ma yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas gshags pa ma yin pa dang / kun dga' bo lus gyur te mngon par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa yang ma yin par bstan to zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: that he did not rise from great compassion into nirvana, that he did not go to another world system, and that he did not transform his body and teach as Ananda manifestly attained buddhahood.

original: gang gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las dus dang / phyogs dang gang zag bstan pa ni sems can rnams yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las dus dang / phyogs dang gang zag bstan pa ni sems can rnams yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, it is explained in the commentary to the perfection of wisdom that the teaching of time, direction, and persons is for the purpose of generating confidence in sentient beings.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel @38b pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel @38b pa las ji skad du /
translated: With regard to that, the statement for the purpose of stabilizing the teaching of the Buddha is as it is explained in the commentary to the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe grong khyer rtsva can shing s'a la zung cig gi drung du dbu byang phyogs su bstan te gzims nas mya ngan las 'das par bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe grong khyer rtsva can shing s'a la zung cig gi drung du dbu byang phyogs su bstan te gzims nas mya ngan las 'das par bzhugs so //
translated: When the Bhagavat was in the process of passing into nirvāṇa, he lay down in the city of Kuśinagara between two sāla trees, his head pointing to the north, and he passed into nirvāṇa.

original: de'i tshe kun dga' bo gnyen bshes la sred pa ma spangs 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir sems mya ngan gyi mtshor bying bas rang gis 'byung bar ma nus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun dga' bo gnyen bshes la sred pa ma spangs 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir sems mya ngan gyi mtshor bying bas rang gis 'byung bar ma nus so //
translated: At that time, since Ānanda had not abandoned craving for relatives and had not become free from attachment, his mind sank into a lake of sorrow and he was unable to rise from it on his own.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas kun dga' bo la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas kun dga' bo la smras pa /
translated: Then the venerable Aniruddha said to Ānanda,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sde snod 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni so so'i skya bo bzhin du bdag nyid mya ngan gyi mtshor bying bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sde snod 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni so so'i skya bo bzhin du bdag nyid mya ngan gyi mtshor bying bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right for those who uphold the Buddha’s Dharmapiṭaka to sink into the ocean of sorrow like ordinary people.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni thams cad kyang mi rtag pa yin na ci'i phyir mya ngan byed /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni thams cad kyang mi rtag pa yin na ci'i phyir mya ngan byed /
translated: If all conditioned phenomena are impermanent, why do you grieve?

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das phyag gi chos rnams khyod la gtad na deng khyod mya ngan gyi sa gzir bas yang dag par blangs pa'i dngos po stor bar gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das phyag gi chos rnams khyod la gtad na deng khyod mya ngan gyi sa gzir bas yang dag par blangs pa'i dngos po stor bar gyur to //
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, if you entrust the Dharma to us, today you will be overcome by the earth of sorrow and the state of proper acceptance will be lost.

original: khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu ji ltar rnam 'byor bsgom par bgyi //
analyzed: khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu ji ltar rnam 'byor bsgom par bgyi //
translated: You asked the Blessed One, “After the Blessed One’s nirvāṇa, how should we cultivate spiritual practice?

original: ston pa ni gang gis bgyi /
analyzed: ston pa ni gang gis bgyi /
translated: Who will be our teacher?

original: mos pa can dka' blo mi bde ba dang ji ltar gnas par bgyi /
analyzed: mos pa can dka' blo mi bde ba dang ji ltar gnas par bgyi /
translated: How should we live with those who are faithful, those who are difficult to please, and those who are unhappy?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mdo sde'i mgo bor tshig ji lta bu zhig bzhag par bgyi zhes zhus shig ces smras pa dang / des kyang dngos po de dag bcom ldan 'das la zhus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mdo sde'i mgo bor tshig ji lta bu zhig bzhag par bgyi zhes zhus shig ces smras pa dang / des kyang dngos po de dag bcom ldan 'das la zhus so //
translated: He asked the Blessed One about those things.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Ananda, one should abide in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo ni ston par ltos shig / dge slong mos pa can ni tshangs pa'i smra ba lta bus chad pas gcad do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo ni ston par ltos shig / dge slong mos pa can ni tshangs pa'i smra ba lta bus chad pas gcad do //
translated: Look to the Sutta on Individual Liberation. A monk who is faithful is cut off by the speech of a Brahma-like one.🔽At the beginning of the sutras of the Tathagatas, the words 'Thus have I heard,' and so on, should be placed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi mgor ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyi mgor ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: This is what was said.

original: chos bsdus pa'i mdo dang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las kyang phal cher shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa dang mthun par 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos bsdus pa'i mdo dang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las kyang phal cher shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa dang mthun par 'byung ste /
translated: The Compendium of Dharma Sutra and the Great Nirvana Sutra also for the most part agree with the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //🔽snying rje chen po'i mdo las ni nye bar 'khor gyis kun @39a * //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do // snying rje chen po'i mdo las ni nye bar 'khor gyis kun @39a * //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not cite them here.

original: dga' bo la bcol zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dga' bo la bcol zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Sutra of Great Compassion says that Upali entrusted it to Ananda.

original: de ltar mdo sde dang bstan bcos las bshad pa mi mthun par gyur ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde dang bstan bcos las bshad pa mi mthun par gyur ba yang /
translated: Thus, the explanations in the sutras and treatises are not contradictory.

original: gang zag gnyis kas kyang bcol bas so so nas don re re la brten pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gang zag gnyis kas kyang bcol bas so so nas don re re la brten pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since both individuals entrusted it, each relied on a different meaning, so they are not mutually contradictory.

original: dngos po'i rjes su rnam par phye ste bshad pa yang de la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po bdun las thos par bya ba dang / thos par nus pa dang / gsung mngon sum du ma nos pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gsum dag go //
analyzed: dngos po'i rjes su rnam par phye ste bshad pa yang de la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po bdun las thos par bya ba dang / thos par nus pa dang / gsung mngon sum du ma nos pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gsum dag go //
translated: The explanation that follows the entities is as follows: In the phrase “Thus have I heard,” there are three entities: that which is to be heard, that which is able to hear, and that which is not directly received as speech.

original: don rnam pa drug las ni yid ches pa dang / thos pa'i dngos po gnyis po dag go //
analyzed: don rnam pa drug las ni yid ches pa dang / thos pa'i dngos po gnyis po dag go //
translated: The six topics are the two, confidence and the thing heard.

analyzed: rnam pa lnga las ni thams cad bdag nyid kyis thos pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa spyi'i rnam par bshad pa dang / 'di skad bdag gis thos pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa dang / de dag bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //🔽de la spyi'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The explanation of the words of the sutra is as follows.🔽The

translated: The teachings of the Buddha were transmitted by Ārya Mañjuśrī, Ānanda, and so on, and they said, “In the past, I heard this profound meaning and so on, as stated in the phrase ‘Thus have I heard.’🔽”
