analyzed: rnam par phye ste bshad pa zhes bya ba de yang /
translated: The phrase “explained in detail” also

original: sngar ni 'di skad ces bya ba bshad la phyis ni bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngar ni 'di skad ces bya ba bshad la phyis ni bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: means that the phrase “Thus have I heard” was explained earlier, and the phrase “I heard” will be explained later.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: Among them, the phrase “Thus have I heard” is also explained differently by each.

original: yul 'di pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: yul 'di pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The explanations of the masters of this land are, in brief, of eight types.

original: de la kha cig ni yid ches pa dang mthun par byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni yid ches pa dang mthun par byed pa la brten nas /
translated: Some explain it based on what is consistent with confidence.

original: rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par bshad de /
translated: They explain it as follows.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni yid ches pa dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i tshig ste yang yid ches pa yod na ni tshig dang don gyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni yid ches pa dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i tshig ste yang yid ches pa yod na ni tshig dang don gyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: This is said is a phrase that accords with confidence, for if there is confidence, one engages in the words and their meaning.

original: rjes su 'jug pa yod na ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa yod na ni /
translated: If one engages in them,

original: slob dpon dang slob ma'i tshul gyis lam mngon par 'gyur par 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon dang slob ma'i tshul gyis lam mngon par 'gyur par 'gyur te /
translated: one engages in the path in the manner of a master and disciple.

original: mdo sde yang yid @39b ches pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mdo sde yang yid @39b ches pa ma yin na /
translated: If one has no confidence in the sutra,🔽one does not engage in it.

original: brgyud par mi byed pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba tshig rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: brgyud par mi byed pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba tshig rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Thus, this is said is a phrase that is established.

original: kha cig ni yi ge dang don la brten nas bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni yi ge dang don la brten nas bshad de /
translated: Some explain based on the letters and the meaning.

original: de la yi ge ni 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la yi ge ni 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therein, the letters are this is said,

original: don ni 'di bzhin zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ni 'di bzhin zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the meaning is it is like this.

original: 'di ltar yi ge ni legs pa brjod pas 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur la don ni skyon med pas bzhin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge ni legs pa brjod pas 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur la don ni skyon med pas bzhin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Thus, the letters are said to be this because they are well spoken, and the meaning is said to be like this because it is faultless.

original: kha cig ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob la brten nas bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob la brten nas bshad de /
translated: Some explain based on the ultimate and the conventional.

original: don dam pa kun rdzob dang mi mthun pa med pas 'di zhes brjod la /
analyzed: don dam pa kun rdzob dang mi mthun pa med pas 'di zhes brjod la /
translated: Since the ultimate is not inconsistent with the conventional, it is called this.

original: kun rdzob don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ni bzhin zhes brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ni bzhin zhes brjod do zhe'o //
translated: And since the conventional is consistent with the ultimate, it is called thus.

original: kha cig ni slob ma la brten nas bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni slob ma la brten nas bshad de /
translated: Some explain this in terms of disciples.

original: 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pas bshad pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ni 'di zhes pa la 'dra ba'i de bzhin nyid las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ni de bzhin zhes brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pas bshad pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ni 'di zhes pa la 'dra ba'i de bzhin nyid las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ni de bzhin zhes brjod do zhe'o //
translated: Since the explanations of the noble Ananda and so on are just as the Buddha taught, it is called this, and in order to distinguish it from the suchness of similarity, it is called thus.

original: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas bshad de /
translated: Some explain this in terms of the Tathagata.

original: 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos rnams zlos pa de dag ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'di zhes bstan la /
analyzed: 'phags pa kun dga' bo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos rnams zlos pa de dag ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'di zhes bstan la /
translated: Since the noble Ananda and so on repeat the Dharma taught by the Buddha, it is called this, because it is no different from that taught by past buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du bshad pas yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du bshad pas yang dag pa yin te /
translated: It is correct because it is explained just as the Tathagatas are,

original: log pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshig phyi ma las bzhin zhes bya ba la gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: log pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshig phyi ma las bzhin zhes bya ba la gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: and it is just as it is said in the second line, because it is not false.

original: kha cig ni ston pa dang slob ma la brten nas bshad de /🔽de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni skal pa dang ldan pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni ston pa dang slob ma la brten nas bshad de / de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni skal pa dang ldan pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Some explain that it is based on the teacher and the disciple.🔽Here, this is the phrase that is suitable and appropriate.

original: 'di zhes bya ba dbang po'i rjes su mthun pas mi blang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba dbang po'i rjes su mthun pas mi blang ba yin la /
translated: This is the phrase that is suitable for the faculties, and it is not to be rejected.

original: bzhin zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'i phyir ming du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bzhin zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'i phyir ming du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Just as is said is the phrase that is established as a name because it is faultless.

original: 'di ltar sems can skyon med pas ni skal pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can skyon med pas ni skal pa dang ldan la /
translated: Thus, because sentient beings are faultless, they are suitable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad pas rjes su mthun par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad pas rjes su mthun par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: And because the Tathagatas act in accordance with their inclinations, they are appropriate.

original: brgyud pa dang nyan pa po'i ming la skal ba dang ldan pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: brgyud pa dang nyan pa po'i ming la skal ba dang ldan pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: The words thus have I heard are spoken because the name of the lineage and the listener are called fortunate and compatible.

original: kha cig na re 'di skad ces bya ba ni mdo sde 'di gcig bdag gis ston pa las mngon @40a * //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di skad ces bya ba ni mdo sde 'di gcig bdag gis ston pa las mngon @40a * //
translated: Some say that the words thus have I heard are spoken because this sutra was directly heard by me from the Teacher.

original: sum du thos pas des na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: sum du thos pas des na 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Thus have I heard.

original: kha cig na re 'di skad ces bya ba ni gsung 'di lta bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di skad ces bya ba ni gsung 'di lta bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the words thus have I heard are spoken in order to show that such words as these were spoken by the Tathagata.

original: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The explanations of the Indian masters can also be summarized in three ways.

original: dang po ni slob dpon po de le'u cis slob dpon rdo rje drang srong gis byas pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa'i brjed byang byas pa las /
analyzed: dang po ni slob dpon po de le'u cis slob dpon rdo rje drang srong gis byas pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa'i brjed byang byas pa las /
translated: First, the master Bodhibhadra, in his commentary on the Diamond Cutter Sutra called Notes on the Diamond Cutter, says:

original: kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas te brjod na rnam pa mang du yod mod kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas te brjod na rnam pa mang du yod mod kyi /
translated: If one speaks from the point of view of the conventional, there are many kinds of generation of the Thought.

original: 'dir bsdu na rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: 'dir bsdu na rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: But here, in brief, there are four kinds:

original: sems bskyed pa de bzhin pa dang / gzhan la gdams pa dang / dpe dang rnam par nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de bzhin pa dang / gzhan la gdams pa dang / dpe dang rnam par nges pa'o //
translated: the generation of the Thought as it is, the exhortation of others as it is, the example as it is, and the ascertainment as it is.

original: de la sems bskyed pa de bzhin pa ni bdag nyid 'di snyam du bdag gis de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa de bzhin pa ni bdag nyid 'di snyam du bdag gis de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
translated: The generation of the Thought as it is is like this: One thinks, “I have generated the Thought of Enlightenment in that way,

original: dge ba rnams spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba rnams spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and I will practice the virtues.”

original: gzhan la gdams pa de bzhin pa ni gzhan dag la 'di snyam du khyod kyi 'di bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: gzhan la gdams pa de bzhin pa ni gzhan dag la 'di snyam du khyod kyi 'di bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
translated: The exhortation of others as it is is like this: One exhorts others, “You should generate the Thought of Enlightenment in that way,

original: legs pa'i spyod pa rnam par spyod par bya'o //🔽zhes 'doms bar byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: legs pa'i spyod pa rnam par spyod par bya'o // zhes 'doms bar byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: and you should practice the good conduct.”

original: dpe de bzhin pa ni gang zag 'di gzi byin shin tu rgyas pa ni nyi ma'i 'od bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin pa ni gang zag 'di gzi byin shin tu rgyas pa ni nyi ma'i 'od bzhin no //
translated: The example as it is is like this: One says, “This person’s splendor is very extensive, like the light of the sun.”

original: shes rab zab cing yangs pa ni rgya mtsho bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab zab cing yangs pa ni rgya mtsho bzhin no //
translated: “His wisdom is deep and vast, like the ocean.”

original: byad bzhin sdug pa ni zla ba nya pa bzhin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byad bzhin sdug pa ni zla ba nya pa bzhin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: The face is beautiful like the full moon.

original: rnam par nges pa de bzhin pa ni bdag gis 'di bzhin du mthong ngo thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa de bzhin pa ni bdag gis 'di bzhin du mthong ngo thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The same as the ascertainment is I saw it this way, I heard it this way, and so on.

original: 'dir 'di skad ces bya ba ni bzhi dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad ces bya ba ni bzhi dang sbyar te /
translated: Here, thus have I heard is connected with the four.

original: rnam par nges pa de bzhin pa 'dis ni rab 'byor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa las bstan pa'i tshul thos pa dang / bdag gis 'dir bshad pa 'di las mang nyung dang nor pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par nges pa de bzhin pa 'dis ni rab 'byor gyis de bzhin gshegs pa las bstan pa'i tshul thos pa dang / bdag gis 'dir bshad pa 'di las mang nyung dang nor pa med de /
translated: This shows that Subhuti heard the way the Tathagata taught, and that there is no more or less in this explanation than in what he taught.

original: nges par de kho na bzhin du bshad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nges par de kho na bzhin du bshad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ba gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It shows that it was explained just as it is. Thus, thus have I heard is stated.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon sde snod gsum pa rna rings kyis don rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon sde snod gsum pa rna rings kyis don rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: The second is explained by the master Tripiṭaka Āryaśūra in three ways.

original: dang po ni sangs rgyas kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dang po ni sangs rgyas kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The first is from the perspective of the Buddha.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams @40b kyi gsung la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ni 'di zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams @40b kyi gsung la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ni 'di zhes gsungs la /
translated: Because the speech of the buddhas of the three times is not different, it is said to be this.

original: de ltar gsungs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ni bzhin zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ni bzhin zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is said to be just so, it is said to be thus.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second is from the perspective of the Dharma.

original: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ni 'di zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ni 'di zhes gsungs la /
translated: Because it is the true nature of phenomena, it is said to be this.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i phyir ni bzhin zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i phyir ni bzhin zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is explained just as it is, it is said to be thus.

original: gsum pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbang du byas nas 'phags pa kun dga' bos bshad de /🔽sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ni 'di zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbang du byas nas 'phags pa kun dga' bos bshad de / sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ni 'di zhes gsungs la /
translated: The third is from the perspective of the Saṅgha, explained by the noble Ānanda.🔽Because it is not different from what the Buddha taught, it is said to be this.

original: skyon rnams dang gtan du bral ba'i phyir ni bzhin zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: skyon rnams dang gtan du bral ba'i phyir ni bzhin zhes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is free from faults forever, it is said to be thus.

original: gsum pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'di skad ces bya ba ni rnam par nges pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'di skad ces bya ba ni rnam par nges pa'i don yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the term “determination.”

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: 'di lta ste tshig 'bru dang don to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshig 'bru dang don to //
translated: words and meanings.

original: de la tshig 'bru ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshig 'bru ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: Words are to be expressed.

original: 'phags pa kun dga' bos brjod pa'i tshig 'bru dang / don rnam par nges pa ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun dga' bos brjod pa'i tshig 'bru dang / don rnam par nges pa ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir 'di skad ces bya gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: The words expressed by the noble Ananda and the determination of meanings are explained as “thus have I heard” because they are just as the Buddha taught.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum du thos pa la ni di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum du thos pa la ni di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya la /
translated: Moreover, “thus have I heard” refers to direct hearing.

original: brgyud de thos pa la ni 'di skad thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brgyud de thos pa la ni 'di skad thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “This has been heard” refers to hearing by way of transmission.

original: gzhan yang sde pa rnams kyi brjed byang las /🔽mngon sum du thos pa la ni bdag gis thos pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sde pa rnams kyi brjed byang las / mngon sum du thos pa la ni bdag gis thos pa zhes brjod la /
translated: Moreover, the Vinaya of the sects explains:🔽“Thus have I heard” refers to direct hearing.

original: thos pa gtams pa la ni 'di skad thos pa zhes brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: thos pa gtams pa la ni 'di skad thos pa zhes brjod do zhe'o //
translated: “This has been heard” refers to hearing that is transmitted.

original: bstan bcos rnams las kyang rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams las kyang rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: Also, the treatises explain three types of faith.🔽The first is as follows.

original: dang po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad ces bya ba'i don ni yid ches par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad ces bya ba'i don ni yid ches par byed pa yin te /
translated: The commentary on the perfection of wisdom says, “The meaning of the phrase ‘thus have I heard’ is that it inspires confidence.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgya mtsho chen por yid ches pas 'jug par nus pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgya mtsho chen por yid ches pas 'jug par nus pas /
translated: Thus, because one has confidence in the great ocean of the Buddha’s teachings, one is able to enter it.

original: gang yid ches shing rjes su 'brang ba dag ni dngos po 'di de bzhin no zhes zer la gang yid ma ches pa de dag ni dngos po 'di de lta bu ma yin no zer ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gang yid ches shing rjes su 'brang ba dag ni dngos po 'di de bzhin no zhes zer la gang yid ma ches pa de dag ni dngos po 'di de lta bu ma yin no zer ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Those who have confidence and follow it say, ‘This thing is just like that.’ Those who do not have confidence say, ‘This thing is not like that.’

original: rgya cher ni de nyid las byung pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni de nyid las byung pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is like that found in that text.🔽The second is as follows.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon yon tan byin gyis 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon yon tan byin gyis 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
translated: The master Gunaprabha, in his commentary on the noble perfection of wisdom Diamond Cutter Sutra, says:

original: de la @41a * //
analyzed: de la @41a * //
translated: “In this regard,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di bcom ldan 'das blo mngon sum du gyur pas gsungs pa yin gyis /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di bcom ldan 'das blo mngon sum du gyur pas gsungs pa yin gyis /
translated: The phrase thus have I heard indicates that this sutra was spoken by the Buddha, who directly perceives the object,

original: bdag nyid kyis byas pa ni ma yin par ston to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis byas pa ni ma yin par ston to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and not that it was composed by himself.

original: gsum pa ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las rnam pa bzhir bshad de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las rnam pa bzhir bshad de /
translated: The third is explained in the Arya Buddha-bhumi-vyakhya in four ways.🔽It says there:🔽The phrase thus have I heard engages four topics.

original: de las 'di skad ces bya ba ni don rnam pa bzhi'i rjes su 'jug par de la dpe ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las 'di skad ces bya ba ni don rnam pa bzhi'i rjes su 'jug par de la dpe ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The example is like this:

original: da ltar bshad pa'i tshig 'bru 'di dag gis bdag gis sngon thos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar bshad pa'i tshig 'bru 'di dag gis bdag gis sngon thos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These words that are now being explained are just like those I heard in the past.

original: lung 'bogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The transmission is like this:

original: 'khor rnams la 'di bzhin du bdag gis sngon thos pa rnams nyon cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams la 'di bzhin du bdag gis sngon thos pa rnams nyon cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Listen to the retinue, just as I heard in the past.

original: dris pa rnam par nges pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dris pa rnam par nges pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ascertainment of questions is like this:

original: kha cig 'di skad du khyod kyis de ltar bshad pa'i don 'di nges par sngon thos pa yin nam zhes dris na /
analyzed: kha cig 'di skad du khyod kyis de ltar bshad pa'i don 'di nges par sngon thos pa yin nam zhes dris na /
translated: Some ask, “Did you definitely hear this meaning as you explain it?”

original: de'i phyir lan du 'di bzhin du bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lan du 'di bzhin du bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: So the reply is, “I heard it in this way.”

original: tshig gi lan ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshig gi lan ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reply in words is as follows.

original: yang dag par sdud pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag par sdud pa'i tshe /
translated: When the assembly is gathered together,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams kyis khyod kyis ji ltar thos pa bzhin du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams kyis khyod kyis ji ltar thos pa bzhin du /
translated: the assembly of bodhisattvas requests, “Please explain just as you heard it.”

original: de bzhin du bshad par gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos brgyud pas de dag la gnang ba'i tshig tu de bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bshad par gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos brgyud pas de dag la gnang ba'i tshig tu de bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is the master of ceremonies replies to them, “I will explain it just as it is.”

original: ji ltar bdag gis thos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis thos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Just as I heard it.”

original: don rnam pa 'di bzhi la slob dpon gsum gyis 'di skad du bshad de /
analyzed: don rnam pa 'di bzhi la slob dpon gsum gyis 'di skad du bshad de /
translated: These four topics are explained in this way by the three masters.

original: kha cig ni rnam pa bzhi las tha ma dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam pa bzhi las tha ma dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
translated: Some apply the last of the four topics.

original: kha cig ni rnam pa gnyis dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam pa gnyis dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
translated: Some apply the two topics.

original: kha cig ni don bzhi char dang sbyar te bshad par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni don bzhi char dang sbyar te bshad par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some say that it should be explained as applying to all four meanings.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: de la bdag gis thos pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa yang chos brgyud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang kun dga' bo la sogs pa phung po lnga'i lus la btags pa tsam du bdag ces rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la bdag gis thos pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa yang chos brgyud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang kun dga' bo la sogs pa phung po lnga'i lus la btags pa tsam du bdag ces rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In this context, the explanation of “I have heard” is that the bodhisattva who has received the lineage of the Dharma and Ananda and so on posit a mere designation of self with regard to the body of five aggregates.

original: rna ba'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the ear faculty consciousness,

original: bshad pa nyan pa'i phyir bdag gis thos pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: bshad pa nyan pa'i phyir bdag gis thos pa zhes brjod de /
translated: they say “I have heard” in order to listen to the explanation.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las bdag ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las bdag ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore the commentary to the Buddha Land Sutra says:

original: phung po rnams la kun rdzob tu btags @41b pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams la kun rdzob tu btags @41b pa'o //
translated: “Self” means the aggregates designated conventionally.

original: thos pa ni 'di lta ste rna ba'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed nas nyan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni 'di lta ste rna ba'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed nas nyan par byed pa'o //
translated: “Heard” means having generated the ear faculty consciousness, one listens.

original: gzhan spangs pas spyi'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos la gang zag med do //
analyzed: gzhan spangs pas spyi'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo // sangs rgyas kyi chos la gang zag med do //
translated: But in order to avoid the error of attributing to the Buddha the faults of the listeners, the author says, I have heard.

original: bdag med do zhes gsungs na ci'i phyir mdo sde kun las bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs /
analyzed: bdag med do zhes gsungs na ci'i phyir mdo sde kun las bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs /
translated: The Buddha's teaching is devoid of the person and devoid of self. Why then does the author say, I have heard in all the sūtras?

original: don 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: don 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: This point has been explained in various ways.

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi gzhung gis ni grub pa'i mtha' rnam pa bzhi la brten nas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi gzhung gis ni grub pa'i mtha' rnam pa bzhi la brten nas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba rnam par bshad de /
translated: The master Nāgārjuna explains the phrase I have heard in terms of four philosophical positions:

original: grub pa'i mtha' rnam pa bzhi'i don kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ji skad du /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' rnam pa bzhi'i don kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ji skad du /
translated: The meaning of the four philosophical positions is explained in the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas as follows:

original: dang po ni 'jig rten pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'jig rten pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The first is the philosophical position of the world.

original: ji ltar phung po rnams kyi gang zag mngon par 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba yang 'jig rten pa'i phyir ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phung po rnams kyi gang zag mngon par 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba yang 'jig rten pa'i phyir ni yod pa'o //
translated: Just as the person is established by the aggregates, so too the phrase I have heard exists for the world.

original: don dam pa'i phyir ni med pa'o zhes bshad pa dag go //
analyzed: don dam pa'i phyir ni med pa'o zhes bshad pa dag go //
translated: and “it does not exist ultimately.”

original: gnyis pa ni gang zag so so'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang zag so so'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The second is the philosophy of the individual,

original: gang zag gi sems kyi spyod pa so sor brtags nas /
analyzed: gang zag gi sems kyi spyod pa so sor brtags nas /
translated: for when the mind of the individual is examined,

original: chos bshad pa'i tshe dngos po gcig la kha cig ni nyan par byed /
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i tshe dngos po gcig la kha cig ni nyan par byed /
translated: when the Dharma is explained, some listen to one thing,🔽and some do not listen to another.

original: kha cig ni nyan par mi byed pas chad par lta ba dag gi phyir ni mtshams sbyor ba'i sems can yod do zhes bshad la /
analyzed: kha cig ni nyan par mi byed pas chad par lta ba dag gi phyir ni mtshams sbyor ba'i sems can yod do zhes bshad la /
translated: Therefore, for the sake of those who have the view of annihilation, it is explained that there are sentient beings who are reborn.

original: rtag par lta ba dag gi phyir ni gang zag med do zhes bshad pa dag go //
analyzed: rtag par lta ba dag gi phyir ni gang zag med do zhes bshad pa dag go //
translated: For the sake of those who have the view of permanence, it is explained that there is no person.

original: gsum pa ni gnyen po grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyen po grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The third is the philosophy of the antidote,

original: ji ltar mi gtsang bar bsgom pa 'dod chags spyod pa dag gis ni gnyen por gyur pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi gtsang bar bsgom pa 'dod chags spyod pa dag gis ni gnyen por gyur pa la /
translated: for example, the meditation on impurity is an antidote for those who are engaged in desire,

original: zhe sdang spyod pa dag la ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa dag la ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: but it is not for those who are engaged in hatred.

original: bzhi pa ni don dam pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni don dam pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The fourth is the philosophy of the ultimate,

original: 'di ltar chos rnams kyi nge kho na'i mtshan nyid ni tshig gi lam chad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams kyi nge kho na'i mtshan nyid ni tshig gi lam chad pa /
translated: for example, the intrinsic identity of things is beyond the path of words,

original: sems kyi spyod yul 'gags pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul 'gags pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The sphere of activity of mind is stopped.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
translated: And in a verse:

original: thams cad yang dag nyid yin te //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag nyid yin te //
translated: Everything is real,

original: yang dag nyid kyang yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag nyid kyang yang dag min //
translated: and reality is not real.

original: thams cad yang dag ma yin pa'ang min //🔽de ni chos rnams yang dag mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag ma yin pa'ang min // de ni chos rnams yang dag mtshan nyid do //
translated: Everything is not unreal,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //🔽yang bstan bcos de nyid las gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni gsum yod de /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // yang bstan bcos de nyid las gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni gsum yod de /
translated: and that is the real characteristic of things.

original: 'di lta ste log @42a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste log @42a * //
translated: And in that treatise itself, it is said that there are three other worldly conventions:🔽error,

original: ba dang nga rgyal dang ming ngo //
analyzed: ba dang nga rgyal dang ming ngo //
translated: pride, and name.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The self is said to be the second.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las btags pa tsam du bdag ces bshad do zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las btags pa tsam du bdag ces bshad do zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This is the explanation in the Yogācāra bhūmi that the self is a mere designation.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos las /🔽de kho na'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bdag kyang ma yin /
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos las / de kho na'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bdag kyang ma yin /
translated: In the Madhyamaka treatise,

original: bdag med pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan nam zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan nam zhe na /
translated: it is taught that the self is neither real nor unreal from the point of view of reality.

original: ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bdag med do zhes bshad la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bdag med do zhes bshad la /
translated: Why is it that the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says, “There is no self”?

original: 'gal ba med de 'jig rten pa'i grub pa'i dbang du byas na ni bdag ces bshad la /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de 'jig rten pa'i grub pa'i dbang du byas na ni bdag ces bshad la /
translated: There is no contradiction, for in terms of mundane establishment, it explains “self,”

original: don dam pa'i dbang du byas na ni bdag med ces bshad do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbang du byas na ni bdag med ces bshad do //
translated: and in terms of ultimate establishment, it explains “no self.”

original: gang zag so so'i dbang du byas na ni bdag yod pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag so so'i dbang du byas na ni bdag yod pa'am /
translated: In terms of individual persons, it explains “self exists” or

original: yang na bdag med pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang na bdag med pa zhes bshad de /
translated: “self does not exist.”

original: 'dzin pa gnyi ga cig car yongs su bsal ba'i phyir bdag kyang ma yin bdag med pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang bstan te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyi ga cig car yongs su bsal ba'i phyir bdag kyang ma yin bdag med pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang bstan te /
translated: In order to eliminate both of these apprehensions simultaneously, it also teaches, “It is not that there is a self, nor is it that there is no self.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: Therefore the Treatise on the Middle Way says:🔽Sometimes the buddhas teach self,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis res 'ga' bdag / res 'ga' bdag med par yang gsungs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis res 'ga' bdag / res 'ga' bdag med par yang gsungs //
translated: sometimes they teach selflessness.

original: chos rnams yang dag mtshan nyid la //
analyzed: chos rnams yang dag mtshan nyid la //
translated: In the true characteristics of phenomena

original: bdag med bdag med pa'ang min //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag med bdag med pa'ang min // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: there is neither self nor nonself.

original: gal te phyogs gcig tu bdag tu 'dzin pa la ltos na ni /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig tu bdag tu 'dzin pa la ltos na ni /
translated: If it is in relation to the apprehension of one extreme,

original: bdag med par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med par bshad pa ste /
translated: and the explanation of selflessness.

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: These are the characteristics of reality.

original: gal te 'dzin pa cig car yongs su bsal na ni bdag kyang ma yin bdag med pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin pa cig car yongs su bsal na ni bdag kyang ma yin bdag med pa yang ma yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: If one completely eliminates the grasping of self and selflessness at the same time, then the teaching of neither self nor selflessness

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: is the characteristic of reality.

original: so so nas don re re'i dbang du byed pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: so so nas don re re'i dbang du byed pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since each is made in terms of a particular meaning, there is no contradiction.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo dang sbyar nas /
translated: In the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: yang dag pa'i bdag nyid ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bdag nyid ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: the nature of reality is said to be the characteristic of reality.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung dang sbyar na don rnam pa bzhi'i phyir phung po rnams la btags pa tsam du bdag ces brjod pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung dang sbyar na don rnam pa bzhi'i phyir phung po rnams la btags pa tsam du bdag ces brjod pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the treatises of Ārya Maitreya, it says, “For four reasons, the self is said to be a mere designation in the aggregates.”

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag rgyu rnam pa bzhi'i phyir 'du byed rnams la sems can dogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag rgyu rnam pa bzhi'i phyir 'du byed rnams la sems can dogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore the Bodhisattvabhūmi says, “Bhagavān, for four reasons, the aggregates should be known as the designation of sentient beings.”

original: tha snyad la bde bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba dang / sems can gyi dngos @42b po rnam pa thams cad kyis med do snyam pa'i skrag pa bsal ba dang / bdag dang pha rol la tha snyad kyis yon tan dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: tha snyad la bde bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba dang / sems can gyi dngos @42b po rnam pa thams cad kyis med do snyam pa'i skrag pa bsal ba dang / bdag dang pha rol la tha snyad kyis yon tan dang ldan pa dang /
translated: It is for the sake of ease in conventional expression, for being in harmony with the world, for dispelling the fear of sentient beings who think that all things are nonexistent and for praising oneself and others through conventional expressions of their good qualities.

original: skyon dang ldan par yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: skyon dang ldan par yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is for the sake of ease in conventional expression, for the sake of being in harmony with the world, for the sake of dispelling the fear of sentient beings who think that all things are nonexistent and for the sake of generating conviction in the qualities and faults of self and others through conventional expressions.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / chos mngon pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / chos mngon pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The treatise explanation of phenomena Abhidharmakośabhāṣya explains in accordance with this.

original: de la thos pa zhes bya ba ni so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /🔽thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni rna bas thos pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de la thos pa zhes bya ba ni so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te / thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni rna bas thos pa yin gyis /
translated: With regard to what is called hearing, the explanations of each are not the same.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The scriptures of the Vaibhāṣikas explain that it is heard by the ear but not by consciousness.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis rnam par shes pas thos kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis rnam par shes pas thos kyis /
translated: Master Dharmashri explains that it is heard by consciousness but not by the ear.
